original: smros zhes pa lnga pa'i gsum pa ba yig 'od dpag med dang bzhi pa'i gsum pad yig rin chen dbang po dang / gnyis ka dbyer med pas 'phrog par byed cing bsdus zhes pa'o //🔽mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin bdag med mngon dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo de smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smros zhes pa lnga pa'i gsum pa ba yig 'od dpag med dang bzhi pa'i gsum pad yig rin chen dbang po dang / gnyis ka dbyer med pas 'phrog par byed cing bsdus zhes pa'o // mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin bdag med mngon dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo de smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: The five is the third of the fifth [i.e. ra], the syllable va, and the third of the fourth [i.e. la] is the syllable da, the syllable of Ratnasaṃbhavam, and the two inseparable are taken and collected.🔽 The nature of signlessness is the reality of the truth of no-self.

original: tha snyad byed cing kun rdzob kyi bden pa mngon par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: tha snyad byed cing kun rdzob kyi bden pa mngon par gsal bar byed do //
translated: That is spoken, that is, expressed, and the conventional truth is made manifest.

original: che ge mos khyer ro zhes pa aa'i ming can gyis bsdus zhes ba'o ;
analyzed: che ge mos khyer ro zhes pa aa'i ming can gyis bsdus zhes ba'o ;
translated: The taken is the one called A, that is, collected.

original: ; rdo rje skar ma zhes pa badzra ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: ; rdo rje skar ma zhes pa badzra ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The vajra star is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: dzyo ya ti: zhes pa de 'od gsal ba a'a: yig gi rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: dzyo ya ti: zhes pa de 'od gsal ba a'a: yig gi rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: The illuminated is the seal of the syllable A, luminosity.

original: 'od gsal ba nye bar bstan nas sgrib pa lnga rab tu spang ba'i phyir sngags lnga gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba nye bar bstan nas sgrib pa lnga rab tu spang ba'i phyir sngags lnga gsungs pa /
translated: Having taught luminosity, in order to completely abandon the five obscurations, he taught the five mantras.

original: be du y'a be du y'a zhes brjod ana lag ldan 'bros pas 'gyur ro zhes bya ba don rab tu gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: be du y'a be du y'a zhes brjod ana lag ldan 'bros pas 'gyur ro zhes bya ba don rab tu gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The meaning of bedhu bedhu is very clear: the one with a hand runs away.

original: yang na be du y'a ba'i sgras lnga ba'i gsum pa 'od dpag med de /
analyzed: yang na be du y'a ba'i sgras lnga ba'i gsum pa 'od dpag med de /
translated: Or else, the word bedhu is the third of the fifth [m], Amitābha.

original: de yang ae yig gis brgyan pa bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ae yig gis brgyan pa bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'o //
translated: That is also adorned with the letter e, inseparable from Nairātmya.

original: da yi sgras gsum pa'i gsum pa mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: da yi sgras gsum pa'i gsum pa mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: The word day is the third of the third [i], Akṣobhya.

original: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'o //
translated: That is also adorned with Vajraḍāka.

original: ya'i sgras g-yung mo ste de @91a * //
analyzed: ya'i sgras g-yung mo ste de @91a * //
translated: The word yā is the Yoginī.

original: yang rdo rje mas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: yang rdo rje mas brgyan pa'o //
translated: That is also adorned with Vajra.

original: de ltar gnyis ka dbyer med pa bden pa gnyis te drug ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ka dbyer med pa bden pa gnyis te drug ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Thus, the two inseparable are the two truths, and the sixth is Vajradhara.

original: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i lag ldan 'bros par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i lag ldan 'bros par 'gyur te /
translated: The one with a hand of such an essence runs away.

original: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye ba'i nyon mongs pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhes pa gti mug rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye ba'i nyon mongs pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhes pa gti mug rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The afflictions of the divisions of the sense organs and objects are stopped.

original: ma mm'a ma mm'a zhes brjod na stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don rab tu gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ma mm'a ma mm'a zhes brjod na stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don rab tu gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The meaning of mama mama mama mama is clearly this: the tiger flees.

original: yang na / ma'i sgras mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na / ma'i sgras mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Or else, the word ma is Akṣobhya,

original: de yang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: and that is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: ma don yod grub pa rlung gi khams gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ma don yod grub pa rlung gi khams gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Ma means Amoghasiddhi, the wind element, and Vajra Speech.

original: ma mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ma mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: Mama means Akṣobhya, the mind vajra.

original: aa rdo rje ma gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje ste /
analyzed: aa rdo rje ma gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje ste /
translated: A means Vajradhātvīśvarī, the aggregate of form, and Vajra Body.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ma mm'a zhes bya ba'i don gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ma mm'a zhes bya ba'i don gsal ba'o //
translated: The meaning of mama mama is the indivisibility of the three vajras, Vajradhara.

original: de yang lan gnyis bzlas pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de yang lan gnyis bzlas pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: The repetition twice is the sixth, Vajradhara.

original: 'dis stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa stag lta bur 'tshe ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir gti mug la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa stag lta bur 'tshe ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir gti mug la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the tiger flees, because the suffering that is generated by the harm that is like a tiger is delusion and so on.

original: de de nyid du thim pa'i phyir nga rgyal rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de de nyid du thim pa'i phyir nga rgyal rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is purified pride because it dissolves into reality.

original: ti lli y'a te lli y'a zhes brjod na bse 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ti lli y'a te lli y'a zhes brjod na bse 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: If one says tillyā tillyā, the rhinoceros flees.

original: yang na ta'i sgras pa zhi ba'i dang po don yod grub pa mtha' dag gcig tu sdom pa'i n'a da ste /
analyzed: yang na ta'i sgras pa zhi ba'i dang po don yod grub pa mtha' dag gcig tu sdom pa'i n'a da ste /
translated: The word ti is the nada of Amoghasiddhi, the first of the peaceful deities, all combined into one.

original: de yang / ae yig gis brgyan pa'i phyir thugs rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang / ae yig gis brgyan pa'i phyir thugs rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: And that is the pure mind, because it is adorned with the syllable e.

original: lli zhes pa sa dang rnam par snang mdzad dbyer med pa'i phyir la yig gnyis rab tu sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: lli zhes pa sa dang rnam par snang mdzad dbyer med pa'i phyir la yig gnyis rab tu sbyar ba ste /
translated: The word llyā is the indivisibility of the earth and Vairocana. The two syllables la and ya are applied.

original: de yang / ai yig dang bcas pa ni tsher ba'i phung po goo r'is brgyan pa sku rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de yang / ai yig dang bcas pa ni tsher ba'i phung po goo r'is brgyan pa sku rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: And that is the pure body, because it is adorned with the aggregate of taste, Gaurī, along with the syllable i.

original: gti mug la gti mug nang du thim pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug la gti mug nang du thim pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because delusion dissolves into delusion.

original: ya'i sgras / yang /
analyzed: ya'i sgras / yang /
translated: The word yā is

original: rlung dang g-yung mo dang gsung rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rlung dang g-yung mo dang gsung rdo rje ste /
translated: the wind and Jñānī, and the speech vajra.

original: aa bdag med mas brgyan pa thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med mas brgyan pa thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with a, the Nairātmya, and blessed by the mind vajra.

original: aa rdo rje ma gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin sku rdo rje'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: aa rdo rje ma gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin sku rdo rje'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The syllable a is the nature of the aggregate of form, the essence of the vajra of body.🔽 🔽Oṃ is the syllable of the vajra of body.

original: 'di ni rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gsung rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa rdo rje gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gsung rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa rdo rje gsum rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of speech, which is the nature of the three vajras.

original: de nyid rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo'i ye shes dang de'i rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo'i ye shes dang de'i rang bzhin gyis /
translated: By that very [mantra], the knowledge which is the nature of the three vajras, and by its nature,

original: te lli y'a te lli y'a zhes lan gnyis brjod pa las rdo rje gsum dbyer med pas bse 'bros par 'gyur te /
analyzed: te lli y'a te lli y'a zhes lan gnyis brjod pa las rdo rje gsum dbyer med pas bse 'bros par 'gyur te /
translated: by saying teli ya teli ya twice, the rhinoceros escapes, because the three vajras are inseparable.

original: 'di yang 'tshe ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang 'tshe ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: This also is suffering, because it generates suffering by harm itself.

original: nga rgyal la sogs pa rnam par dag pas 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal la sogs pa rnam par dag pas 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: By the purity of pride and so forth, attachment is purified.

original: ai li mi li phu: phu: zhes brjod na sprul 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i @91b don gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ai li mi li phu: phu: zhes brjod na sprul 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i @91b don gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: By saying ili mili phu phu, the snake escapes. The meaning is clear.

original: yang na / ai li mi li zhes pa /
analyzed: yang na / ai li mi li zhes pa /
translated: Or, ili mili means

original: ai'i sgras goo r'i tshor ba'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid kyis me'i khams so //
analyzed: ai'i sgras goo r'i tshor ba'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid kyis me'i khams so //
translated: the syllable i is the fire element by the nature of the aggregate of feeling of Gaurī.

original: li'i sgras me'i khams dang ldan pa'i sa'i khams so //
analyzed: li'i sgras me'i khams dang ldan pa'i sa'i khams so //
translated: The syllable li is the earth element endowed with the fire element.

original: mi zhes pa me'i khams dang bcas pa'i rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: mi zhes pa me'i khams dang bcas pa'i rlung gi khams so //
translated: The word man is the wind element along with the fire element.

original: li zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa me'i khams la sogs pa ste khams gsum po so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje gsum dang dbyer med pa dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: li zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa me'i khams la sogs pa ste khams gsum po so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje gsum dang dbyer med pa dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The word lee is the indivisible wisdom and means, the fire element, and so on, the three elements, each with the nature of the three vajras, the nature of the mandala of nine indivisible three vajras.

original: de'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni /
translated: Its mantra is:

original: phu: phu: zhes pa lnga pa'i gnyis pa rin chen dbang po ste /
analyzed: phu: phu: zhes pa lnga pa'i gnyis pa rin chen dbang po ste /
translated: PHUH PHUH. The second of the fifth [PHUH] is Ratnasaṃbha-va.

original: de rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'i phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'i phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: Since he is adorned by Vajraḍāka, he is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: slar yang len gnyis bzlas pa ni bzhi pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dga' ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: slar yang len gnyis bzlas pa ni bzhi pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dga' ba bzhi'o //
translated: Again, the repetition of the two [PHUH] is the four joys by the nature of the fourth.

original: des sprul 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes sprul lta bur dug gi bdag nyid kyi phyir sprul te /
analyzed: des sprul 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes sprul lta bur dug gi bdag nyid kyi phyir sprul te /
translated: By that, the emanation flees. Emanation is like a snake, because of the nature of poison.

original: yul rnams rnam par ma dag pa dang dug lta bu'o //
analyzed: yul rnams rnam par ma dag pa dang dug lta bu'o //
translated: The objects are impure and like poison.

original: de rnams shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag ba ye shes kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag ba ye shes kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Since those are extremely pure, they are purified by the nature of the dharmadhatu, and since they become the nature of pristine consciousness,

original: sprul 'bros par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sprul 'bros par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: the dog flees.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pas phrag dog rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pas phrag dog rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since attachment and so on are pure, envy is pure.

original: nor skyong 'dul ba'i phyag gis lag pa bstan na /
analyzed: nor skyong 'dul ba'i phyag gis lag pa bstan na /
translated: If the hand of the protector of wealth is shown,🔽the dog flees.

original: khyi 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: khyi 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The meaning of that is clear.

original: yang na dha'i sgras bzhi pa'i bzhi pa don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dha'i sgras bzhi pa'i bzhi pa don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the syllable dhi is the fourth of the fourth, Amoghasiddhi.

original: na'i sgras bzhi pa'i lnga pa mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: na'i sgras bzhi pa'i lnga pa mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: The syllable ni is the fifth of the fourth, Akshobhya.

original: de gnyis skyong ba ni dbye ba med pas gnas pa'i phyir nor skyong rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis skyong ba ni dbye ba med pas gnas pa'i phyir nor skyong rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Since those two are protected, they are indivisible and remain.

original: de 'dul ba'i phyag ye shes lnga'i ngo bos lhag pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin can gyi ye shes bstan cing 'od gsal bar gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dul ba'i phyag ye shes lnga'i ngo bos lhag pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin can gyi ye shes bstan cing 'od gsal bar gyur par bya'o //
translated: The hand that tames that is the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: des khyi 'bros par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des khyi 'bros par 'gyur te /
translated: The dog flees by that.

original: khyi dang 'dra ba bems po dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par 'dod pa rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa ni khyi'o //
analyzed: khyi dang 'dra ba bems po dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par 'dod pa rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa ni khyi'o //
translated: The aspect of consciousness, which is the nature of the apprehended and apprehender, is the dog.🔽The escape is the attainment of luminosity through the aspect of the realization of the absence of matter.

original: 'bros pa ni bems po med par rtogs pa'i rnam pas 'od gsal ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa phrag dog la sogs pa rnam par dag pas zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'bros pa ni bems po med par rtogs pa'i rnam pas 'od gsal ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa phrag dog la sogs pa rnam par dag pas zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, hatred is purified by the purification of envy and so on.

original: ma rig pa zos pa'i phung po lnga dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can lag ldan la sogs pa lnga po 'di rnams te /
analyzed: ma rig pa zos pa'i phung po lnga dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can lag ldan la sogs pa lnga po 'di rnams te /
translated: These five, the five beginning with the crocodile, have the nature of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions of the five aggregates that are consumed by ignorance.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: They are the nature of the completely pure dharmadhātu.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: @92a * // gsungs pa /
analyzed: @92a * // gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rdo rje ma dang / dkar mo dang / chu ma dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang / bdag med ma rnams /
analyzed: rdo rje ma dang / dkar mo dang / chu ma dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang / bdag med ma rnams /
translated: Vajrī, Gaurī, Caurī, Vajravārāhī, and Nairātmyā,

original: sa spyod ma dang / mkha' spyod ma'i rnal 'byor las rengs pa la sogs pa rnams bya'o //
analyzed: sa spyod ma dang / mkha' spyod ma'i rnal 'byor las rengs pa la sogs pa rnams bya'o //
translated: One should perform the yoga of the earth-walking and sky-walking yoginīs, and so on, for paralysis and so forth.

original: brtul zhugs can zhes pa 'di rnams kyang gzugs dang / tshor pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can zhes pa 'di rnams kyang gzugs dang / tshor pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The “one who is disciplined” is the purity of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gsungs pa / sa spyod ma dang / mkha' spyod ma'i rnal 'byor las zhes pa /
analyzed: gsungs pa / sa spyod ma dang / mkha' spyod ma'i rnal 'byor las zhes pa /
translated: It is said: “from the yoga of the earth-walking and sky-walking yoginīs.”

original: sa spyod ma srid pa'i rang bzhin dang / mkha' spyod ma mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dbyer med pas rnal 'byor te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa spyod ma srid pa'i rang bzhin dang / mkha' spyod ma mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dbyer med pas rnal 'byor te de'i phyir ro //
translated: The earth-walking yoginī is the nature of existence, and the sky-walking yoginī is the nature of nirvana. The yoga is their inseparability.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /🔽srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa / srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽These great compassionate ones

original: snying rje chen po 'di dag gnas //
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'di dag gnas //
translated: abide in the nature of existence and peace.

original: zhes pa'o // rgyu 'dis shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid las rengs pa la sogs pa phyi rol du grags pa dang nang gi bdag nyid can g-yo ba med pa la sogs pa rnams bya zhing bsgrubs te brtul zhugs can rdo rje 'chang gi ngo
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rgyu 'dis shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid las rengs pa la sogs pa phyi rol du grags pa dang nang gi bdag nyid can g-yo ba med pa la sogs pa rnams bya zhing bsgrubs te brtul zhugs can rdo rje 'chang gi ngo
translated: By this cause, the yogī/nī should perform and accomplish the external fame of paralysis, etc., and the internal nature of immobility, etc., from the nature of the utterly pure dharmadhātu.

original: bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the essence of Vajradhara” is🔽explained.

original: 'dis ci gsungs na /
analyzed: 'dis ci gsungs na /
translated: What is said by this?

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin /
translated: The nature of the five gnoses,

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa yul dang dbang po rnam par dag pa rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa yul dang dbang po rnam par dag pa rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa /
translated: the indivisible three vajras of pure objects and sense powers, inseparable method and wisdom,

original: bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: the maṇḍala of Nairātmya,

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid can /
translated: the nature of the utterly pure dharmadhātu,

original: drug pa rdo rje 'chang dang tha dad med pa /
analyzed: drug pa rdo rje 'chang dang tha dad med pa /
translated: inseparable from the sixth buddha, Vajradhara,

original: bzhi pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: the nature of the fourth,

original: rang byung gi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gsungs so //
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gsungs so //
translated: the nature of self-originated gnosis, is explained.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor yang 'di dang 'dra ba kho nar gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor yang 'di dang 'dra ba kho nar gsungs te /
translated: The maṇḍala of Vajradhara is also said to be just like this.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two mandalas are inseparable.

original: a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi n'a de'i phreng ba so sor sngags kyi de kho na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi n'a de'i phreng ba so sor sngags kyi de kho na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The garland of nādas of the two alikāli arise as the reality of the mantra,

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'di las bzlog pa rtog pa las gsungs pa'i sngags rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'di las bzlog pa rtog pa las gsungs pa'i sngags rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise, the mantras taught in the Tantra would not be accomplished.

original: aom zhes pa rang 'byung ste /
analyzed: aom zhes pa rang 'byung ste /
translated: The syllable oṃ is self-arisen.

original: de nyid shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye bas a'a li k'a li gnyis kyis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye bas a'a li k'a li gnyis kyis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold by the division of wisdom and method, as a and i.

original: gnyis ka'i dbye bas kyang sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i dbye bas kyang sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold by the division of the two, as the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: de la yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is also fourfold by the concepts of pleasure and so on.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyis ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyis ye shes lnga'o //
translated: It is the five intuitions by the nature of the five intuitions such as the mirror-intuition.

original: 'di rnams ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni bco lnga'o //
translated: These are the fifteen.

original: de @92b rnams kyang ye shes kyi lus yin pa'i phyir drug pa rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de @92b rnams kyang ye shes kyi lus yin pa'i phyir drug pa rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They are the sixth consciousness, because they are the body of intuition.

original: de yang / de'i ngo bo nyid kyis de las 'das pa'i phyir lnga ba dang drug pa dang bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de yang / de'i ngo bo nyid kyis de las 'das pa'i phyir lnga ba dang drug pa dang bdun pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the fifth, sixth, and seventh are because of the transcendence of that by its own nature.

original: gsum po so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dgu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gsum po so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dgu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The ninth is because of the nature of the three vajras individually.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa kho na sngags kyi de kho na'o zhes pa ste ka sde ni dang po mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa kho na sngags kyi de kho na'o zhes pa ste ka sde ni dang po mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reality of mantra is only the indivisibility of the two mandalas. The ka group is Akṣobhya, the first.

original: tsa sde ni gnyis pa don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: tsa sde ni gnyis pa don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The ca group is Amoghasiddhi, the second.

original: ta sde ni gsum pa rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: ta sde ni gsum pa rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The ṭa group is Ratnasaṃbhava, the third.

original: ta sde ni bzhi pa rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: ta sde ni bzhi pa rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The ta group is Vairocana, the fourth.

original: pa sde ni lnga pa 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: pa sde ni lnga pa 'od dpag med do //
translated: The pa group is Amitābha, the fifth.🔽These are also each the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses and the five elements.🔽The ka group is the five pristine consciousnesses and the earth element.🔽The ca group is the mirror-like pristine consciousness and the water element.🔽The ṭa group is the pristine consciousness of uniformity and the fire element.🔽The ta group is the pristine consciousness of individual discernment and the wind element.🔽The pa group is the pristine consciousness of successful activities and the space element.

original: 'di rnams kyang so sor ye shes lnga dang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can de mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang so sor ye shes lnga dang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can de mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pas /
translated: The five pristine consciousnesses and the five elements are the five aggregates, the five blood relatives, the five meats, the five nectars, and so on.

original: ka kha ga gha nga /
analyzed: ka kha ga gha nga /
translated: The ka group is the aggregate of form and the mother.🔽The ca group is the aggregate of feeling and the sister.🔽The ṭa group is the aggregate of discrimination and the daughter.🔽The ta group is the aggregate of compositional factors and the son.🔽The pa group is the aggregate of consciousness and the father.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the five blood relatives.🔽The five meats are the five nectars.🔽The five nectars are the five blood relatives.🔽The five blood relatives are the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five elements.🔽The five elements are the five pristine consciousnesses.🔽The five pristine consciousnesses are the five families.🔽The five families are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five mandalas.🔽The five mandalas are the five deities.🔽The five deities are the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five blood relatives.🔽The five blood relatives are the five meats.🔽The five meats are the five nectars.🔽The five nectars are the five blood relatives.🔽The five blood relatives are the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five elements.🔽The five elements are the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: de rnams re re la lnga'i bdag nyid dang / de rnams kyang lnga'i bdag nyid kyis mtha' yas ba'i rigs rnams su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams re re la lnga'i bdag nyid dang / de rnams kyang lnga'i bdag nyid kyis mtha' yas ba'i rigs rnams su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Each of those has the nature of five, and those also have the nature of five, so they become infinite types.🔽Thus, all the syllables are the form of the five, such as mirrorlike timeless awareness, and so on.

original: yi ge thams cad me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'i rnam pa'o zhes pa sngags kyi de kho na gsungs so //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'i rnam pa'o zhes pa sngags kyi de kho na gsungs so //
translated: This is the teaching on the reality of mantra.

original: de bzhin du sngags btu ba'i zhar la yang bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags btu ba'i zhar la yang bshad de /
translated: Similarly, it is also explained in the context of the extraction of the mantra:

original: dang po'i dang po dang zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gnyis pa'i gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gnyis pa'i dang po zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gsum pa'i gnyis pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang / bzhi pa'i gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: dang po'i dang po dang zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gnyis pa'i gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gnyis pa'i dang po zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gsum pa'i gnyis pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang / bzhi pa'i gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: The first of the first, and so on, the third of the second, and so on, the first of the second, and so on, the second of the third, and so on, the third of the fourth, and so on,

original: lnga pa'i bzhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa dang / bdag med ma yis brgyan zhes pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lnga pa'i bzhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa dang / bdag med ma yis brgyan zhes pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: the fourth of the fifth, and so on, and adorned with Nairātmya, and so on.

original: sv'a zhes pas khu ba 'od dpag tu med pa gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sv'a zhes pas khu ba 'od dpag tu med pa gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The syllable sva is the seminal essence, Amitābha, and the vajra of enlightened speech.

original: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The ba is Vairocana, the vajra of body.🔽 The a is Nairātmya, the vajra of mind.

original: aa bdag med ma thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa ni sngags te /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa ni sngags te /
translated: The mantra is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: de yang / h'a zhes pa /
analyzed: de yang / h'a zhes pa /
translated: Moreover, the ha

original: ha thabs ; aa shes rab gnyis ka dbyer med pa sngags so //
analyzed: ha thabs ; aa shes rab gnyis ka dbyer med pa sngags so //
translated: is the method, the a is wisdom, and their inseparability is the mantra.

original: phat yig nang du gzhug pa ni dbye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phat yig nang du gzhug pa ni dbye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phaṭ is placed inside because it has the meaning of division.

original: de'i phyir gang sngags med pa dang / gang phyag rgya med pa dang / gang dkyil 'khor med pa dang / gang lha'i rnam pa med pa dang / gang bdag med ma'i rnam pa med pa dang / gang rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i rnam pa med pa ni 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang sngags med pa dang / gang phyag rgya med pa dang / gang dkyil 'khor med pa dang / gang lha'i rnam pa med pa dang / gang bdag med ma'i rnam pa med pa dang / gang rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i rnam pa med pa ni 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that which is without mantra, that which is without mudrā, that which is without maṇḍala, that which is without the form of the deity, that which is without the form of Nairātmya, and that which is without the inseparability of Vajradhara and Nairātmya is not suitable here.

original: de'i phyir phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi brda gnyis kyi sgras bya bar gyur pa thams cad sngags nyid do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi brda gnyis kyi sgras bya bar gyur pa thams cad sngags nyid do zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all activities by the words of the two symbolics of the outer and inner natures are mantra itself.🔽 🔽Oṃ vajra-śodhana-sarva-pa-pā-ni-svāhā.

original: mdor bstan pa tsam bris pa 'di ni bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa las 'ongs pa ste /🔽bdag @93a * //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa tsam bris pa 'di ni bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa las 'ongs pa ste / bdag @93a * //
translated: This brief explanation was written from the stage of the lineage of gurus.🔽For the sake of the meaning of recollecting oneself and for the sake of

original: nyid rjes su dran pa'i don dang bdag dang mnyam pa'i sems can gyi don du yang /
analyzed: nyid rjes su dran pa'i don dang bdag dang mnyam pa'i sems can gyi don du yang /
translated: beings equal to oneself,

original: kye'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom par sngags kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom par sngags kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: this is the second chapter of the Tantra of the Web of Magical Net of Illusion Dakinis, the chapter on the mantra.

original: kye'i rdo rje zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa ste /
translated: The khecarī is the inseparability of the two.

original: gang gi phyir mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Because the web of dakinis is the circle of yoginīs,

original: mchog dang sdud par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: mchog dang sdud par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyis /
translated: the supreme and the gathering, that is their nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the engagement in that nature,

original: mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom pa'o //
translated: it is the Web of Magical Net of Illusion Dakinis.

original: der sngags kyi le'u /
analyzed: der sngags kyi le'u /
translated: There, the chapter on the mantra.

original: sngags ni ye shes te /
analyzed: sngags ni ye shes te /
translated: The mantra is gnosis.

original: pa ta ni de sbas pa'o //
analyzed: pa ta ni de sbas pa'o //
translated: Paṭa means hidden,

original: la ni de 'dzin cing 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la ni de 'dzin cing 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and la means grasping and holding.

original: de yang gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i sku dang dbyer med pa nyid kyis chos kyi sku dang dbyer med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i sku dang dbyer med pa nyid kyis chos kyi sku dang dbyer med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The second is the meaning of “inseparable from the Dharma Body by being inseparable from the Emanation Body.”

original: dang por 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: dang por 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: First is the mantra of the bali offering to all beings.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sa bon no //
translated: Then are the seed syllables of the Tathagatas.

original: de nas phyag bcu drug pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag bcu drug pa'i'o //
translated: Then is the mantra of the sixteen-armed form.

original: de nas sngags thams cad kyi tshig gi dang por aom yig dang mthar sv'a h'a dang h'um dang phat yig nang du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags thams cad kyi tshig gi dang por aom yig dang mthar sv'a h'a dang h'um dang phat yig nang du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Then is the insertion of the syllable Om at the beginning of all mantras, the syllable svaha at the end, and the syllables hum and phat in the middle.

original: de nas grong khyer dkrugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas grong khyer dkrugs pa'o //
translated: Then is the mantra for agitating the city.

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sa bon no //
translated: Then are the seed syllables of the yoginis.

original: de nas phyag gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: Then is the mantra of the two-armed form.

original: de nas phyag bzhi pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag bzhi pa'i'o //
translated: Then is the mantra of the four-armed form.

original: de nas phyag bcu drug pa'i 'o //🔽de nas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag bcu drug pa'i 'o // de nas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Then is the mantra of the sixteen-armed form.🔽Then is the consecration.

original: de nas sa sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: de nas sa sbyong ba'o //
translated: Then is the purification of the ground.

original: de nas rengs pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / skrod pa dang / dbye ba dang / mngon spyod dang / 'gugs pa dang / gsad pa dang / ku ru ku lle'i sngags dang / char dbab pa dang / sprin dral ba dang /
analyzed: de nas rengs pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / skrod pa dang / dbye ba dang / mngon spyod dang / 'gugs pa dang / gsad pa dang / ku ru ku lle'i sngags dang / char dbab pa dang / sprin dral ba dang /
translated: Then, the paralyzing, the enthralling, the expelling, the separating, the slaying, the summoning, the killing, the mantra of Kurukulla, the causing of rain, the dispersing of clouds,

original: kha ti k'a bsgrub pa dang / lha dags pa dang / tsha ba'i rims byed pa dang / chang skyug pa'i cho ga dang / myos ma dbang du bya ba dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma gzung ba dang / rdo rje skar rtsis dang /
analyzed: kha ti k'a bsgrub pa dang / lha dags pa dang / tsha ba'i rims byed pa dang / chang skyug pa'i cho ga dang / myos ma dbang du bya ba dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma gzung ba dang / rdo rje skar rtsis dang /
translated: the accomplishment of katikas, the pleasing of gods, the causing of hot fevers, the rite of vomiting alcohol, the enthralling of intoxicated women, the seizing of the moon and sun, vajra astrology,

original: glang po che 'bros pa dang / stag 'bros pa dang / bse 'bros pa dang / sprul 'bros pa dang / khyi 'bros pa'i sngags te /
analyzed: glang po che 'bros pa dang / stag 'bros pa dang / bse 'bros pa dang / sprul 'bros pa dang / khyi 'bros pa'i sngags te /
translated: the fleeing of elephants, the fleeing of tigers, the fleeing of rhinoceroses, the fleeing of snakes, and the fleeing of dogs.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur gsungs pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'khor lo spro ba ni sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur gsungs pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'khor lo spro ba ni sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can /
translated: The emanation of the thirty-two channels taught in the Vajra Family Chapter has the nature of the emanation body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin sngags sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams so zhes pa sngags kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin sngags sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams so zhes pa sngags kyi le'u'o //
translated: This is the Mantra Chapter.

original: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes Chapter Two of the commentary on the Concise Meaning of the Immaculate Light, the commentary on the Concise Meaning of the Immaculate Light.

original: // / da ni rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / da ni rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Now, in the Vajra Family Chapter, the Body Vajra, the Emanation Body, has been taught.

original: @93b sngags kyi le'ur yang gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mngon par brjod de /
analyzed: @93b sngags kyi le'ur yang gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mngon par brjod de /
translated: In the Mantra Chapter, the Speech Vajra, the Enjoyment Body, has been described.

original: thugs rdo rje chos kyi sku rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje chos kyi sku rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to realize the Mind Vajra, the Truth Body, it is said:

original: lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The Deity Chapter will be explained.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te lus dang ldan pa dang / sngags kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te lus dang ldan pa dang / sngags kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That is twofold: having a body and having the nature of mantra.

original: gnyis ka yang bshad ma thag pa'i le'u gnyis por mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang bshad ma thag pa'i le'u gnyis por mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Both of those are illustrated in the two chapters just explained.

original: da ni de gnyis ka dbyer med pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis lha gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de gnyis ka dbyer med pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis lha gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the deity, which is the nature of gnosis, inseparable from those two, it is said:

original: lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The chapter on the deity will be explained.

original: de la / dang por byams pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de la / dang por byams pa bsgom par bya //
translated: There, first one should cultivate loving kindness,

original: gnyis par snying rje rnam bsgom zhing //
analyzed: gnyis par snying rje rnam bsgom zhing //
translated: secondly one should cultivate compassion,

original: gsum par dga' ba bsgom bya ste //
analyzed: gsum par dga' ba bsgom bya ste //
translated: thirdly one should cultivate joy,

original: lhag ma thams cad btang snyoms so //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad btang snyoms so //
translated: and all the rest is equanimity.

original: zhes pa'o // de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: slar yang stong pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: slar yang stong pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: again, emptiness is enlightenment,

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: in the second, the seed is gathered,

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //🔽bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs // bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: in the third, the reflection is complete,

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: in the fourth, the syllable is arranged.

original: dang por zhes pa sngon du stong pa nyid byang chub stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dang por zhes pa sngon du stong pa nyid byang chub stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: First, means that previously one should cultivate the three doors of liberation: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: In the second, the seed is gathered.

original: zhes pa de'i rjes la gang lha bsgom par bya ba de'i bskyed pa'i sngags bsdu ba yang dag par sdud pa'i ngo bo ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de'i rjes la gang lha bsgom par bya ba de'i bskyed pa'i sngags bsdu ba yang dag par sdud pa'i ngo bo ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: After that, the gathering of the seed mantra that generates the deity to be cultivated, the essence of perfect gathering, is the second.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: In the third, the reflection is complete.

original: zhes pa phyag dang / zhal dang sku mdog dang / mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam pas rdzogs par byed pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa phyag dang / zhal dang sku mdog dang / mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam pas rdzogs par byed pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the completion by way of the aspects of the hands, faces, bodies, colors, and emblems, etc.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: The fourth is the arrangement of the seed-syllable.

original: ces pa 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir 'gyur med rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: ces pa 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir 'gyur med rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Since it is unchanging, it is unchanging Vajradhara.

original: de yang dgod cing bskyed pa g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang dgod cing bskyed pa g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, the arrangement and generation of that is the nature of immobility.🔽The head becomes the lord of one's family.

original: spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gsung las rim pa de lta bus lha bsgom par bya'o zhes pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gsung las rim pa de lta bus lha bsgom par bya'o zhes pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: By such a process, one should meditate on the deity.

original: yang na / dang por stong nyid byang chub ste //
analyzed: yang na / dang por stong nyid byang chub ste //
translated: The first is emptiness-awakening.

original: zhes pa dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The first is nondual.

original: de yang / stong nyid byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang / stong nyid byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, emptiness-awakening is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: The second is the gathering of the seed.

original: zhes pa thugs rdo rje n'a da la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa thugs rdo rje n'a da la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the mind vajra rides on the nada,🔽it is the second.

original: de yang gnyis pas sa bon gyi tshul gyis yang dag par sdud cing bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gnyis pas sa bon gyi tshul gyis yang dag par sdud cing bsdu ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the gathering of the seed in the manner of the seed gathers and collects.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: In the third, the image is complete.

original: zhes pa sku ni a'a li dang k'a li na da'i bdag nyid kyis sku bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa sku ni a'a li dang k'a li na da'i bdag nyid kyis sku bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the generation of the body by means of the vowels and consonants, the nature of the nāḍīs.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //🔽ces pa 'god par byed pa ni dgod pa ste /🔽rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod // ces pa 'god par byed pa ni dgod pa ste / rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'o //
translated: In the fourth, the syllables are arranged.
The arrangement is the placement of the three indestructible vajras.

original: yang yig 'bru ste /
analyzed: yang yig 'bru ste /
translated: That is the syllable.

original: de ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: That is the unmoving.

original: de bsgom par bya zhing snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor bas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgom par bya zhing snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor bas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni rim pa'o //
translated: That should be cultivated, and the yoga should be completed by the practice of meditative equipoise. This is the sequence.

original: las kyi phyag rgya la ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas 'di'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya la ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas 'di'i rim pa'o //
translated: In the case of the karma consort, this is the sequence by means of the stages of joy, and so on.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya la ni 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya la ni 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa'o //
translated: In the case of the dharma consort, this is the sequence of the yoga of caṇḍālī by means of the stages of the four cakras.

original: phyag rgya chen po la ni phyag rgya gsum dbye ba med pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la ni phyag rgya gsum dbye ba med pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir rim pa bzhin no //
translated: In the case of the mahāmudrā, it is the stage of the nondifferentiation of the three mudras, and the stage of the complete enlightenment of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir slar yang byams pa bsgom par bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir slar yang byams pa bsgom par bya /
translated: Therefore, one should cultivate loving kindness again.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa lta bur dga' bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa lta bur dga' bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the desire to have joy for all sentient beings, as if they were one's only child.

original: gnyis par snying rje ni 'bras dang / phol mig la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi dge ba'i rang bzhin rnams las yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par bsgral bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis par snying rje ni 'bras dang / phol mig la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi dge ba'i rang bzhin rnams las yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par bsgral bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire to rescue and deliver from the varieties of suffering, such as the results of the evil life-periods, and the nature of the causes of suffering, such as the abscesses, etc.

original: dga' ba ni sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las grol bar gyur cing bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa rnams la gang zhig sems rangs pa de ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las grol bar gyur cing bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa rnams la gang zhig sems rangs pa de ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the delight of mind with regard to all sentient beings who are liberated from suffering and the causes of suffering, and who have attained happiness.

original: btang snyoms zhes pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Equanimity is the characteristic of being liberated from the eight worldly dharmas.

original: lhag ma thams cad ces pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad ces pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: The phrase all the rest refers to the ultimate of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: Or, what is it?

original: byams pa zhes pa bu gcig pa lta bur dga' ba nyid de /
analyzed: byams pa zhes pa bu gcig pa lta bur dga' ba nyid de /
translated: Love is the very joy, like that of a mother for her only child.

original: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
analyzed: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
translated: From me all beings have come.

original: nga las sa gsum po yang byung //
analyzed: nga las sa gsum po yang byung //
translated: From me the three worlds have come.

original: nga yis 'di kun khyab pa ste //
analyzed: nga yis 'di kun khyab pa ste //
translated: I pervade all this.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma mthong //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma mthong //
translated: I do not see any other nature of beings.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gnyis par snying rje zhes pa gsungs pa'i rang bzhin rnams zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: gnyis par snying rje zhes pa gsungs pa'i rang bzhin rnams zhes pa'o ;
translated: In the second, compassion is said to be the nature of the self.

original: / gsum par dga' ba zhes pa de'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis ka dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: / gsum par dga' ba zhes pa de'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis ka dbyer med pa'o //
translated: In the third, joy is the inseparability of the two.

original: lhag ma thams cad btang snyoms so zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa rtog pa las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //🔽yang na / dbang po dang yul tha dad pa med pa ni byams pa ste /🔽dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad btang snyoms so zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa rtog pa las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to // yang na / dbang po dang yul tha dad pa med pa ni byams pa ste / dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: All the rest is equanimity.

original: snying rje zhes pa kam bde ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa kam bde ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, love is the non-differentiation of the sense faculties and objects, which is the nature of joy.

original: ru na 'thud zhing bdag nyid la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir snying rje mchog dga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ru na 'thud zhing bdag nyid la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir snying rje mchog dga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Compassion is the nature of supreme joy, because it is the continuation of joy and is fully engaged in the self.

original: dga' ba zhes pa bde ba dang chags pa'i rang bzhin khyad par gyi dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes pa bde ba dang chags pa'i rang bzhin khyad par gyi dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Joy is the nature of bliss and attachment, the nature of special joy.

original: btang snyoms zhes pa chags pa dang chags bral rnam par 'dren par gyur pa lhan cig @94b skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes pa chags pa dang chags bral rnam par 'dren par gyur pa lhan cig @94b skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Equanimity is the nature of innate joy, which is the state of being a guide to those who are attached and those who are free from attachment.

original: yang na byams pa'i sgras gnyis su med par rtogs pa shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang na byams pa'i sgras gnyis su med par rtogs pa shes rab bo //
translated: Alternatively, the word “love” refers to wisdom, which is the realization of nonduality.

original: snying rje zhes pa spro ba'i rang bzhin thabs so //
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa spro ba'i rang bzhin thabs so //
translated: Compassion refers to the method, which is the nature of enthusiasm.

original: dga' ba'i zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir rdo rje gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba'i zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir rdo rje gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Joy is the indivisibility of the two, and therefore it is the nature of the three vajras.

original: btang snyoms zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de ;
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de ;
translated: Equanimity is the nature of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the nature of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations.

original: bzhi po 'di shes rab dang thabs gnyis dbyer med pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di shes rab dang thabs gnyis dbyer med pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: These four are the indivisibility of wisdom and method, which is the nature of the eight liberations.

original: lha'i bdag nyid ma lus pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pas /
analyzed: lha'i bdag nyid ma lus pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pas /
translated: The nature of the deities, in its entirety, is to be contemplated separately, in order to purify the stages of the mandala circle,

original: rang byin gyis brlab pa dang zung du 'jug pa dag las so sor rtog par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang byin gyis brlab pa dang zung du 'jug pa dag las so sor rtog par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: and in order to purify the self-consecration and union.

original: re phas nyi ma sngon du rnam pa sgom zhing //
analyzed: re phas nyi ma sngon du rnam pa sgom zhing //
translated: One should contemplate the sun with the Re-pha,

original: nyi der h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste //
analyzed: nyi der h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste //
translated: and from that sun, the Hum arises, and the vajra cross.🔽From that vajra, one should contemplate the ground,

original: rdo rje de nyid kyi sa ni rab dang // gur bcing ba yang rnam par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyi sa ni rab dang // gur bcing ba yang rnam par bsgom par bya //
translated: and the enclosure and tent.

original: zhes pa nyi ma ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: zhes pa nyi ma ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The sun is the sun mandala.

original: sngon du dang por rnam bsgom zhing bsams nas ;
analyzed: sngon du dang por rnam bsgom zhing bsams nas ;
translated: One should contemplate it first, at the beginning.

original: de'i rjes la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de gzhir gyur pa la /🔽h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de gzhir gyur pa la / h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste //
translated: After that, on the ground of that sun mandala,🔽the Hum arises, and the vajra cross.

original: h'um yig dang de yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs rdo rje sgo thams cad nas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: h'um yig dang de yongs su gyur pa las sna tshogs rdo rje sgo thams cad nas rdo rje'o //
translated: From the syllable Hum and its transformation, the vajra cross arises, with vajras on all the doors.🔽From that vajra, one should contemplate the ground,

original: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni rab bsam zhing rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni rab bsam zhing rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: and one should contemplate the enclosure and tent.

original: dang yig gis phreng ba la son pa'i 'od zer gyis bsgom par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dang yig gis phreng ba la son pa'i 'od zer gyis bsgom par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: The light rays from the syllable OM, which is on the garland, should be meditated.

original: gur bcing pa yang zhes pa gur lta bu ni gur de de'i bcing ba ni dbyibs so //
analyzed: gur bcing pa yang zhes pa gur lta bu ni gur de de'i bcing ba ni dbyibs so //
translated: The enclosure is also the tent, and the shape of the enclosure is the shape of the tent.

original: yam yig gi 'og tu son pa'i 'od zer gyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang / steng du son pas bla re ste /
analyzed: yam yig gi 'og tu son pa'i 'od zer gyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang / steng du son pas bla re ste /
translated: The light rays from the syllable YAM, which is below, are the vajra-nature of the ground, and from the one above is the canopy.

original: 'dis ni khang pa brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni khang pa brtsegs pa'o //
translated: This is the mansion.

original: yang na re phas zhes pa rin chen dbang pos nyi ma bdag med mdel h'um 'od dpag med zla ba byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: yang na re phas zhes pa rin chen dbang pos nyi ma bdag med mdel h'um 'od dpag med zla ba byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Or, the syllable RE is Ratnasambhava, the sun, Nairatmya, the moon, and the bodhicitta.

original: de gnyis ka las byung ba sna tshogs khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka las byung ba sna tshogs khams gsum pa ste /
translated: The various elements arise from both of those, and they are the three worlds.

original: de yang rdo rje dbye ba med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje dbye ba med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the indivisible vajra, which is gnosis.

original: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ye shes de nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ye shes de nyid kyis te /
translated: By that vajra, by that gnosis,

original: ra ba phul du byung ba'i rnam pa sku mdog dang phyag dang zhal dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i ngo bo ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ra ba phul du byung ba'i rnam pa sku mdog dang phyag dang zhal dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i ngo bo ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of the enclosure is the nature of the relative truth, with all its aspects of color, hands, faces, shapes, and so forth.

original: de yang kam don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang kam don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That is also kam, the nature of ultimate truth.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pas zung du 'jug pa ni gur bcing ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pas zung du 'jug pa ni gur bcing ba'o //
translated: The union of the two, because they are inseparable, is the binding of the enclosure.

original: dang por ro ni bsgom bya ba //
analyzed: dang por ro ni bsgom bya ba //
translated: First, one should meditate on the taste,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid dag //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid dag //
translated: the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: ces pa khang pa brtsegs pa de dang po thog mar ro bsgom @95a * //
analyzed: ces pa khang pa brtsegs pa de dang po thog mar ro bsgom @95a * //
translated: That palace should first be meditated on as the taste.

original: par bya'o // khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: par bya'o // khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its distinction?

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rig / chos 'du byed thams cad do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rig / chos 'du byed thams cad do //
translated: The nature of the dharmadhātu is the nature of all conditioned phenomena.

original: de rnams kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The dhātu of those is their nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: That is the nature of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: rig pa ni shes pa ste ye shes kyi rnam pas de rtog pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa ni shes pa ste ye shes kyi rnam pas de rtog pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Vidyā is consciousness, the aspect of gnosis.

original: yang na de nyid kye'i rdo rjer brjod de /
analyzed: yang na de nyid kye'i rdo rjer brjod de /
translated: That is also called “Hevajra.”

original: dang po gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The first two are nondual.

original: ro ni rang bzhin med pa ste //
analyzed: ro ni rang bzhin med pa ste //
translated: Taste is essenceless,🔽the nature of the realm of phenomena,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid dang // de'i ngo bo ni chos rnams kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid dang // de'i ngo bo ni chos rnams kyi dbyings so //
translated: and its essence is the realm of phenomena.

original: sgrogs pa dang rjod par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can de /
analyzed: sgrogs pa dang rjod par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can de /
translated: It is the nature of the realm of phenomena because it is proclaimed and expressed.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: rig pa ye shes kyi rnam pas rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa ye shes kyi rnam pas rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It should be established by the aspect of the gnosis of awareness.

original: de'i steng rnal 'byor pa gnas nas //
analyzed: de'i steng rnal 'byor pa gnas nas //
translated: The yogi/nī, abiding on that,

original: he ru ka nyid rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: he ru ka nyid rnam par bsgom //
translated: meditates on Heruka himself.

original: zhes pa / ro'i steng du rnal 'byor pa gnas nas he ru ka nyid he ru ka'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa / ro'i steng du rnal 'byor pa gnas nas he ru ka nyid he ru ka'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogi/nī, abiding on the corpse, should meditate on Heruka himself in the aspect of Heruka.

original: yang na / rnal 'byor pa 'di la rnal 'byor yod pa'i pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa bzung 'jug gi rim pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na / rnal 'byor pa 'di la rnal 'byor yod pa'i pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa bzung 'jug gi rim pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Or, because this yogi/nī has yoga, the yogi/nī abides in the stage of retention and entry.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ro bshad zin pa'i don gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ro bshad zin pa'i don gyi rang bzhin /
translated: The nature of the corpse, explained to be the nature of the realm of phenomena,

original: de'i steng du g-yo ba med par gyur pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas /
analyzed: de'i steng du g-yo ba med par gyur pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas /
translated: On top of that, having become unmoving, one should abide in the manner of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: he ru ka nyid ces pa /
analyzed: he ru ka nyid ces pa /
translated: The very Heruka is as follows.

original: he ni rgyu sogs spangs pa ste //
analyzed: he ni rgyu sogs spangs pa ste //
translated: He is the abandonment of causes, etc.

original: ru ni bkod pa dang bral ba //
analyzed: ru ni bkod pa dang bral ba //
translated: Ru is free from arrangement.

original: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Ka is not located anywhere.

original: zhes pa / de ltar gyur pa'i he ru ka de'i dngos po de nyid rnam par bsgom zhing rnam pa sna tshogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par gnas par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa / de ltar gyur pa'i he ru ka de'i dngos po de nyid rnam par bsgom zhing rnam pa sna tshogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par gnas par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the reality of that Heruka should be contemplated, and one should abide by the yoga of various kinds of meditative concentration.

original: re bas nyi ma sngon du rnam bsgom zhing //🔽zhes mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: re bas nyi ma sngon du rnam bsgom zhing // zhes mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: One should contemplate the sun in front, with the aspiration,

original: rang gi snying gar re pha bsgom //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar re pha bsgom //
translated: One should contemplate the syllable Re in one's heart center.

original: zhes pa / de gang du bsgom par bya zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa / de gang du bsgom par bya zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
translated: Fearing that one might wonder where one should contemplate that, it is said,

original: rang gi snying gar rang gi sems la re pha bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar rang gi sems la re pha bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate the syllable Re in one's heart center, in one's own mind.

original: de las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor //
translated: The maṇḍala of the sun arises from that.

original: der ni h'um gi rnam pa nyid //
analyzed: der ni h'um gi rnam pa nyid //
translated: There, the form of HŪṂ.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
translated: Having the nature of method and wisdom.

original: zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes thams cad bshad zin te rang gi snying gar zhes pa chos 'byung la /
analyzed: zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes thams cad bshad zin te rang gi snying gar zhes pa chos 'byung la /
translated: Thus, all the wisdoms having the nature of method and wisdom have been explained.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
translated: Having the nature of method and wisdom.

original: zhes pa thabs sna tshogs rdo rje dang / shes rab sna tshogs padma dang // 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni kam ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes pa thabs sna tshogs rdo rje dang / shes rab sna tshogs padma dang // 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni kam ye shes te /
translated: The nature of these is the wisdom of the syllable KAM.

original: @95b chos 'byung dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / sna tshogs padma ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @95b chos 'byung dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / sna tshogs padma ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The dharma source, the variegated vajra, and the variegated lotus are the meaning of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: rdo rje de la h'um ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje de la h'um ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one meditate on the HŪṂ in the vajra?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / kha dog nag po te /
analyzed: gsungs pa / kha dog nag po te /
translated: Black in color.

original: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje ni //
analyzed: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje ni //
translated: The vajra arisen from HŪṂ

original: kha dog nag por 'jigs chen po //
analyzed: kha dog nag por 'jigs chen po //
translated: Is black in color, very frightening,

original: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas pa //
translated: Residing in the center of the vajra hub,

original: yang ni h'um gi de nyid bsgom //
analyzed: yang ni h'um gi de nyid bsgom //
translated: Again, one should meditate on the reality of HŪṂ.

original: zhes pa h'um gi de nyid yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa h'um gi de nyid yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the reality of the syllable hūṃ.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its special feature?

original: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas pa /
translated: It is located in the center of the vajra navel.

original: rdo rje'i dbus su gnas pa kha dog nag po 'jigs chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbus su gnas pa kha dog nag po 'jigs chen po //
translated: It is located in the center of the vajra, black in color, very frightening,

original: blta bar mi bzod pa'i h'um yig las byung ba'i rdo rje de'i dbus su gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: blta bar mi bzod pa'i h'um yig las byung ba'i rdo rje de'i dbus su gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the syllable hūṃ, which is unbearable to behold. The meaning is that it is located in the center of the vajra that arises from the syllable hūṃ.

original: h'um yig yongs su gyur bltas nas //
analyzed: h'um yig yongs su gyur bltas nas //
translated: Having seen the transformation of the syllable hūṃ,

original: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the nature of hatred.

original: h'um yig de yongs su gyur par bltas te /
analyzed: h'um yig de yongs su gyur par bltas te /
translated: Having seen the transformation of the syllable hūṃ,

original: zhe sdang bdag nyid mi bskyed pa'i rang bzhin rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang bdag nyid mi bskyed pa'i rang bzhin rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the nature of hatred, which is not generated.

original: rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
translated: The vajra-born one is black,🔽the color of a blue lotus, or else the color of blue and red,

original: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / yang na sngo dang dmar ba'i mdog / dad pas nges par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / yang na sngo dang dmar ba'i mdog / dad pas nges par bsgom par bya //
translated: one should definitely meditate with faith.

original: zhes pa rdo rje skye ba ni gang zhig rdo rje'i ngo bor skyes shing byung ba de rdo rje skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje skye ba ni gang zhig rdo rje'i ngo bor skyes shing byung ba de rdo rje skye ba'o //
translated: The vajra-born one is one who is born and arises in the nature of a vajra. That is the vajra-born one.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nag po che shin tu sngon po gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nag po che shin tu sngon po gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the very dark blue is non-dual.

original: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba ni dkar po dang nag po 'dres pa'i kha dog gi ngo bo rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba ni dkar po dang nag po 'dres pa'i kha dog gi ngo bo rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The lotus-born blue is the nature of the color of a mixture of white and black, which is of two kinds.

original: yang na / sngo dang dmar po'i mdog ces pa dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po bsres pa'i kha dog gi rang bzhin rnam pa gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na / sngo dang dmar po'i mdog ces pa dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po bsres pa'i kha dog gi rang bzhin rnam pa gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the color blue and red is the nature of the color of a mixture of white, black, and red, which is of three kinds.

original: 'di las kha dog gcig la tha dad pa'i rang gi bsam pas nges par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las kha dog gcig la tha dad pa'i rang gi bsam pas nges par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on this with a different intention in regard to a single color.

original: he ru ka phyag gnyis pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa gsum ni gcig go zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: he ru ka phyag gnyis pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa gsum ni gcig go zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The three, the two-armed Heruka, the four-armed, and the six-armed, are one, is the idea.

original: yang na / kha dog nag po zhes pa nag po'i lus su gyur pa'i yi ge a'a li'i ngo bo gang yin pa de kha dog nag po ste cha dang bal ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na / kha dog nag po zhes pa nag po'i lus su gyur pa'i yi ge a'a li'i ngo bo gang yin pa de kha dog nag po ste cha dang bal ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or else, the color blue is the nature of the syllable A, which has become the body of the blue, which is the color blue, the meaning of the word part.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'jigs pa chen po ni shin tu dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po ni shin tu dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The great fear is the nature of complete non-apprehension.

original: byung ba'i rdo rje zhes pa mi phyed pa'i ngo bos yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i rdo rje zhes pa mi phyed pa'i ngo bos yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: The “vajra of arising” is the perfect abode by the nature of non-division.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: h'um yig la ste /
analyzed: h'um yig la ste /
translated: From the syllable hūṃ.

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa las so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa las so //
translated: From the indivisibility of wisdom and means.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus gnas pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus gnas pa /
translated: The vajra that has become like that abides in the center of the navel.

original: ba byang chub kyi sems thabs dang / ra shes rab gnyis ka rtogs pa'i phyir lte ba ste /
analyzed: ba byang chub kyi sems thabs dang / ra shes rab gnyis ka rtogs pa'i phyir lte ba ste /
translated: The navel is the center of both the bodhicitta and the method, because of the realization of both the method and wisdom.

original: de yang kam ngo //
analyzed: de yang kam ngo //
translated: And that is the ka.

original: de'i dbus gnas zhes shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'o //🔽de ltar gyur @96a * //
analyzed: de'i dbus gnas zhes shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'o // de ltar gyur @96a * //
translated: Abiding in its center is the indivisibility of wisdom and means.

original: pa'i h'um gi de nyid de kho na yang dag pa'i ye shes bsgom bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i h'um gi de nyid de kho na yang dag pa'i ye shes bsgom bya ste /
translated: The reality of that hūṃ is the true wisdom to be cultivated.

original: yang zhes pa 'di yang nas yang bar chad med pa kho nar zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes pa 'di yang nas yang bar chad med pa kho nar zhes pa'o //
translated: Again means again and again, without interruption.

original: de nyid kyi phyir h'um yig yongs su gyur pa h'um yig gi rang bzhin kho nas 'bras bu dang rgyu dbyer med pa'i phyir bltas nas zhes pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir h'um yig yongs su gyur pa h'um yig gi rang bzhin kho nas 'bras bu dang rgyu dbyer med pa'i phyir bltas nas zhes pa /
translated: Therefore, by the mere nature of the transformation of the syllable hūṃ into the syllable hūṃ, the result and cause are inseparable, and so “looking” means

original: rtogs nas zhe sdang gi bdag nyid 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba dbye ba med pa'i phyir gnyis 'dod pa //
analyzed: rtogs nas zhe sdang gi bdag nyid 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba dbye ba med pa'i phyir gnyis 'dod pa //
translated: realizing that the nature of hatred is the inseparability of cyclic existence and complete nirvana.

original: gang yang mi 'dor ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: gang yang mi 'dor ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: “ Not abandoning anything” is hatred.

original: de nyid gang gi lus yin pa de ni bdag nyid de //
analyzed: de nyid gang gi lus yin pa de ni bdag nyid de //
translated: That which has that as its body is the nature.🔽That should be cultivated.

original: de bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: yang de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Again, what is its special feature?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The vajra birth, the great black one,🔽the lotus, the blue one, the color of the sky,🔽the vajra, the great joy, the great seal,🔽the great hero, the great bliss.

original: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Birth is arising.

original: nag po che ni 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: nag po che ni 'jig pa ste /
translated: The great black one is destruction.

original: gnyi ga yang dbyer med pa ni rdo rje yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dbyer med pa ni rdo rje yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since both are inseparable, they are vajra.

original: rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
translated: Therefore, the vajra birth is the great black one.🔽The lotus is the blue one, the color of the sky.

original: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po nyid las so //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po nyid las so //
translated: Blue is from white and black.

original: sngon po de yang 'dam skyes te /
analyzed: sngon po de yang 'dam skyes te /
translated: The blue is the lotus,

original: padma dang chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: padma dang chos 'byung ngo //
translated: and the source of phenomena.
