original: de la yang dag par lhag pa med pas gsal zhing so sor gsal ba'i phyir 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par lhag pa med pas gsal zhing so sor gsal ba'i phyir 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog ste /
translated: Since there is no true superimposition, it is the color of blue lotus, clear and distinct.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dbyer med pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dbyer med pa ni /
translated: The inseparability of arising and cessation

original: chos 'byung las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'byung las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because it is not other than the source of phenomena.

original: yang na / sngo dang dmar ba'i mdog ces pa /
analyzed: yang na / sngo dang dmar ba'i mdog ces pa /
translated: Or else, the color of blue and red

original: kha dog gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i tshul gyis 'jig pa dang skye ba dang / gnas pa'i ngo bos mtshungs pa'i phyir sngon po dang / dmar po'i mdog go //
analyzed: kha dog gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i tshul gyis 'jig pa dang skye ba dang / gnas pa'i ngo bos mtshungs pa'i phyir sngon po dang / dmar po'i mdog go //
translated: is the color of blue and red in the manner of blue, white, and red, because of the equality of arising, cessation, and abiding.

original: de ltar gyur pa dad pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dad pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: That is the faculty of faith,

original: dbang po gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is not the domain of other faculties.

original: dad pas bsgom par bya zhing nges pas mnyam par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pas bsgom par bya zhing nges pas mnyam par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be cultivated with faith and realized with certainty.

original: yang na / rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
analyzed: yang na / rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
translated: Or else, the great black birth of the vajra

original: zhes pa 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the pristine consciousness that is totally pure by the nature of nonduality.

original: de nyid / 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / ces pa /
analyzed: de nyid / 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / ces pa /
translated: That itself is the color of a blue lotus.

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also the indivisibility of wisdom and method.

original: yang na / sngo dang dmar ba'i mdog ces pa //
analyzed: yang na / sngo dang dmar ba'i mdog ces pa //
translated: Or, the color of blue and red🔽is the pristine consciousness of the indivisibility of wisdom and method.

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa yang ngo zhes bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa yang ngo zhes bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: That itself is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: snyoms par 'jug pas gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pas gnas par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate and abide in union.

original: dad pas nges par zhes pa'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: dad pas nges par zhes pa'i don bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “determined by faith” has been explained.🔽Or, that which arises is birth, and that which is destroyed is death.

original: yang na gang skye ba 'byung ba dang / nag po che 'jig pa ste de yang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na gang skye ba 'byung ba dang / nag po che 'jig pa ste de yang rdo rje'o //
translated: That is also the vajra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngon po gnyis ka dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngon po gnyis ka dbyer med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the two blues are indivisible.

original: gnyis po dbyer med pa yang @96b gnas pa thim pa nyid do zhes pa sngo dang dmar ba nyid las skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis po dbyer med pa yang @96b gnas pa thim pa nyid do zhes pa sngo dang dmar ba nyid las skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The indivisibility of the two is the dissolution of abiding.

original: 'di gsum yang aa'i gzugs bdag med ma dbye ba med pas snang bar 'gyur ba de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur ro zhes ba sngo ba dang dmar po'i mdog go //
analyzed: 'di gsum yang aa'i gzugs bdag med ma dbye ba med pas snang bar 'gyur ba de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur ro zhes ba sngo ba dang dmar po'i mdog go //
translated: These three are the appearance of the form of the letter A, the indivisible Nairātmya, who abides in the nature of that appearance.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i rje btsun gang du ji ltar bskyed par bya zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / nam mkhar rje btsun zhes pa nam mkhar chos 'byung khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang du /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i rje btsun gang du ji ltar bskyed par bya zhe na / gsungs pa / nam mkhar rje btsun zhes pa nam mkhar chos 'byung khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang du /
translated: Where and how should one generate the Lord, who is like that?🔽It is said: In the sky, the Lord,

original: rje btsun zhes pa 'gro ba'i mnga' bdag go //
analyzed: rje btsun zhes pa 'gro ba'i mnga' bdag go //
translated: in the sky, in the house of the source of phenomena, the Lord is the master of beings.

original: bltas nas rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
analyzed: bltas nas rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
translated: Having seen him, the vajra-born, the great compassionate one,

original: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa yi //
translated: the one who holds all ornaments,

original: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
translated: is worshipped by the eight goddesses.

original: bltas nas zhes pa yang dag par dmigs nas khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: bltas nas zhes pa yang dag par dmigs nas khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: Having seen him, having perceived him correctly, what is his distinction?

original: rdo rje skye ba zhes pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba zhes pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The vajra-born is Vajradhara.

original: snying rje che zhes pa ston pa bla ma rje btsun no //
analyzed: snying rje che zhes pa ston pa bla ma rje btsun no //
translated: The great compassionate one is the teacher, the venerable lord.

original: snying gnas dmigs pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: snying gnas dmigs pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya ste /
translated: He should be worshipped with the worship of visualization in the heart.

original: lha mo brgyad ces pa /
analyzed: lha mo brgyad ces pa /
translated: The eight goddesses

original: goo r'i la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyis so //
translated: are the eight yoginis beginning with Gauri.

original: khyad par ji lta bu rnams kyis she na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu rnams kyis she na /
translated: In what way are they special?🔽They hold all ornaments,

original: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa'i zhes pa rgyan 'khor lo dang rna rgyan la sogs pa'i phyag rgya de rnams 'dzin pa yis so //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa'i zhes pa rgyan 'khor lo dang rna rgyan la sogs pa'i phyag rgya de rnams 'dzin pa yis so //
translated: that is, they hold the ornaments such as the wheel and earrings.

original: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: Gauri holds a deer and a moon.

original: zhes pa byang chub kyi sems zla ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa byang chub kyi sems zla ba'o //
translated: The deer is the bodhisattva spirit, and the moon is the moon.

original: chom rkun bdud las rgyal ba'i snod //
analyzed: chom rkun bdud las rgyal ba'i snod //
translated: Chudamani is the vessel of victory over Mara.

original: ces pa thod par gnas pa'i rin chen dbang po nyi ma'o //
analyzed: ces pa thod par gnas pa'i rin chen dbang po nyi ma'o //
translated: The jewel is the sun, and it is in the skull cup.

original: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
translated: Vetali holds a water knife.

original: zhes pa mi bskyod pas gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mi bskyod pas gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: She holds a skull cup filled with Akshobhya.

original: ghasma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //
analyzed: ghasma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //
translated: Ghasmari holds medicine.

original: zhes pa sman ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes pa sman ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: The medicine is Vairochana,

original: des gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: des gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and she holds a skull cup filled with him.🔽Pukkasi has a vajra hand.

original: pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa rdo rje ni sha ste /
analyzed: pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa rdo rje ni sha ste /
translated: The vajra is flesh,🔽and she holds a skull cup filled with it.

original: don yod grub pa sku rdo rje la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir de nyid rdo rje'i lag pa'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa sku rdo rje la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir de nyid rdo rje'i lag pa'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is the vajra body, and so he is the vajra hand.

original: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
analyzed: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
translated: Likewise, the Candali holds the corpse.

original: zhes pa ro ni sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'i bcud kyi mtshan nyid de de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ro ni sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'i bcud kyi mtshan nyid de de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The corpse is the characteristic of the essence of honey, etc. , and so she is the corpse-holder.

original: gdol pa mo ni cang te'u brdung //
analyzed: gdol pa mo ni cang te'u brdung //
translated: The Caṇḍālī beats the drum.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni gtso bo mchod //🔽g-yung mos sku la 'khyud pa nyid ;
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni gtso bo mchod // g-yung mos sku la 'khyud pa nyid ;
translated: These worship the principal one.🔽The Ḍākinī embraces the body.

original: / ji ltar g-yung mos sku la 'khyud par gyur pa de ltar g-yung mo des mchod pa'o //
analyzed: / ji ltar g-yung mos sku la 'khyud par gyur pa de ltar g-yung mo des mchod pa'o //
translated: Just as the Ḍākinī embraces the body, so she worships.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags las //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags las //
translated: From the passion of great desire.

original: zhes pa 'dod chags chen po ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dod chags chen po ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Great desire is Vajradhara.

original: de'i rjes chags las zhes pa 'dis he ru ka bzhi po'i yang ste /🔽'di ni mkha' @97a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes chags las zhes pa 'dis he ru ka bzhi po'i yang ste / 'di ni mkha' @97a * //
translated: From the passion of that, this is also the case for the four herukas.

original: 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of the sky-farers.

original: yang na nam mkhar rje btsun zhes pa la sogs pa ni nam mkhar zhes pa chos 'byung ae yig gi dbyibs la /
analyzed: yang na nam mkhar rje btsun zhes pa la sogs pa ni nam mkhar zhes pa chos 'byung ae yig gi dbyibs la /
translated: Or else, “in the sky, the exalted mind” and so forth: “in the sky” is the shape of the letter E of the phenomena source.

original: rje btsun byang chub kyi sems bam yig gi dbyibs so //
analyzed: rje btsun byang chub kyi sems bam yig gi dbyibs so //
translated: The exalted mind is the shape of the letter Vaṃ.

original: bltas nas zhes pa lta ba ni ye shes te /
analyzed: bltas nas zhes pa lta ba ni ye shes te /
translated: “Looking” is pristine awareness.

original: de'i rang bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du byas nas /
translated: Having made that the nature,

original: rdo rje skye ba gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ngo bos skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ngo bos skyes pa'o //
translated: the vajra is born, born with the nature of the inseparability of the two kinds of exalted mind.

original: snying rje che zhes pa rnams pa thams cad pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: snying rje che zhes pa rnams pa thams cad pa'i rang bzhin no // lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
translated: “Great compassion” is the nature of all aspects.

original: ces pa lha mo brgyad kyi rang bzhin gyis bskyed par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa lha mo brgyad kyi rang bzhin gyis bskyed par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: “The eight goddesses make offerings” means that one should generate the nature of the eight goddesses.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa zhes pa 'khor lo dang rna rgyan la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyan 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa zhes pa 'khor lo dang rna rgyan la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyan 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: “Holding all ornaments” means that one holds the ornaments of the purities of the tathāgatas, such as the wheel and earrings.

original: de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Those are the purities of the tathāgatas.

original: gnyis ka mnyam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ka mnyam pa'i phyir /
translated: Because both are equal,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang de lta bu kho na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang de lta bu kho na'o //
translated: The Lord is just like that.

original: dkar mo ri dgas mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: dkar mo ri dgas mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: The white one holds the deer's mark.

original: zhes pa / gzugs rdo rje ma goo r'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin sku rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa / gzugs rdo rje ma goo r'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin sku rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The white one, i.e., Gaurī, holds the deer's mark, i.e., the moon, which is the nature of the mirror-like intuition.

original: chom rkun bdud las rgyal ba'i snod //
analyzed: chom rkun bdud las rgyal ba'i snod //
translated: The thief is the vessel of victory over the demon.

original: ces pa sgra rdo rje ma chom rkun ma n'a da mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin las gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ces pa sgra rdo rje ma chom rkun ma n'a da mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin las gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The thief, i.e., Caurī, is the nature of the equality intuition.

original: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
translated: The zombie is the water-bearer.

original: zhes pa dri rdo rje ma ro langs ma sems n'a da la 'khyud pa'i phyir de yang sa bon so sor rtog pa'i ye shes thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dri rdo rje ma ro langs ma sems n'a da la 'khyud pa'i phyir de yang sa bon so sor rtog pa'i ye shes thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The zombie, i.e., Vetālī, is the nature of the discriminating intuition.

original: ghasma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //🔽zhes pa rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i phyir bdud rtsi lnga ni smin te bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //🔽pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag /
analyzed: ghasma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing // zhes pa rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i phyir bdud rtsi lnga ni smin te bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so // pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag /
translated: The one of Ghasmarī holds the medicine.🔽The one of Ghasmarī, i.e., Pukkasī, holds the medicine, i.e., the skull, which is the nature of the all-accomplishing intuition.🔽The one of Pukkasī has the vajra hand.

original: ces pa sa ni pukka s'i ru bshad de sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ces pa sa ni pukka s'i ru bshad de sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The one of Pukkasī, i.e., Caṇḍālī, has the vajra hand, which is the nature of the vajra body.

original: de yang rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa ste /
translated: The three vajras are indivisible.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje'i lag pa chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje'i lag pa chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, the vajra hand is the wisdom of the extremely pure dharmadhātu.

original: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
analyzed: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
translated: Likewise, the charnel ground is the bearer of corpses.

original: zhes pa / chu'i khams ri khrod ma byang chub kyi sems me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa / chu'i khams ri khrod ma byang chub kyi sems me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa dbyer med pa ste /
translated: The water element is the charnel ground, which is the bodhicitta indivisible from the mirror-like wisdom, and so on.

original: ro 'dzin zhes pa byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ro 'dzin zhes pa byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The bearer of corpses means that it is indivisible from the bodhicitta of the simultaneously born gnosis.

original: gdol ba mo ni cang te'u brdung //
analyzed: gdol ba mo ni cang te'u brdung //
translated: The untouchable woman plays the ḍamaru.

original: zhes pa / me'i khams ni gdol ba mo ste bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa / me'i khams ni gdol ba mo ste bdag med ma'o //
translated: The fire element is the untouchable woman, that is, Nairātmya.

original: de yang cang te'u gzhom du med pa'i sgra sgrogs pa n'a da dang tha dad med pa cha dang bral ba rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang cang te'u gzhom du med pa'i sgra sgrogs pa n'a da dang tha dad med pa cha dang bral ba rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, when the ḍamaru is sounded with an invincible sound, it is the realization of the partless, which is inseparable from the ḍamaru.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni gtso bo mchod //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni gtso bo mchod //
translated: They worship the principal one.

original: ces pa 'di rnams kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan @97b 'das zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa 'di rnams kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan @97b 'das zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “they” is the Bhagavān, who is the nature of those.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags las //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags las //
translated: From the passion of great desire,

original: g-yung mo sku la 'khyud pa nyid //
analyzed: g-yung mo sku la 'khyud pa nyid //
translated: the embrace of the Yoginī’s body.

original: ces pa g-yung mo ni rlung ste /
analyzed: ces pa g-yung mo ni rlung ste /
translated: The Yoginī is the wind.

original: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so //
translated: The two garlands of vowels and consonants.

original: de yis sku la 'khyud pa ni sems kyi rdo rje dang 'khyud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yis sku la 'khyud pa ni sems kyi rdo rje dang 'khyud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The embrace of the body is because of the embrace of the mind-vajra.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags te /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags te /
translated: From the passion of great desire.

original: 'dod chags chen po ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Great desire is Vajradhara.

original: de'i rjes su chags pa ni de la mngon par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su chags pa ni de la mngon par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Passion for that is because of the engagement in that.

original: de yang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: And that is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis ka yang sku las gzhan ma yin zhing de yang thugs las gzhan ma yin no ;
analyzed: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis ka yang sku las gzhan ma yin zhing de yang thugs las gzhan ma yin no ;
translated: The two garlands of vowels and consonants are not other than the body, and that is not other than the mind.

original: / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
translated: The vowels are the moon, the consonants the sun,

original: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
analyzed: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
translated: the seed having entered within.

original: a'a li zla ba zhes pa aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs bco lnga ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba zhes pa aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs bco lnga ni zla ba'o //
translated: The fifteen vowels beginning with a are the moon.

original: k'a li nyi zhes pa ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi ni nyi ma ste /
analyzed: k'a li nyi zhes pa ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi ni nyi ma ste /
translated: The thirty-four consonants beginning with ka are the sun.

original: 'di dag gi nang du son pa ni sa bon nang du son gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang du son pa ni sa bon nang du son gyur pa'o //
translated: The seed is located within them.🔽Or else,

original: yang na / sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
analyzed: yang na / sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
translated: the seed is located within.

original: zhes pa gnyis ka'i n'a da dbyer med pa gang yin pas sa bon te /
analyzed: zhes pa gnyis ka'i n'a da dbyer med pa gang yin pas sa bon te /
translated: The two nādas of a and ā are inseparable, and that is the seed.

original: de nang du son pa ye shes su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nang du son pa ye shes su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is located within, which is the state of gnosis.

original: de nyid rdo rje 'chang sems dpa' //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje 'chang sems dpa' //
translated: That itself is Vajradhara, the hero.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
translated: The hero is the oneness of the three existences.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i ye shes de yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin srid pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i ye shes de yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin srid pa gsum mo //
translated: From this statement, that gnosis of the inseparability of wisdom and method is the three existences, which are the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: gcig pa ni dbyer med pa nyid de de ni sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa ni dbyer med pa nyid de de ni sems dpa'o //
translated: One is their inseparability, and that is the hero.🔽It is also said:

original: de yang / mchog tu dka' ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: de yang / mchog tu dka' ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: It has the nature of the supreme difficulty.

original: zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “Vajradhara, the nature of co-emergent pristine consciousness.”

original: da ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag pa tha dad med par bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag pa tha dad med par bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the pristine consciousness maṇḍala and the samaya maṇḍala are inseparable,🔽it is said:

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa yi //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa yi //
translated: The maṇḍala that pervades the sky

original: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //
analyzed: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //
translated: is emanated as the same as one’s body.🔽And:

original: zhes pa dang / zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
translated: Meditate on the nature of anger.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa de ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa de ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the pristine consciousness maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
translated: The vajra birth, great compassion,

original: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
translated: is worshipped by the eight goddesses.

original: ces gang gsungs pa de ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ces gang gsungs pa de ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the samaya maṇḍala.

original: de gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: de gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor //
translated: The maṇḍala of the inseparability of those two

original: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
translated: is the moon of the vowels and the sun of the consonants.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs ma thag pa gang yin pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs ma thag pa gang yin pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa /
translated: This is the meaning of the just-mentioned words.🔽The maṇḍala that pervades the sky

original: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //
analyzed: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //
translated: is emanated as the same as one’s body.

original: zhes pa rang gi lus @98a * //
analyzed: zhes pa rang gi lus @98a * //
translated: This is the body of the deity.🔽

original: ni rang nyid kyi lus te ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //🔽de dang mtshungs pa ni 'od de /
analyzed: ni rang nyid kyi lus te ye shes kyi rang bzhin no // de dang mtshungs pa ni 'od de /
translated: One's own body is one's own body, which is the nature of intuition.

original: 'od zer sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa /
analyzed: 'od zer sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa /
translated: Similar to that is the light, which is the nature of the mandala of commitment, in the form of various light rays.

original: de rnams rnam par spro ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams rnam par spro ba'o //
translated: Those are the emanations.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa yi //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa yi //
translated: The pervasion of the sphere of space

original: zhes pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa nyid kyis nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du yang de rnams mi shong ba lta bu zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa nyid kyis nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du yang de rnams mi shong ba lta bu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means that the nature of those is the three realms, and so the sphere of space is as if not large enough for them.

original: bsdus nas snying gar bkug pa na //
analyzed: bsdus nas snying gar bkug pa na //
translated: Having gathered them, one should draw them into the heart,

original: yo g'i zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: yo g'i zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
translated: and one becomes the nature of the yoga's anger.

original: zhes pa de rnams bsdus nas gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: zhes pa de rnams bsdus nas gcig tu byas te /
translated: Having gathered them, one should make them one,

original: snying gar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la dgug cing gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la dgug cing gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and draw the mandala of intuition into the heart.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: yo g'i zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: yo g'i zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
translated: one becomes the nature of the yoga's anger.

original: zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The mandala of the indivisibility of both is Vajradhara.

original: 'dis ci gsungs na bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kho na bcom ldan 'das so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ci gsungs na bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kho na bcom ldan 'das so zhes pa'o //
translated: What is this saying? The Blessed One is just the nature of the two truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is the distinction of that Blessed One?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽With a color like blue and red,

original: sngo dang dmar ba mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces pa shin tu mnag pa zhes pa'i don to //🔽ban du dmar po'i spyan dang ldan //
analyzed: sngo dang dmar ba mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces pa shin tu mnag pa zhes pa'i don to // ban du dmar po'i spyan dang ldan //
translated: very beautiful is the meaning.🔽With eyes like red bandhuka flowers,

original: zhes pa me tog ban du ka ltar dmar ba'i spyan dang ldan pa'o //🔽skra ser gyen du 'khyil ba yang //
analyzed: zhes pa me tog ban du ka ltar dmar ba'i spyan dang ldan pa'o // skra ser gyen du 'khyil ba yang //
translated: with eyes red like bandhuka flowers.🔽With yellow hair standing upward,

original: zhes pa gang gi sgra ser po kham pa steng du son pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi sgra ser po kham pa steng du son pa de bzhin du /
translated: with hair yellow like the color of turmeric.

original: de'i 'khyil pa rdzi ma yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'khyil pa rdzi ma yang ngo //
translated: And his eyebrows are also like that.

original: phyag rgya lnga po rnams kyis brgyan //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga po rnams kyis brgyan //
translated: Adorned with the five symbolic ornaments,

original: phyag rgya 'di rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: and these symbolic ornaments are the purification of the five transcendent buddhas.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽The wheel, the necklace,

original: 'khor lo rnam cha mgul rgyan dang // lag gdub dang ni ska rags nyid //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnam cha mgul rgyan dang // lag gdub dang ni ska rags nyid //
translated: the bracelets, and the belt,

original: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa //
translated: The five Buddhas are pure,

original: 'di rnams phyag rgyar rab tu grags //
analyzed: 'di rnams phyag rgyar rab tu grags //
translated: and these are well known as the seals.

original: zhes pa'o // yang khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: sdang mig ni zhes pa //
analyzed: sdang mig ni zhes pa //
translated: The angry eyes

original: gdug pa 'dul phyir khro bo nyid //
analyzed: gdug pa 'dul phyir khro bo nyid //
translated: are wrathful in order to subdue the wicked.

original: ces pa'o // brgyad gnyis lo'i tshul zhes pa thams cad kyi tshe gzhon nu'i tshul nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa'o // brgyad gnyis lo'i tshul zhes pa thams cad kyi tshe gzhon nu'i tshul nyid do //
translated: The way of the twelve years is the way of youth in all cases.

original: 'di'i mtshan ma yang //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan ma yang //
translated: The signs of this are:🔽The vajra skull in the left hand,

original: g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang // phyag g-yon par rdo rje thod pa zhes pa rdo rjes mtshan pa'i thod pa'o //🔽kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
analyzed: g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang // phyag g-yon par rdo rje thod pa zhes pa rdo rjes mtshan pa'i thod pa'o // kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
translated: the skull marked with a vajra in the left hand.🔽The khaṭvāṅga in the left,

original: zhes pa g-yon logs kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa g-yon logs kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: the khaṭvāṅga on the left side.

original: g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
analyzed: g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
translated: The black vajra in the right,

original: rdo rje de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: what is that vajra like?

original: gsungs pa / h'um yig 'don pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: gsungs pa / h'um yig 'don pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: It is said: the nature of the syllable hūṃ.

original: h'um yig gi sgra rdzogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: h'um yig gi sgra rdzogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the completion of the sound of the syllable hūṃ.

original: dur khrod du ni mgon @98b po rol //
analyzed: dur khrod du ni mgon @98b po rol //
translated: The lord plays in the charnel ground,

original: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor ba //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor ba //
translated: surrounded by the eight yoginīs.

original: dur khrod kyi sgra'i don bshad par bya ste /🔽dbugs rgyu zhes pa'i rigs pa 'dis //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sgra'i don bshad par bya ste / dbugs rgyu zhes pa'i rigs pa 'dis //
translated: Now the meaning of the word “charnel ground” should be explained.🔽By the reasoning of “the movement of breath,”

original: dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
translated: it is called a “charnel ground.”

original: der rol zhing gnas te /
analyzed: der rol zhing gnas te /
translated: One should play and dwell there,

original: de yang / 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang / 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one engages in the activity for the benefit of beings.

original: rnal 'byor ma goo r'i la sogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis yongs bskor thams cad nas phyogs dang phyogs bral gyi rim pas bskor ba'o zhes pa phyag gnyis pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma goo r'i la sogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis yongs bskor thams cad nas phyogs dang phyogs bral gyi rim pas bskor ba'o zhes pa phyag gnyis pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: Surrounded by the eight yoginīs beginning with Gaurī, all around in the sequence of the directions and quarters.

original: 'di'i shes rab ni kha tv'am ga'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'di'i shes rab ni kha tv'am ga'i gzugs can no //
translated: His wisdom is in the form of Khaṇḍarohā.

original: phyag bzhi pa yang /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa yang /
translated: The four-armed one is also like that.

original: phyag bzhi ni bdud bzhi las rgyal ba rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: phyag bzhi ni bdud bzhi las rgyal ba rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The four arms are the purification of the victory over the four māras.

original: phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag ces pa 'di rnams rnam par sbyong bas phyag bzhi'o //
analyzed: phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag ces pa 'di rnams rnam par sbyong bas phyag bzhi'o //
translated: The four arms are the purification of the aggregates, the afflictions, and the lord of death.

original: gong du brjod pa'i gzugs dang / sku mdog dang / h'um las byung ba ni /
analyzed: gong du brjod pa'i gzugs dang / sku mdog dang / h'um las byung ba ni /
translated: The form, color, and arising from hūṃ mentioned above

original: h'um yig gi sa bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: h'um yig gi sa bon las byung ba'o //
translated: are arising from the seed syllable hūṃ.

original: 'di'i mtshan ma yang phyag g-yon gyi dang po na /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan ma yang phyag g-yon gyi dang po na /
translated: In the first left hand,

original: skyes pa'i thod pa zhes pa mi'i thod pa aa yig las byung ba /
analyzed: skyes pa'i thod pa zhes pa mi'i thod pa aa yig las byung ba /
translated: a human skull-cup arisen from the letter A,

original: lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis gang ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis gang ba'o //
translated: filled with the blood of gods and demigods.

original: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje h'um las byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje h'um las byung ba'o //
translated: In the first right hand, a vajra arisen from the letter Hum.

original: phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis shes rab la 'khyud pa ni /
analyzed: phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis shes rab la 'khyud pa ni /
translated: The remaining two hands embrace the wisdom.

original: shes rab la 'khyud par gyur cing shes rab kyis kyang 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab la 'khyud par gyur cing shes rab kyis kyang 'khyud pa'o //
translated: The wisdom also embraces him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab rdo rje phag mo zhes pa shes rab ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab rdo rje phag mo zhes pa shes rab ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the wisdom is Vajravarahi. The wisdom is in the form of the Bhagavat.

original: de yang rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: And that is Vajravarahi.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang phyag gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor la ji lta ba de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang phyag gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor la ji lta ba de bzhin te /
translated: The yoginis also have two arms, as in the mandala.

original: phyag bzhi pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: They are generated with four arms.

original: phyag drug pa yang phyag drug pa zhal gsum pa g-yon dmar ba zhes pa zhal g-yon pa dmar po'o //
analyzed: phyag drug pa yang phyag drug pa zhal gsum pa g-yon dmar ba zhes pa zhal g-yon pa dmar po'o //
translated: The six-armed one is six-armed, three-faced, with the left face red. The left face is red.

original: g-yas zla ba dang / nyi ma lta bu zhes pa zhal g-yas pa dkar po'o //
analyzed: g-yas zla ba dang / nyi ma lta bu zhes pa zhal g-yas pa dkar po'o //
translated: The right one is like the moon and sun, the right face is white.

original: dang po sngon po zhes pa zhal dang po sngon po'o //
analyzed: dang po sngon po zhes pa zhal dang po sngon po'o //
translated: The first one is blue, the first face is blue.

original: gcer bu gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs can no //
analyzed: gcer bu gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs can no //
translated: Naked, having the previously described body color and form.

original: 'dis ni he ru ka gzhan rnams la stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni he ru ka gzhan rnams la stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs yod pa'o //
translated: This indicates that the other Herukas have tiger-skin skirts.

original: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The hands are the purities of the perfections.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de rnams rnam par dag pa'i phyag rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de rnams rnam par dag pa'i phyag rnams so //
translated: The six perfections of generosity and so on are the pure hands.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na rtse gsum pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na rtse gsum pa /
translated: The first left hand holds a trident.

original: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje /🔽phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu /
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje / phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu /
translated: The first right hand holds a vajra.🔽The second left hand holds a bell.

original: phyag g-yas kyi gnyis pa na gri gug /
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi gnyis pa na gri gug /
translated: The second right hand holds a flaying knife.

original: @99a * // phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis rdo rje lcags sgrog ma la snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: @99a * // phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis rdo rje lcags sgrog ma la snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: The remaining two hands embrace Vajravetālī.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de ltar shes rab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de ltar shes rab ste /
translated: Just as the Bhagavān, so is wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is on his right and left, holding a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can gyi khams gsum pa mnan nas gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can gyi khams gsum pa mnan nas gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The corpse, which is the nature of the three realms, is suppressed, meaning that the three realms, which are the nature of the realm of phenomena, are suppressed and abide.

original: yang na / a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
analyzed: yang na / a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
translated: Or, as it is said:🔽The vowels are the moon, the consonants the sun.

original: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
analyzed: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
translated: The seed syllables are within.

original: de nyid sems dpa' zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de nyid sems dpa' zhes gsungs te //
translated: That is said to be the sattva.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: It has the nature of supreme joy.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa /
translated: And:

original: dang por stong nyid byang chub ste //
analyzed: dang por stong nyid byang chub ste //
translated: First, emptiness is enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: Second, the seed is gathered.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: Third, the reflection is complete.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: Fourth, the syllables are arranged.

original: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should meditate.🔽And:

original: de nyid / dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: de nyid / dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: Pāṇḍarā holds the sign of the deer.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: And so forth.

original: pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The five-fold nature of the five intuitions, such as the mirror-intuition, is indicated by the words beginning with “Pukkasi is the vajra hand” and ending with “Vajra-woman is the vajra mind. ”

original: phyag gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to indicate the two-armed form, it is said:

original: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi /
analyzed: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi /
translated: The vowels are the moon, the consonants the sun.

original: zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dag ste /
analyzed: zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dag ste /
translated: This is wisdom and means.

original: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
translated: The moon is endowed with the mirror intuition,

original: bdun gyi bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //
analyzed: bdun gyi bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //
translated: the seventh of the sevens is endowed with the equality intuition.

original: zhes pa ye shes gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes pa ye shes gnyis te /
translated: These are the two intuitions.

original: dbyer med pa las stong nyid byang chub ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa las stong nyid byang chub ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: From their inseparability, the intuition of duty-fulfillment should be declared.

original: 'di dag gi nang du son pa'i sa bon /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang du son pa'i sa bon /
translated: The seed-syllable that is included in these,

original: a'a li k'a li dag gi yi ge gang ci yang rung pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li dag gi yi ge gang ci yang rung pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: any syllable of the vowels and consonants, which is the nature of both, should be declared to be the discerning intuition.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: In the second, the seed is gathered.

original: de nyid sems dpa' zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de nyid sems dpa' zhes gsungs te //
translated: That itself is the being.

original: zhes pa 'di gsum ka dbyer med pa ni sems dpa' bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di gsum ka dbyer med pa ni sems dpa' bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: These three, which are inseparable, are the being, the duty-fulfillment intuition.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: On the third, the image is complete.

original: zhes pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: And, having the nature of supreme joy,

original: zhes pa rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is the nature of Vajradhara.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: On the fourth, the syllables are arranged.

original: ces pa ri khrod ma dang / gdol pa mo dang / g-yung mo ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sku la 'khyud pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ri khrod ma dang / gdol pa mo dang / g-yung mo ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sku la 'khyud pa ste /
translated: The meaning of which is that because the cowherdess, the caṇḍālī, and the weaver are the nature of body, speech, and mind, they embrace the body.

original: ji ltar dbyer med par gyur pa de ltar 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyer med par gyur pa de ltar 'dod chags chen po'i rjes chags rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In the same way that they become inseparable, the meaning of which is the nature of Vajradhara, who is passionate with great passion.

original: rnam par spro zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna @99b tshogs pa'i rnam par spro ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par spro zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna @99b tshogs pa'i rnam par spro ba ste /
translated: The meaning of “emanation” and so on is the emanation of various forms.

original: spro ba'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “in the manner of emanation” is that they are generated.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rang gi lus mtshungs te /
analyzed: rang gi lus mtshungs te /
translated: “One’s own body”

original: rang gi lus kyi 'od zer rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi 'od zer rnams so //
translated: means the light rays of one’s own body.

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa ste /
translated: pervading the sphere of the sky.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgras bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgras bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The sphere of the sky is the sphere of Nairātmya.🔽Pervading it means that by the identity of that, one becomes nondual, which is the meaning of “emanation.”

original: de khyad pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis su med par gyur pa spro zhes pa'i don te gnyis su med pa rtogs pa nyid kyis sdud pa de bsgrubs na /
analyzed: de khyad pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis su med par gyur pa spro zhes pa'i don te gnyis su med pa rtogs pa nyid kyis sdud pa de bsgrubs na /
translated: By the very realization of nonduality, one gathers in.

original: rnal 'byor pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid kyis zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid kyis zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur te /
translated: Having accomplished that, the yogi becomes the nature of wrath, by the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: gnyis 'dod pa'i phyir zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis 'dod pa'i phyir zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Wrath is so called because it is the desire for the two.

original: gang gi rang bzhin de ltar gyur pa de ni bdag nyid de rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin de ltar gyur pa de ni bdag nyid de rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is the self, which is perfected.

original: rnam pa gzhan du spro ba dang // bsdu ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du spro ba dang // bsdu ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, one would not be the nature of emanation and gathering in.

original: de yang khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: de yang khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?🔽It is said:🔽The color of blue and the sun,

original: gsungs pa / sngo dang nyi ma mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / sngo dang nyi ma mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po'o //
analyzed: sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po'o //
translated: Blue is white and black.

original: nyi ma ni dmar po ste //
analyzed: nyi ma ni dmar po ste //
translated: The sun is red.

original: sngo dang nyi ma zhes pa rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: sngo dang nyi ma zhes pa rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The blue and sun are the three vajras.

original: de yang aa bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: de yang aa bdag med ma ste /
translated: Moreover, a is Nairātmya,

original: de'i ngo bos snang zhing so sor gsal ba'i phyir sngo dang nyi ma'i 'od do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bos snang zhing so sor gsal ba'i phyir sngo dang nyi ma'i 'od do //
translated: and because of the appearance and individual clarity of her nature, there is blue and sun-light.

original: kha dog ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the color?

original: n'a da gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: n'a da gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the nature of both nāḍīs.

original: ban du dmar po'i spyan dang ldan //
analyzed: ban du dmar po'i spyan dang ldan //
translated: Having eyes of red bandhu,

original: zhes pa / dmar po ni chags pa dang kun du chags pa'i mchan nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa / dmar po ni chags pa dang kun du chags pa'i mchan nyid de /
translated: Red is the nature of passion and attachment.

original: de yang ; snang ba sku rdo rje zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ; snang ba sku rdo rje zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, it is the meaning of appearance is vajra body.

original: ban du ka zhes pa 'ching ba'i phyir ban du n'ad gnyis gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ban du ka zhes pa 'ching ba'i phyir ban du n'ad gnyis gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Because of binding, the two nāḍīs of bandhu are vajra speech.

original: ka'i sgras thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa ban du dmar po'o //
analyzed: ka'i sgras thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa ban du dmar po'o //
translated: The word ka is mind vajra, and so it is red bandhu.

original: gang zhig de lta bu'i spyan ye shes yod pa de de dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: gang zhig de lta bu'i spyan ye shes yod pa de de dang ldan pa ste //
translated: One who has such eyes of wisdom is endowed with them.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das la spyan gsum kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das la spyan gsum kho na'o //
translated: This shows that the Bhagavān has only three eyes.

original: skra ser gyen du 'khyil pa yang /
analyzed: skra ser gyen du 'khyil pa yang /
translated: Having yellow hair that curls upward,

original: zhes pa dmar ser gnyis las ser po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dmar ser gnyis las ser po'o //
translated: Yellow is from the two, red and yellow.

original: steng du son pa'i phyir gyen du ste /
analyzed: steng du son pa'i phyir gyen du ste /
translated: Since it has ascended above, it is upward.

original: gyen du ser po ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: gyen du ser po ni nyi ma'o //
translated: Upward yellow is the sun.

original: skra zhes pa kam bde ba'o //
analyzed: skra zhes pa kam bde ba'o //
translated: Hair is kam, bliss.

original: de'i dbang po ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni gtso bo ste /
translated: Its organ is the principal one,

original: bde ba spangs nas der mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba spangs nas der mi 'gyur //
translated: for without bliss, it would not be that.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las /
translated: From this statement,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zla pa'o zhes pa zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zla pa'o zhes pa zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: the nature of bodhicitta is the moon, meaning it has the nature of the moon and sun.

original: 'khyil pa ni lam ste /
analyzed: 'khyil pa ni lam ste /
translated: The coiled is the path,

original: gang zhig skra ser gyen du 'khyil pa de'o //
analyzed: gang zhig skra ser gyen du 'khyil pa de'o //
translated: for it is the one whose hair is yellow and coiled upward.

original: de nyid kyi phyir me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya lnga po 'khor lo dang / rna cha dang / mgul rgyan @100a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya lnga po 'khor lo dang / rna cha dang / mgul rgyan @100a * //
translated: For that very reason, it is the five mudras of the nature of the five tathagatas, who are the nature of the five wisdoms such as mirror-like wisdom, adorned with the wheel, earrings, necklace,

original: dang ; lag gdub dang / ska rags rnams kyi brgyan pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin can zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang ; lag gdub dang / ska rags rnams kyi brgyan pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin can zhes pa'i don to //
translated: armlets, and belt, meaning it has the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: 'khor lo rna cha mgul rgyan dang / lag gdub dang ni ska rags nyid //
analyzed: 'khor lo rna cha mgul rgyan dang / lag gdub dang ni ska rags nyid //
translated: armlets, and the belt.

original: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa ste //
translated: The five buddhas are completely pure.

original: shes rab dang thabs dang sku gsum dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang ye shes lnga rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes pa'i don to //🔽de yang khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dang sku gsum dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang ye shes lnga rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes pa'i don to // de yang khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: Vajradhara is the complete purity of wisdom, method, the three bodies, the four great elements, and the five pristine awarenesses.

original: gsungs pa / sdang mig ni /🔽gdug pa 'dul phyir khro bo nyid //
analyzed: gsungs pa / sdang mig ni / gdug pa 'dul phyir khro bo nyid //
translated: What is the difference between him and the others?

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: It is said:🔽Wrath is for taming the vicious.

original: gdug pa ni dbang po dang yul la lhag par gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gdug pa ni dbang po dang yul la lhag par gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Vicious refers to the afflictions and the secondary afflictions that are excessively present in the sense faculties and their objects.

original: 'di rnams 'dul ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di rnams 'dul ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Taming them is the process of making them the nature of the utterly pure expanse of reality.

original: de'i phyir khro bo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khro bo'o //
translated: Therefore, he is wrathful.

original: mig ces pa mthong ba ye shes te /
analyzed: mig ces pa mthong ba ye shes te /
translated: Eye refers to the seeing pristine awareness.

original: de de ltar gyur pa'i phyir sdang mig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar gyur pa'i phyir sdang mig ces pa'o //
translated: Since it is like that, it is called wrathful eye.

original: yang na sdang ba ni khro bo'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na sdang ba ni khro bo'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Or else, “hatred” is the nature of the relative truth, which is the nature of wrath.

original: mig ni mthong ba ye shes don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: mig ni mthong ba ye shes don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: “Eye” is the nature of the ultimate truth, which is the nature of seeing wisdom.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir sdang mi gces pa'o //🔽brgyad gnyis lo yi tshul zhes pa //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i phyir sdang mi gces pa'o // brgyad gnyis lo yi tshul zhes pa //
translated: Since both are inseparable, they are “hatred and eye.”🔽The “way of the sixteen years”

original: brgyad gnyis ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis ni bcu drug go //
translated: is the sixteen.

original: lo ni aa ba ste /
analyzed: lo ni aa ba ste /
translated: “Years” is ava.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid bcu drug go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid bcu drug go //
translated: The nature of bodhicitta is the sixteen emptinesses.

original: 'di dag gi tshul ni 'di dag gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi tshul ni 'di dag gi rnam pa ste /
translated: “Way” is the aspect of those.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The sixteen emptinesses are pure.

original: lo ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams te /
analyzed: lo ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams te /
translated: “Years” are the ḍākinīs.

original: de rnams kyang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin brgyad nyis 'gyur gyis bcu drug go //
analyzed: de rnams kyang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin brgyad nyis 'gyur gyis bcu drug go //
translated: They are also the sixteen, the nature of wisdom and method, doubled eight times.

original: gang gi rang bzhin 'di lta bur gyur pa de ni tshul lo //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin 'di lta bur gyur pa de ni tshul lo //
translated: The one whose nature is like that is the “way.”

original: 'dis ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that Vajradhara is the inseparability of the mandala of gnosis and the mandala of commitment.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i mtshan ma gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i mtshan ma gsungs pa /
translated: The signs of that are stated:🔽The vajra skull-cup and khaṭvāṅga in the left,

original: g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang // kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
analyzed: g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang // kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
translated: and the five-pointed vajra in the right.

original: g-yon na zhes pa phyag g-yon par te /
analyzed: g-yon na zhes pa phyag g-yon par te /
translated: The left is the left hand.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin a'a li li n'a da'i ngo bo zla ba la rdo rje thod pa ste //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin a'a li li n'a da'i ngo bo zla ba la rdo rje thod pa ste //
translated: The nature of the bodhicitta that is the nature of the five gnoses is the essence of the ālīḍa stance, the moon. The vajra skull-cup is

original: rdo rje byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rdo rje byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: the vajra of bodhicitta.

original: de yang kam thod pa ni kam bde ba'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de yang kam thod pa ni kam bde ba'i ye shes te /
translated: Moreover, kaṃ is the skull-cup, and kaṃ is the gnosis of bliss.

original: de skyong bar byed pa'i phyir rdo rje thod pa'o //
analyzed: de skyong bar byed pa'i phyir rdo rje thod pa'o //
translated: Since it sustains that, it is the vajra skull-cup.

original: kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
translated: The khaṭvāṅga is in the left.

original: kha tv'am ga gzugs shes rab ste //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga gzugs shes rab ste //
translated: The khaṭvāṅga is the form of wisdom.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las bdag med ma la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las bdag med ma la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga ste /
translated: From the statement “the fifteen ḍākinīs such as Vajravārāhī,”🔽there are fifteen ḍākinīs such as Vajravārāhī.

original: cha bco @100b lnga'i bdag nyid kyis g-yon pa nyid dang zla ba nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: cha bco @100b lnga'i bdag nyid kyis g-yon pa nyid dang zla ba nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: The fifteen parts are the left, and the moon.🔽Or,

original: yang na / kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
analyzed: yang na / kha tv'am ga yang g-yon pa nas //
translated: from the left,

original: zhes pa kha tv'am ga ni brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa kha tv'am ga ni brjod pa nyid de /
translated: the syllable is speech itself.

original: de yang g-yon pa nas zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang g-yon pa nas zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir te /
translated: And that is from the left, because of the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Va is Vairocana, the vajra of body.

original: aa n'ad gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: aa n'ad gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Ana is Amitābha, the vajra of speech.

original: ma lnga pa bsdus pas mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: ma lnga pa bsdus pas mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje ste /
translated: The five anusvāras are Akṣobhya, the vajra of mind.

original: dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their inseparability.

original: g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
analyzed: g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
translated: On the right, the vajra is black.

original: ces pa g-yas nyi ma la /
analyzed: ces pa g-yas nyi ma la /
translated: On the right, the sun.

original: rdo rje nag po zhes pa nag po de nyid rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nag po zhes pa nag po de nyid rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra is black, that very black is the vajra,

original: mi phyed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
translated: because of its indivisibility.

original: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa shes rab dang thabs dag gis h'um yig go //
analyzed: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa shes rab dang thabs dag gis h'um yig go //
translated: The syllable is hūṃ, by the left and right, that is, by means of wisdom and means.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: yi ge las byung gong bu ni //
analyzed: yi ge las byung gong bu ni //
translated: The aggregate arisen from the syllable

original: h'um ste phat yig 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: h'um ste phat yig 'dod ma yin //
translated: is hūṃ, and the syllable phaṭ is desire.

original: zhes pa'i gsungs las h'um yig kho na shes rab dang thabs dag gis sa bon te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsungs las h'um yig kho na shes rab dang thabs dag gis sa bon te /
translated: From this statement, only the syllable hūṃ is the seed of wisdom and means.

original: de'i phyir phat yig tha dad pa'i bya ba 'dod ma yin zhes pa mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phat yig tha dad pa'i bya ba 'dod ma yin zhes pa mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the statement “the syllable phaṭ is not asserted to be a separate action” is not asserted.

original: 'di gnyis ka dbyer med pa gang yin pa de brjod pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka dbyer med pa gang yin pa de brjod pa'i bdag nyid can /
translated: That which is the inseparability of these two is the nature of the expression.

original: n'a da'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: n'a da'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “the nature of nāda.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsung pa ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsung pa ;
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: dur khrod du ni mgon po rol //
analyzed: dur khrod du ni mgon po rol //
translated: The lord plays in the charnel ground,

original: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yong sa bskor ba //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yong sa bskor ba //
translated: surrounded by the eight yoginīs.

original: zhes pa dur khrod kyi sgra'i don ni bcom ldan 'das rang nyid kyis gsal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes pa dur khrod kyi sgra'i don ni bcom ldan 'das rang nyid kyis gsal bar mdzad de /
translated: The meaning of the term “charnel ground” is clarified by the Bhagavān himself:

original: dbugs rgyu ba dbugs 'byung ba dang / 'jug par byed pa a'a li dang k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid kyis zhes pa'i rigs pa 'dis gnyig dbyer med pa'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba dbugs 'byung ba dang / 'jug par byed pa a'a li dang k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid kyis zhes pa'i rigs pa 'dis gnyig dbyer med pa'i sbyor bas /
translated: “The exhalation and inhalation of breath, by the method of the nature of ālī and kālī, the nature of nāda,” by the union of the inseparability of the two,

original: dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
translated: it is called “charnel ground.”

original: ces pa'o // 'di la spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa ni rol ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // 'di la spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa ni rol ba'o //
translated: Here, “playing” is abiding in the mode of emanation.

original: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor ba //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor ba //
translated: surrounded by the eight yoginis.

original: zhes pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa ste /
translated: This is the abiding in the manner of the pervaded and the pervader.🔽Therefore, the meaning of the protector, the guru of the three worlds, is stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mgon po 'jig rten gsum gyi bla ma zhes pa'i don to zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa nyid kyis phyag gnyis pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mgon po 'jig rten gsum gyi bla ma zhes pa'i don to zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa nyid kyis phyag gnyis pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is two-armed, because of the indivisibility of wisdom and means.

original: de nyid rdo rje 'chang phyag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje 'chang phyag bzhi pa'o //
translated: He is four-armed, because of being the vajra holder.

original: gang gi phyir bdud bzhi las rgyal ba rnam par dag pa ste zhes pa bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdud bzhi las rgyal ba rnam par dag pa ste zhes pa bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The four demons are the demon of the aggregates, which is the nature of the five aggregates beginning with form.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni nyon mongs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni nyon mongs par byed pa ste /
translated: The demon of afflictions is that which afflicts.

original: dbang po dang yul gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is of the nature of the afflictions and secondary afflictions, because it engages through the adherence to the apprehended and apprehender of the sense faculties and objects.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud ni lha zhes pa rtse zhing rol pa'i phyir rnam par shes @101a * //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud ni lha zhes pa rtse zhing rol pa'i phyir rnam par shes @101a * //
translated: The devaputra māra is the consciousness, because of the play and enjoyment of the gods.

original: pa'o ; / dbang po dang yul la sogs pa rnams ni de'i bu ste /
analyzed: pa'o ; / dbang po dang yul la sogs pa rnams ni de'i bu ste /
translated: The sons of the gods are the sense faculties, objects, etc.

original: des bskyed pa'i phyir lha'i bu dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i phyir lha'i bu dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The devaputra māra is the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses, because they are generated by that.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni 'chi bdag gshin rje 'jig byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni 'chi bdag gshin rje 'jig byed ces pa ste /
translated: The māra of the lord of death is the lord of death, Yama, the destroyer.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyis bskyed pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyis bskyed pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the aspects of pleasure, etc., generated by the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.🔽Moreover, although it has the nature of the cessation of the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses, it is a māra because it is characterized by attachment.

original: de yang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yin yang chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir bdud nyid do zhes pa bdud bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yin yang chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir bdud nyid do zhes pa bdud bzhi ste /
translated: These are the four māras.

original: de rnams las rgyal ba ni lhag ma med par brtul ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las rgyal ba ni lhag ma med par brtul ba'o //
translated: Victory over them is the complete subjugation of them.

original: de rnam par dag pa zhes pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa zhes pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is pure, which is beyond the nature of the experience of bliss, etc., and means Vajradhara.

original: de yang gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang / gzugs can h'um las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang / gzugs can h'um las byung ba'o //
translated: And that is the color of the body mentioned above, and arises from the syllable hūṃ.

original: mtshan ma yang tha dad med pa'i mtshan nyid kho na tha dad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma yang tha dad med pa'i mtshan nyid kho na tha dad pas gsungs pa /
translated: The sign is also said to be non-different, but with a different characteristic.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na skyes pa'i thod pa lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis gang ba zhes pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na skyes pa'i thod pa lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis gang ba zhes pa /
translated: In the first left hand, a human skull filled with the blood of gods and demigods.

original: dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The first is the non-dual,

original: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad sdud pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad sdud pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
translated: and the left is the moon, because it is the nature of gathering all ḍākinīs.

original: de yang dga' ba bzhi longs spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis phyag ste /
analyzed: de yang dga' ba bzhi longs spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis phyag ste /
translated: And that is a hand, because it is the nature of enjoying the four joys.

original: de las skyes pa'i thod pa ni mi'i bde ba rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i thod pa ni mi'i bde ba rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
translated: From that, the skull is the wisdom of Vajradhara, the bliss of humans.

original: lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis gang ba ni brtse ba'i phyir lha gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis gang ba ni brtse ba'i phyir lha gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: Filled with the blood of gods and demigods means that out of love, the five aggregates are in the form of gods, etc.

original: lha ma yin ni yul lnga'o //🔽de rnams kyi khrag ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: lha ma yin ni yul lnga'o // de rnams kyi khrag ni 'dod chags te /
translated: The demigods are the five objects.🔽Their blood is passion.

original: de rnams la chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams la chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of attachment to them.

original: de yis gang ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyis spro ba'i ngo bos rnam par gnas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yis gang ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyis spro ba'i ngo bos rnam par gnas so zhes pa'o //
translated: Filled with that means that they are present in the nature of the emanation of that.

original: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje zhes pa g-yas na nyi ma ste /
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje zhes pa g-yas na nyi ma ste /
translated: The first right hand holds a vajra means that the right hand is the sun.

original: de yang phyag ni khams gsum pa za ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de yang phyag ni khams gsum pa za ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Moreover, the hand is the nature of devouring the three realms.

original: dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The first is nondual.

original: de la rdo rje zhes pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la rdo rje zhes pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The vajra there is indivisible wisdom.

original: phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis zhes pa /
analyzed: phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis zhes pa /
translated: The two remaining hands means

original: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag gnyis po zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'dres par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag gnyis po zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'dres par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the two left and right hands are mixed with the moon and sun.

original: lhag ma ni lhag ma nyid de shes rab la 'khyud pa ni gnyis po dag gis 'khyud pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni lhag ma nyid de shes rab la 'khyud pa ni gnyis po dag gis 'khyud pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: The remainder is just the remainder. The embrace of wisdom is the embrace of the two, and so it is the gnosis of nonduality.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: shes rab rdo rje phag mo ni //
analyzed: shes rab rdo rje phag mo ni //
translated: Wisdom is Vajravarahi,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can te //
translated: and the Bhagavat has her form.🔽There is no difference between Nairatmya and Vajra.

original: bdag med ma dang rdo rje dag la tha dad @101b med pa nyid do zhes pa kye'i rdo rje phyag bzhi ba'o //🔽de nyid phyag drug pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med ma dang rdo rje dag la tha dad @101b med pa nyid do zhes pa kye'i rdo rje phyag bzhi ba'o // de nyid phyag drug pa ste /
translated: He is four-armed Kye’i rdo-rje.

original: phyag drug pa /
analyzed: phyag drug pa /
translated: He is six-armed,

original: zhal gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa drug bsdus pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: zhal gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa drug bsdus pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: with three faces, and so on.

original: de yang zhal gsum zhes pa sku gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang zhal gsum zhes pa sku gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The three faces are the nature of the three bodies.

original: g-yon dmar ba zhes pa g-yon zla ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon dmar ba zhes pa g-yon zla ba'o //
translated: The left is red, the left is the moon.

original: de nyid dmar ba ni nye ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid dmar ba ni nye ma ste /
translated: That itself is red, the sun.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med ba'o ;
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med ba'o ;
translated: Both are inseparable.

original: / g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: / g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The right is the sun.

original: de nyid zla ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid zla ba ste /
translated: That itself is the moon.

original: de yang nyi ma lta bu ni aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de yang nyi ma lta bu ni aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: That is also like the sun, the self.

original: de'i ngo bos skyes pa'i phyir aa ru na ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bos skyes pa'i phyir aa ru na ste /
translated: Because it is born of its own nature, it is the arura.

original: lta bu ni 'dis so sor gsal ba'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lta bu ni 'dis so sor gsal ba'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the sun because it illuminates each one.

original: de yang dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dang po ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the first one is nondual.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngon po dkar po dang nag po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngon po dkar po dang nag po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: For that very reason, it is the nature of blue, white, and black.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gcer bu sgrib pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gcer bu sgrib pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is naked, the nature free from obscuration.

original: gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs can zhes pa h'um yig gi rang bzhin kho na bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs can zhes pa h'um yig gi rang bzhin kho na bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one described above, having the color and form of the syllable hum, is the nature of the Blessed One.

original: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa phyag rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa phyag rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa'o //
translated: The purity of the perfections is the purity of the arms.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: The six perfections, such as generosity.
