original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the Blessed One as the nature of expansion and contraction.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na rtse gsum pa zhes pa g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na rtse gsum pa zhes pa g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
translated: The first of the left hands holds a trident. The left is the moon.

original: longs spyod cing za ba'i phyir zhes pa'i don las phyag ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: longs spyod cing za ba'i phyir zhes pa'i don las phyag ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The hand is the sun, because of the meaning of “enjoying and eating.”

original: 'di gnyis ka yang dang po gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang dang po gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: These two are nondual in the first two.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po'o //
translated: The first of the left hands.

original: de la rtse gsum pa zhes pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rtse gsum pa zhes pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: There, the trident is the three vajras of body, speech, and mind.

original: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na zhes pa g-yas pa ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na zhes pa g-yas pa ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The first of the right hands holds a vajra. The right is the sun.

original: phyag ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyag ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
translated: The hand has the meaning already explained.

original: dang po ni rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje snang ba'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang ste //
analyzed: dang po ni rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje snang ba'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang ste //
translated: The first is Vairocana, the vajra of body, the nature of the relative truth, Vajradhara, the characteristic of illumination.

original: nyi ma yang bdag med ma yin pa'i phyir phyag g-yas kyi dang po kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma yang bdag med ma yin pa'i phyir phyag g-yas kyi dang po kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The sun is also Nairātmya, so the first of the right hands is the inseparability of the relative and the ultimate.

original: rdo rje ni sku rdo rje mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sku rdo rje mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The vajra is the gnosis of the indivisible vajra of body.

original: phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu zhes pa g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu zhes pa g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
translated: The second left hand holds a bell.

original: gnyis pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The second is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: de yang phyag ni sdud pa'i rnam pa ste ;
analyzed: de yang phyag ni sdud pa'i rnam pa ste ;
translated: That is also a hand in the aspect of gathering.

original: de 'dril bu zhes pa de la a'a li k'a li gnyis ka'i n'a da dbye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de 'dril bu zhes pa de la a'a li k'a li gnyis ka'i n'a da dbye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: That is a bell. The two, ālikāli, are of the nature of the indivisibility of the nāda.🔽The second right hand holds a flaying knife.

original: phyag g-yas kyi gnyis pa ni gri gug ces pa g-yas pa ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi gnyis pa ni gri gug ces pa g-yas pa ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The right is the sun.

original: de'i gnyis pa ni zla ba yin pa'i phyir g-yas kyi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyis pa ni zla ba yin pa'i phyir g-yas kyi gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second of that is the moon.

original: de dag 'dres par 'gyur ba ni phyag go //🔽gri gug gis mi shes @102a * //
analyzed: de dag 'dres par 'gyur ba ni phyag go // gri gug gis mi shes @102a * //
translated: Those two are mixed, becoming a hand.🔽The flaying knife cuts all ignorance.

original: pa thams cad gcod par byed pa thugs rdo rje mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: pa thams cad gcod par byed pa thugs rdo rje mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of indivisible mind-vajra.

original: phyag lhag ma gnyis la rdo rje lhags sgrog ma snyoms par zhugs pa zhes pa /
analyzed: phyag lhag ma gnyis la rdo rje lhags sgrog ma snyoms par zhugs pa zhes pa /
translated: The remaining two hands embrace Vajra Ghaṇṭā.

original: lhag ma ni ma lus pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni ma lus pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The remaining two are the indivisible three vajras, the coemergent gnosis.

original: lhag ma gnyis kyang phyag gnyis shes rab dang thabs dbyer med par gyur ba la zhes phyag lhag ma gnyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis kyang phyag gnyis shes rab dang thabs dbyer med par gyur ba la zhes phyag lhag ma gnyis so //
translated: The remaining two are also the two hands, which become the indivisibility of wisdom and means.

original: der rdo rje lcags sgrog ma snyoms par zhugs zhes ba rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'i sgras ni rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: der rdo rje lcags sgrog ma snyoms par zhugs zhes ba rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'i sgras ni rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: There, Vajra-Lokeśvara enters into union, by the word Vajra-Lokeśvara, Vajra is Vajradhara.

original: de lcags sgrog gi tshul gyis phan tshun dbye ba med pas 'ching ba rdo rje lcags sgrog ma bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de lcags sgrog gi tshul gyis phan tshun dbye ba med pas 'ching ba rdo rje lcags sgrog ma bdag med ma'o //
translated: By the method of a chain, they are mutually inseparable, and the binding is Vajra-Lokeśvara Nairātmya.

original: de yis lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa zhes pa mnyam pa'i rang bzhin tha dad med pa'i ngo bos zhugs pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yis lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa zhes pa mnyam pa'i rang bzhin tha dad med pa'i ngo bos zhugs pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: By that, they enter into union, by the nature of equality, with the essence of non-difference, the perfect wisdom.

original: rgyu des na bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de lta bu'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rgyu des na bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de lta bu'i shes rab ste /
translated: By that cause, the Bhagavat is just such wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs dag la dbye ba 'ga' yang med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs dag la dbye ba 'ga' yang med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, there is no division at all of wisdom and means.

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa zhes pa g-yas pa ni nyi ma cha dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa zhes pa g-yas pa ni nyi ma cha dang bral ba'o //
translated: In the right and left hands, a flaying knife and skull-cup. The right hand is the sun, free of parts.

original: g-yon pa na ni zla ba cha dang bas pa ste /
analyzed: g-yon pa na ni zla ba cha dang bas pa ste /
translated: The left hand is the moon, free of parts.

original: cha dang bral ba nyid cha dang bcas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: cha dang bral ba nyid cha dang bcas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Freedom from parts is the same as having parts.

original: 'di dag gi byed pa kho na gri gug dang thod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi byed pa kho na gri gug dang thod pa ste /
translated: Their function is the flaying knife and skull-cup.

original: gri gug bdag med ma dang thod pa rdo rje 'chang gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: gri gug bdag med ma dang thod pa rdo rje 'chang gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis gcig gi tshig go //
translated: The flaying knife is Nairātmya, and the skull-cup is Vajradhara. The two are inseparable, and so the word “one” is used.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, she tramples the corpse, which is the nature of the three realms.

original: khams gsum gyi sgras rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi sgras rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three realms are the three vajras.

original: de'i bdag nyid can de'i ngo bo'i ro chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can de'i ngo bo'i ro chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The corpse, which is their nature, is the essence of the dharmadhātu.🔽“ Tramples” means that she is pervaded by the nature of the pervaders.🔽This is the meaning of the word “tramples.”

original: mnan pa zhes pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bos mnan pa zhes pa'i don to zhes pa lha'i le'u ste gsum pa'o zhes pa gang gi phyir lus la byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mnan pa zhes pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bos mnan pa zhes pa'i don to zhes pa lha'i le'u ste gsum pa'o zhes pa gang gi phyir lus la byung ba'i phyir /
translated: This is the third chapter, the chapter on the deity.

original: lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
translated: It should be called the “god chapter. ”

original: zhes pa'i gsung las lha ni n'a das 'khyud pa'i thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las lha ni n'a das 'khyud pa'i thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: In the statement, “god” refers to the mind vajra embraced by nāda.

original: de yang bad g-yogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bad g-yogs pa ste /
translated: It is also the “veil,”

original: de len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir lha'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir lha'i le'u'o //
translated: because it takes up and holds the nāda.

original: de yang gsum pa ni sku gsung thugs gsum po rnams kyi rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gsum pa ni sku gsung thugs gsum po rnams kyi rdzogs pa ste /
translated: It is also the “third,” because it is the perfection of the three: body, speech, and mind.

original: sku mdog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi rnam pas sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sku mdog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi rnam pas sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The body vajra is in the form of color, hands, and shape.

original: de yang sa bon las skyes pa'i phyir sngags kyi rnam pa dang bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod ces pa'i gsung las ye shes kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sa bon las skyes pa'i phyir sngags kyi rnam pa dang bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod ces pa'i gsung las ye shes kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: It is also the “fourth,” because it is the placement of the seed syllable, as stated in the statement, “the form of wisdom.”

original: le'u gsum pa 'di ni le'u gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa 'di ni le'u gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: This third chapter is the essence of the three chapters.

original: n'a da rnam @102b shes las skye zhing //
analyzed: n'a da rnam @102b shes las skye zhing //
translated: Nāda arises from consciousness,

original: n'a da las ni sku skye 'gyur //
analyzed: n'a da las ni sku skye 'gyur //
translated: and the body arises from nāda.

original: zhes ba sku dang n'a da dang / rnam shes gsum po gnyis su med //
analyzed: zhes ba sku dang n'a da dang / rnam shes gsum po gnyis su med //
translated: Thus, the body, nāda, and consciousness are nondual.

original: rnam shes las skyes n'a da ste //
analyzed: rnam shes las skyes n'a da ste //
translated: Nāda arises from consciousness,

original: de yis kyang ni sprul pa sku //
analyzed: de yis kyang ni sprul pa sku //
translated: and it also emanates the nirmāṇakāya.

original: gnyis po bskyed par grub pa ste //
analyzed: gnyis po bskyed par grub pa ste //
translated: The two are established as produced.

original: rnam pa shes pa gang gis sprul //
analyzed: rnam pa shes pa gang gis sprul //
translated: By which consciousness is the emanation?

original: ma skyes pa yi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: The nature of the unborn

original: rnam shes de ni 'od gsal lo //🔽de yis kyang ni bskyed pa gang //
analyzed: rnam shes de ni 'od gsal lo // de yis kyang ni bskyed pa gang //
translated: is the clear light of consciousness.🔽And what is produced by that?

original: de yang ji ltar skyes par brjod //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar skyes par brjod //
translated: How can that also be called born?

original: de phyir sku dang n'a da ste //🔽gnyis po 'di ni ma skyes pa //
analyzed: de phyir sku dang n'a da ste // gnyis po 'di ni ma skyes pa //
translated: Therefore, the body and nāḍī🔽are both unborn.

original: gnyis ka skyes par ma grub na //
analyzed: gnyis ka skyes par ma grub na //
translated: If both are not established as born,

original: ma skyes pa ni bden par brjod //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni bden par brjod //
translated: the unborn is said to be true.

original: zhes pa 'gro kun ma skyes pa //
analyzed: zhes pa 'gro kun ma skyes pa //
translated: Thus all beings are unborn

original: 'od gsal ba yi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba yi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: and the nature of clear light.

original: ma rig pa yi gdug sems kyis //
analyzed: ma rig pa yi gdug sems kyis //
translated: By the poison of the mind of ignorance,🔽birth is imagined.

original: skye ba ru ni yongs su brtag / de ni rnam dag don 'di nyid //
analyzed: skye ba ru ni yongs su brtag / de ni rnam dag don 'di nyid //
translated: This very pure meaning

original: snying brtse ldan pa gtso chen po //
analyzed: snying brtse ldan pa gtso chen po //
translated: is the great compassion of the chief one.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med kyi rdo rje //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med kyi rdo rje //
translated: The indivisibility of the two

original: dag pa dag ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: dag pa dag ni bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained to be pure.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thugs rnam par dag pa nag po chen po phyag gnyis pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thugs rnam par dag pa nag po chen po phyag gnyis pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can /
translated: Therefore, the pure mind is black, two-armed Mahādeva, the nature of wisdom and method.

original: shes rab dang bral ba'o ;
analyzed: shes rab dang bral ba'o ;
translated: He is without wisdom.

original: / phyag bzhi pa sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po nyid las shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pas sdo dang dmar ba'o //
analyzed: / phyag bzhi pa sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po nyid las shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pas sdo dang dmar ba'o //
translated: The four-armed one is blue, because of the white and black, wisdom and means are inseparable, so he is blue and red.

original: phyag drug pa sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po dang / nyi ma ni dmar po nyid las rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa ste shes rab dang thabs kyi phyag drug pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug pa sngon po ni dkar po dang nag po dang / nyi ma ni dmar po nyid las rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa ste shes rab dang thabs kyi phyag drug pa'o //
translated: The six-armed one is blue, because of the white, black, and red, the three vajras are inseparable, so he has six arms of wisdom and means.

original: phyag bcu drug pa ni nag bo dang dmar po dang dkar po'i zhal gsum mo //
analyzed: phyag bcu drug pa ni nag bo dang dmar po dang dkar po'i zhal gsum mo //
translated: The sixteen-armed one has three faces, black, red, and white.

original: du ba lta bus rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: du ba lta bus rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The smoky one is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: lhag ma'i zhal ni bung ba bzhin //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma'i zhal ni bung ba bzhin //🔽zhes pa ste /
translated: The remaining faces are like bees.

original: dga' ba bzhi'i dbye bas zhal brgyad dang shes rab dang thabs rnam par dag pas phyag bcu drug pa'o zhes pa phyag gnyis pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa dang phyag bcu drug pa'i he ru ka bzhi po 'di dag gong nas gong du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pas blta bar bya'o zhes pa le'u gsum po zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor dri
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi'i dbye bas zhal brgyad dang shes rab dang thabs rnam par dag pas phyag bcu drug pa'o zhes pa phyag gnyis pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa dang phyag bcu drug pa'i he ru ka bzhi po 'di dag gong nas gong du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pas blta bar bya'o zhes pa le'u gsum po zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor dri
translated: These four Herukas of two, four, six, and sixteen hands are to be seen as the indivisibility of the pristine consciousness maṇḍala and the samaya maṇḍala, higher and higher.

original: ma med pa las le'u gsum pa'o /
analyzed: ma med pa las le'u gsum pa'o /
translated: The third chapter is from the Stainless Union.

original: // / da ni rdo rje rigs kyi le'u la sogs pa gsum gyis rdo rje gsum mngon par brjod nas /
analyzed: // / da ni rdo rje rigs kyi le'u la sogs pa gsum gyis rdo rje gsum mngon par brjod nas /
translated: Now, having explained the three chapters of the vajra family and so on, the expression of the three vajras,

original: de dag dbyer med pa bzhi pa dbang bskur ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag dbyer med pa bzhi pa dbang bskur ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: the fourth chapter, the conferral of empowerment, will be explained.

original: dbang bskur ba ni kun nas 'khyud pa ste ji srid sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / dri ma med par byed pa zhes pa'o //🔽lha rnams kyis dbang bskur ba @103a * //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni kun nas 'khyud pa ste ji srid sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / dri ma med par byed pa zhes pa'o // lha rnams kyis dbang bskur ba @103a * //
translated: The consecration is the embrace, which is the purification and the stainlessness by the removal of the obscurations.

original: ni lha dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: ni lha dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The consecration by the gods is the consecration of the gods.

original: de yang pad ni g-yogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang pad ni g-yogs pa ste /
translated: And that is the lotus, which is the covering.

original: de len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir lha dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir lha dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
translated: Because it takes up and holds that, it is the chapter on the consecration of the gods.

original: de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: rab tu bstan par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bstan par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: It should be fully taught.

original: rang gi snying gar rang gi sa bon las 'thon pa'i 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pas /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar rang gi sa bon las 'thon pa'i 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pas /
translated: From one's seed syllable in one's heart center, black light rays in the form of hooks

original: khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs la /
analyzed: khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs la /
translated: invite all the buddhas residing in the three realms.

original: ma mo brgyad kyis yang dag par mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ma mo brgyad kyis yang dag par mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with the eight mothers, one should make a supplication.

original: rang gi snying gar zhes pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa'i lha'i snying gar rang gi sa bon h'um yig ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar zhes pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa'i lha'i snying gar rang gi sa bon h'um yig ste /
translated: The seed syllable is the syllable hūṃ.

original: sa bon de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sa bon de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
translated: From the transformation of that seed syllable comes a vajra.

original: de'i lte ba'i nang nas 'thon cing spros te 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pa sdigs mdzub lta bu mtshon par byed pa'i rang bzhin des /
analyzed: de'i lte ba'i nang nas 'thon cing spros te 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pa sdigs mdzub lta bu mtshon par byed pa'i rang bzhin des /
translated: From the center of that vajra emerges and emanates a black light ray in the form of a threatening gesture, which is the nature of an iron hook.

original: mtshon par bya ba'i rang bzhin khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad bkug cing spyan drangs la /🔽ma mo brgyad rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba'i rang bzhin khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad bkug cing spyan drangs la / ma mo brgyad rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: By that, one should summon and invite the nature of what is to be summoned, all the buddhas residing in the three realms.🔽Having been summoned, they are perfectly worshipped by the eight mothers and the eight yoginīs.

original: pi wang ma dang / gling bu ma la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod byas nas /
analyzed: pi wang ma dang / gling bu ma la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod byas nas /
translated: Having been perfectly worshipped by the eight goddesses such as the lute player and the flute player,

original: rjes su phye nas don du gnyer zhing gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su phye nas don du gnyer zhing gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: one should open the door and supplicate with a request.

original: yang na rang gi snying gar zhes pa bsdus nas snying gar bkug pa na /
analyzed: yang na rang gi snying gar zhes pa bsdus nas snying gar bkug pa na /
translated: Or else, at one's heart is a contraction of having drawn it into one's heart.

original: yo g'i zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: yo g'i zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
translated: Then, one becomes of the nature of the yoga of hatred.

original: zhes pa 'dis mi bskyod pa'i ngo bos rdzogs pa'i lha'i snying gar rang gi sa bon las zhes pa h'um yig gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang las 'thon pa'i 'od zer nag po zhes pa /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis mi bskyod pa'i ngo bos rdzogs pa'i lha'i snying gar rang gi sa bon las zhes pa h'um yig gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang las 'thon pa'i 'od zer nag po zhes pa /
translated: This means that from the seed at one's heart, which is of the nature of Akshobhya, light rays emanate, which are black, from the vajra holder, which is Vajradhara, who is of the nature of the seed syllable hum.

original: spros pa'i mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: spros pa'i mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The light rays are the gnosis of clear light, which is of the nature of Akshobhya, who is the emanation.

original: 'od zer lcags gyu'i rnam pa des //
analyzed: 'od zer lcags gyu'i rnam pa des //
translated: The light rays are in the form of iron hooks.

original: zhes pa a'am aa yig la sogs pa aam yig gi bar gyis mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa a'am aa yig la sogs pa aam yig gi bar gyis mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'o //
translated: The fifteen dakinis are the vowels from a to am.

original: de rnams rtogs pa'i phyir aam dku sha'o //
analyzed: de rnams rtogs pa'i phyir aam dku sha'o //
translated: The am is the goad, which is for the purpose of realizing those.

original: de yang rnam pa ni bdag med ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa ni bdag med ma'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, the form is the nature of Nairatmya.

original: rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med par byer med pa des /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med par byer med pa des /
translated: The nondual Vajradhara and Nairatmya

original: khams gsum na bzhugs ba sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: khams gsum na bzhugs ba sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa ni khams gsum mo //
translated: are the three realms, which are the indivisible body, speech, and mind of those who dwell in the three realms.

original: der bzhugs pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams spyan drangs shing bsdus la /
analyzed: der bzhugs pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams spyan drangs shing bsdus la /
translated: The five Tathagatas, who are the nature of the five intuitions, mirror-like intuition, etc., are invited and absorbed into the one who is seated there, who is the nature of those five.

original: ma mo brgyad kyis ces pa goo r'i la sogs pa lngas yul lnga dang / sha ba r'i @103b la sogs pa gsum gyis rdo rje gsum mo //🔽'di rnams kyang ma lta bur skyed par byed pa ste /🔽gzung bas mngon par zhen pas 'dzin pa nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyis ka yang lha'i rnam pas rnam par sbyang bar bya zhing sgrib pa dang bral ba'i ched du'o //🔽yang dag par mchod de /🔽yang dag pa /
analyzed: ma mo brgyad kyis ces pa goo r'i la sogs pa lngas yul lnga dang / sha ba r'i @103b la sogs pa gsum gyis rdo rje gsum mo // 'di rnams kyang ma lta bur skyed par byed pa ste / gzung bas mngon par zhen pas 'dzin pa nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro // gnyis ka yang lha'i rnam pas rnam par sbyang bar bya zhing sgrib pa dang bral ba'i ched du'o // yang dag par mchod de / yang dag pa /
translated: The eight mothers are Gauri, etc. The five of them are the five objects, and the three, Shavari, etc., are the three vajras.

original: mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas /
translated: They are mothers because they generate.

original: dbang po dang yul dag la mngon par zhen pa med pa rab tu 'jug pa'i 'di nyid ni yang dag pa'i mchod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dag la mngon par zhen pa med pa rab tu 'jug pa'i 'di nyid ni yang dag pa'i mchod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are mothers because they generate, since they are the objects of the act of perception, and they are the objects of the act of perception, since they are the objects of the act of analyzed: gsol ba gdab par ya'o zhes pa rjes su mtshungs pa la / mtshungs pa nyid kyis gsol ba gang ba ste /
translated: The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The word please is added to the end of all the requests.

original: mgon po'i ngo bo rgyur par bya'o //🔽'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma dag la dbye ba med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po'i ngo bo rgyur par bya'o // 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma dag la dbye ba med do zhes pa'o //

analyzed: de ci ltar gsol ba gdab ce na / de'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: aa bhi shi nytsa tu m'i sarba t'a tha ga t'a zhes pa rnam pa thams cad kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du bdag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mdzad du gsol zhes pa'o // yang na bdag la dbang bskur du gsol / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bdag la mdzad du gsol zhes pa ste /
translated: The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The word please is added to the end of all the requests.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word please is added to the end of all the requests.🔽The

original: sangs rgyas de rnams kyis he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de rnams kyis he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis /
translated: Those Buddhas, in the form of Heruka,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: with the vases filled with the five nectars, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas, should confer the initiation.

original: sangs rgyas de rnams kyis he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de rnams kyis he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, in the form of Heruka, is a metonym.

original: gzhan du lha gang bsgom par bya ba'i lha de dang de nyid kyi gzugs kyis blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du lha gang bsgom par bya ba'i lha de dang de nyid kyi gzugs kyis blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that one should see the form of that and that deity who is to be meditated upon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin /
translated: The nature of the five Tathagatas,

original: bdud rtsi lngar bsgrubs pa'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur zhing brkur zhing bkru bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lngar bsgrubs pa'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur zhing brkur zhing bkru bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: the vases filled with the five nectars, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas, should confer the initiation and should be sprinkled and washed.

original: yang na / sangs rgyas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin de rnams kyis he ru ka'i rnam par gzugs gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: yang na / sangs rgyas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin de rnams kyis he ru ka'i rnam par gzugs gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Or else, those Buddhas, which are the nature of the five intuitions, such as the mirror-like intuition, etc., in the form of Heruka, with the nature of non-duality,

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdud rtsi lngar gyur pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdud rtsi lngar gyur pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: Therefore, by the nature of the five gnoses which are the five nectars,

original: de nyid bdud rtsi lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi lnga'o //
translated: those are the five nectars.

original: bum pa de rnams kyis kam bde ba'i ye shes dang / la sha ba rol sgeg gi phyir ye shes kyi ngo bor gcig pa'i bum pa lnga'i bdag nyid de rnams kyis phung po @104a * //
analyzed: bum pa de rnams kyis kam bde ba'i ye shes dang / la sha ba rol sgeg gi phyir ye shes kyi ngo bor gcig pa'i bum pa lnga'i bdag nyid de rnams kyis phung po @104a * //
translated: By those five vases which are of the nature of the single essence of gnosis, the vase of the bliss of the syllable kam, and the vase of the play of passion of the syllable lasha,

original: lnga po 'di rnams la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di rnams la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: one should confer initiation on these five aggregates.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid thob par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid thob par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should attain freedom from all obscurations.

original: dbang bskur zhing khrus bya ba 'di lta bu'i skad cig la spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur zhing khrus bya ba 'di lta bu'i skad cig la spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: In this instant of conferring initiation and bathing, one becomes the lord of one's own family on the crown.

original: 'di ni he ru ka rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni he ru ka rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This is the completion of Heruka.

original: yang na dpang bskur ba na zhes pa sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid thob par gyur pa na me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa me tog rdul dang char byang chub kyi sems kyi khu ba ni me tog gi char 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dpang bskur ba na zhes pa sgrib pa dang bral ba nyid thob par gyur pa na me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa me tog rdul dang char byang chub kyi sems kyi khu ba ni me tog gi char 'bab pa ste /
translated: Or, when the witness is given, that is, when one attains freedom from obscuration, a rain of flowers falls. The rain of flowers is the nectar of bodhicitta.

original: gnyis su med pa rtogs pas sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa rtogs pas sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: By realizing nonduality, one becomes the nirmāṇakāya.🔽The sound of “na” arises, that is, the sound of the drum, which has the nature of two nāḍīs, is the nature of the āli, and arises above the nāḍī.

original: nga'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa rnga'i sgra ni n'a nga'i phreng ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can a'a li'i rang bzhin gyis n'a de steng du 'byung zhing n'a da gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ye shes spro ba'i phyir /🔽longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //🔽gur gum gyi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa gur gum ni bdag med ma byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'o ;
analyzed: nga'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa rnga'i sgra ni n'a nga'i phreng ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can a'a li'i rang bzhin gyis n'a de steng du 'byung zhing n'a da gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i ye shes spro ba'i phyir / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur 'gyur ro // gur gum gyi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa gur gum ni bdag med ma byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'o ;
translated: Because the gnosis of the indivisibility of the two nāḍīs is emitted, one becomes the saṃbhogakāya.🔽A rain of saffron falls. Saffron is the coemergent bodhicitta of Nairātmya.

original: / char ni thabs kyi bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems zhu ba ste /
analyzed: / char ni thabs kyi bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems zhu ba ste /
translated: The rain is the melting of bodhicitta, which has the nature of the method.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med par 'bab pa chos kyi skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med par 'bab pa chos kyi skur 'gyur ro //
translated: The two inseparable are the dharmakāya.🔽One should worship with Rūpavajrā, etc.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa de las gzugs rdo rje ma dang / sgra rdo rje ma dang / dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang /
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa de las gzugs rdo rje ma dang / sgra rdo rje ma dang / dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang /
translated: The three vajras, which are the nature of wisdom and method, are inseparable. From that, Rūpavajrā, Śabdavajrā, Gandhavajrā, Rasavajrā,

original: reg bya rdo rje ma dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma zhes pa drug mi phyed pas bskyed pa ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma zhes pa drug mi phyed pas bskyed pa ni mchod pa'o //
translated: and Sparśavajrā, and the six Dharmadhātuvajrā are generated by the indivisible.

original: mi phyed pa'i sgra ni rdo rje'i glu ste /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i sgra ni rdo rje'i glu ste /
translated: The indivisible sound is the vajra song.

original: spyan la sogs pa 'byung pa chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin rnams kyis blang bar bya zhing mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa 'byung pa chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin rnams kyis blang bar bya zhing mtshon par bya ste /
translated: The eyes, etc., which are the nature of the four great elements, should be taken up and indicated.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes rab tu rtogs par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes rab tu rtogs par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: The signless nature, the nature of the two maṇḍalas, should be realized as the gnosis of Vajradhara.

original: dbang bskur te /
analyzed: dbang bskur te /
translated: One should confer empowerment.

original: sgrib pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba nyid thob par gyur pa na /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba nyid thob par gyur pa na /
translated: When one has attained the nature free from obscuration, luminosity,

original: spyi bor spyi gtsug tu byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: spyi bor spyi gtsug tu byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i rang bzhin la /
translated: on the crown of the head, the nature of the melting bodhicitta,

original: rang gi rigs kyi dbang po mi bskyod ba lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dbang po mi bskyod ba lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: the lord of one's own family becomes the essence of the co-emergent Akṣobhya.

original: 'dis ni rgyu 'dis he ru ka rdzogs pa'o zhes pa rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni he ru ka nyid de he ru ka'i sgra'i don yang /
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu 'dis he ru ka rdzogs pa'o zhes pa rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni he ru ka nyid de he ru ka'i sgra'i don yang /
translated: This states that by this cause, Heruka is perfected. The perfected is Heruka himself. The meaning of the word Heruka

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rgyu sogs spangs pa zhes pa 'dis gsal bar bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rgyu sogs spangs pa zhes pa 'dis gsal bar bshad do //
translated: is also clearly explained by the Blessed One himself with having abandoned cause and so forth.

original: thun gsum du byin gyis brlabs pa'i @104b bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms nas langs te /
analyzed: thun gsum du byin gyis brlabs pa'i @104b bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms nas langs te /
translated: Having meditated on the meditation of the consecration into three sessions, one should arise.

original: lha'i skur gzhag par bya'o zhes pa snga dro dang nyin gung dang phyi dro'i dus su byin gyis brlab pa'i sgom pa bskyed par snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par bsgoms nas gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir langs te /
analyzed: lha'i skur gzhag par bya'o zhes pa snga dro dang nyin gung dang phyi dro'i dus su byin gyis brlab pa'i sgom pa bskyed par snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par bsgoms nas gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir langs te /
translated: One should abide in the deity's body means that, having meditated on the generation of the consecration yoga in the morning, noon, and evening, one should arise from abiding in the nondual nature.

original: spro bas gnas par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: spro bas gnas par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should abide in the deity's body means that, having meditated on the generation of the consecration yoga in the morning, noon, and evening, one should arise from abiding in the nondual nature.

original: yang na thun gsum du byin gyis brlab pa bsgom pa zhes pa /
analyzed: yang na thun gsum du byin gyis brlab pa bsgom pa zhes pa /
translated: Alternatively, one should meditate on the consecration in three sessions means

original: thun gsum ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang / gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: thun gsum ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang / gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ye shes so //
translated: the three sessions are the wisdom mandala, the commitment mandala, and the wisdom of the mandala of the inseparability of both.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa bsgom pa zhes pa dbang bskur ba'i bar gyis sgrib pa med pa'i gnas thob pa'o ;
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa bsgom pa zhes pa dbang bskur ba'i bar gyis sgrib pa med pa'i gnas thob pa'o ;
translated: One should meditate on the consecration means that one attains the state of nonobstruction by the empowerment.

original: bsgoms nas langs te zhes pa'i don ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: bsgoms nas langs te zhes pa'i don ni brjod zin to //
translated: The meaning of having meditated, one should arise has been explained.

original: lha'i skur gzhag par bya'o zhes pa /
analyzed: lha'i skur gzhag par bya'o zhes pa /
translated: One should abide in the deity's body means

original: lha ni ye shes te don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni ye shes te don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the deity is wisdom, ultimate truth.

original: sku ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: sku ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: The body is relative truth.

original: bden pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid kyis lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid kyis lha'i sku'o //
translated: The body of the deity is the nature of the two truths.

original: gzhag par bya'o zhes ba rdo rje 'chang gi gnas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o zhes ba rdo rje 'chang gi gnas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One should place means one should complete the state of Vajradhara.

original: dbang bskur pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o zhes pa /
analyzed: dbang bskur pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o zhes pa /
translated: This is the fourth chapter.

original: kun nas sgrib pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas sgrib pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one that removes all obscurations.

original: de yang / phat ni g-yogs pa ste de len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
analyzed: de yang / phat ni g-yogs pa ste de len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //
translated: And that is a chapter because it takes up and holds the word phaṭ.

original: bzhi pa ni bzhi rnams kyi rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bzhi rnams kyi rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the completion of the four.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the nature of the innate, is the meaning.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi le'us sku rdo rje dang / sngags kyi le'us gsung rdo rje dang / lha'i le'us thugs rdo rje dang / dbang bskur ba'i le'us rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o zhes pa bzhi pa'o //🔽las kyi phyag rgya la dga' ba bzhi'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi le'us sku rdo rje dang / sngags kyi le'us gsung rdo rje dang / lha'i le'us thugs rdo rje dang / dbang bskur ba'i le'us rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o zhes pa bzhi pa'o // las kyi phyag rgya la dga' ba bzhi'i rim pas so //
translated: The chapter on the vajra family is the vajra body, the chapter on mantra is the vajra speech, the chapter on the deity is the vajra mind, and the chapter on initiation is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽This is the fourth.🔽The yoga of caṇḍālī is by means of the four joys in the stage of the karma consort.

original: chos kyi phyag rgyal 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgyal 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of caṇḍālī is by means of the four cakras in the stage of the dharma consort.

original: phyag rgya chen po la phyag rgya bzhi dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la phyag rgya bzhi dbyer med pas so //
translated: In the great seal, the four seals are inseparable.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: In the pledge seal, one fully awakens to the state of omniscience.

original: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes chapter four of the Illuminating Lamp Commentary on the Concise Saṁvara Tantra called “The Stainless.”

original: // / da ni de nas de kho na'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: // / da ni de nas de kho na'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on reality will be explained.

original: de la de kho na bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la de kho na bzhi ste /
translated: There are four realities:

original: bdag gi de bon dang / sngags kyi de kho na dang / lha'i de kho na dang / ye shes kyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi de bon dang / sngags kyi de kho na dang / lha'i de kho na dang / ye shes kyi de kho na'o //
translated: the reality of the self, the reality of mantra, the reality of deity, and the reality of gnosis.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur bdag gi de kho na'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur bdag gi de kho na'o //
translated: In the Vajra Family chapter, there is the reality of the self.

original: sngags kyi le'ur sngags kyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi le'ur sngags kyi de kho na'o //
translated: In the Mantra chapter, there is the reality of mantra.

original: lha'i le'ur lha'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: lha'i le'ur lha'i de kho na'o //
translated: In the Deity chapter, there is the reality of deity.🔽In the Empowerment chapter, there is the reality of gnosis.

original: dbang bskur ba'i le'ur ye shes kyi de kho na'o zhes pa de kho na bzhi mngon par brjod nas bzhi po dbyer med @105a * //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i le'ur ye shes kyi de kho na'o zhes pa de kho na bzhi mngon par brjod nas bzhi po dbyer med @105a * //
translated: Having described these four realities, the four are inseparable.

original: pa las shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rdo rje 'chang nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: pa las shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rdo rje 'chang nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the wisdom of the utterly pure realm of reality, Vajradhara himself, it is said:

original: de nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa nyid kyis de kho na'i le'ur rab tu bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa nyid kyis de kho na'i le'ur rab tu bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, immediately and without interruption, it should be fully explained in the chapter on thatness.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ngo bos gzugs med ces pa rang gi gzugs ni ngo po ste /
analyzed: ngo bos gzugs med ces pa rang gi gzugs ni ngo po ste /
translated: Formless by nature, its form is its nature.

original: gang gi gzugs gang yin pa de ni de'i gzugs te /
analyzed: gang gi gzugs gang yin pa de ni de'i gzugs te /
translated: The form of that is its form.

original: de ni ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo'o //
translated: That is its nature.

original: de na de med de /
analyzed: de na de med de /
translated: It does not exist there.

original: de ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gang gi tshe /
translated: Also, in the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: gzugs nyid gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs nyid gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: when form itself is free from the nature of form,

original: tshor ba nyid dang / 'du shes nyid dang / 'du byed rnams nyid dang / gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba nyid dang / 'du shes nyid dang / 'du byed rnams nyid dang / gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: when feeling itself, perception itself, mental formations themselves, and when consciousness itself is free from the nature of consciousness, and so on.

original: mthong ba yang med ces pa mthong ba yang mthong ba'i rang rang gi ngo bos med do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba yang med ces pa mthong ba yang mthong ba'i rang rang gi ngo bos med do zhes pa ste /
translated: And there is no seeing means that seeing is not by the nature of seeing itself.

original: le'u dang po bdag gi de kho na'o //
analyzed: le'u dang po bdag gi de kho na'o //
translated: Chapter One: The Thatness of the Self

original: sgra med thos pa po yang med //
analyzed: sgra med thos pa po yang med //
translated: There is no sound, and there is no hearer.

original: ces pa / de kho na ltar thams cad du ngo bos zhes pa sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa / de kho na ltar thams cad du ngo bos zhes pa sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: As it is, all should be supplied, and by nature.

original: sgra ni sgra'i ngo bos med do //
analyzed: sgra ni sgra'i ngo bos med do //
translated: Sound is not by the nature of sound.🔽Hearing is not by the nature of hearing.

original: thos pa ni thos pa'i ngo bos med do zhes pa sngags kyi le'u sngags kyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni thos pa'i ngo bos med do zhes pa sngags kyi le'u sngags kyi de kho na'o //
translated: Chapter Two: The Thatness of Mantra

original: dri med snom pa po yang med //
analyzed: dri med snom pa po yang med //
translated: There is no smell, and there is no smeller.

original: ces pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: ces pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: As it is, all should be supplied, and by nature.🔽 Smell is the object of the nose sense faculty, and the nose sense faculty dissolves into the nāḍī, and the mind is embraced by the nāḍī.

original: dri ni sna'i dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sna'i dbang po ni n'i da'i nang du thim pa'i phyir dang / sems ni n'a das 'khyud pa'i phyir de kho na gsum gyis lha'i le'u lha'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: dri ni sna'i dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sna'i dbang po ni n'i da'i nang du thim pa'i phyir dang / sems ni n'a das 'khyud pa'i phyir de kho na gsum gyis lha'i le'u lha'i de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, by those three thatness, it is the divine chapter, the thatness of the deity.

original: ro med myong ba bo yang med //
analyzed: ro med myong ba bo yang med //
translated: There is no taste, and there is no taster.

original: ces pa / ro ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: ces pa / ro ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: Taste is defined as that which is tasted.

original: de yang dbang bskur ba'i le'u ye shes kyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang dbang bskur ba'i le'u ye shes kyi de kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, the chapter on the consecration is the reality of intuition.

original: reg med reg pa po yang med //
analyzed: reg med reg pa po yang med //
translated: There is no contact, nor any experiencer of contact.

original: ces pa de kho na bzhi bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir dga' ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi dga' ba'i bar ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa de kho na bzhi bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir dga' ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi dga' ba'i bar ni reg pa'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the four realities, the contact is the joy and so forth up to the special joy.

original: sems med sems las byung ba'ang med //
analyzed: sems med sems las byung ba'ang med //
translated: There is no mind, nor anything mental.

original: ces pa lhan cig skyed pa'i dga' ba ni sems las 'das pa'i phyir drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: ces pa lhan cig skyed pa'i dga' ba ni sems las 'das pa'i phyir drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Since the joy of simultaneous origination is beyond the mind, it is the sixth, Vajradhara.

original: yang na ngo bos gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa bzhis de kho na bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na ngo bos gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa bzhis de kho na bzhi'o //
translated: Alternatively, the four realities are the four beginning with “formless by nature.”

original: gnyis po dag shes rab dang thabs kyis phye ba las /
analyzed: gnyis po dag shes rab dang thabs kyis phye ba las /
translated: The two are divided by means of wisdom and method.

original: reg med reg pa po yang med //
analyzed: reg med reg pa po yang med //
translated: There is no contact, nor any experiencer of contact.

original: sems med sems las byung ba'ang med //
analyzed: sems med sems las byung ba'ang med //
translated: There is no mind, nor anything mental.

original: ces pa de kho na bzhi bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa de kho na bzhi bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the collection of the four realities.

original: de ltar rim par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar rim par med pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, since there is no sequence,

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyi khams te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyi khams te /
translated: there are the realms of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: yul drug dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus @105b dang ; yid de /
analyzed: yul drug dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus @105b dang ; yid de /
translated: The six objects, and the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: dbang po drug po 'di dag gis rang bzhin khams gsum pa'o zhes brtags pa yongs su spang ba'i don du /
analyzed: dbang po drug po 'di dag gis rang bzhin khams gsum pa'o zhes brtags pa yongs su spang ba'i don du /
translated: These six faculties are the three realms by nature.

original: bskyed pa dang ni sring mo nyid //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang ni sring mo nyid //
translated: The sister is generated by the method of wisdom and means.

original: rnal 'byor rigs pas rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rigs pas rtag tu mchod //
translated: She is always worshipped by the yogin.

original: gang mtshos ma rdo rje ma //
analyzed: gang mtshos ma rdo rje ma //
translated: The untouchable is Vajrī.

original: gdol ma de bzhin bram ze mo //
analyzed: gdol ma de bzhin bram ze mo //
translated: The outcaste is the brahmin woman.

original: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis /
translated: By the rite of means and wisdom,

original: de nyid dga' bas rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: de nyid dga' bas rtag tu mchod //
translated: she is always worshipped with joy.

original: ces pa'i don go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa'i don go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is easy to understand.

original: yang na bskyed pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na bskyed pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga ste /
translated: Alternatively, the word generated refers to the five objects such as form.

original: gang phyir skye 'gro bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skye 'gro bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they generate living beings.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las phal cher gzung bar mngon par zhan pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las phal cher gzung bar mngon par zhan pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is clear that the majority of living beings are attached to objects, the faculties such as the eye are generated.

original: srid mo'i sgras mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: srid mo'i sgras mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ste /
translated: The word sister refers to the five faculties such as the eye.

original: gang phyir skal ba ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skal ba ston pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it shows the good fortune,

original: shes rab sring mo zhes bya nyid //
analyzed: shes rab sring mo zhes bya nyid //
translated: wisdom is called the sister.

original: ces pa'i gsung las /
analyzed: ces pa'i gsung las /
translated: From this statement,

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the five faculties such as the eye are so called because they apprehend the five objects such as form.

original: gnyis ka dag las rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: gnyis ka dag las rnal 'byor te /
translated: The yogi/nī is from both,

original: de rig pa'i phyir rnal 'byor rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rig pa'i phyir rnal 'byor rig pa'o //
translated: because he/she knows that, he/she is the knower of yoga.

original: rtag tu thams cad kyi tshe bar tshad med pa nyid kyis mchod cing gnyis su med pa'i rnam pas nye bar longs spyod par bya'o zhes ba 'dis rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad kyi tshe bar tshad med pa nyid kyis mchod cing gnyis su med pa'i rnam pas nye bar longs spyod par bya'o zhes ba 'dis rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Always, at all times, one should worship with immeasurable praise and enjoy with nondual form. This is the consecration of the vajra and lotus.

original: 'dis ni mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa yang bstan cing dbang po dang yul phrad pa las skyes pa rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir sku gsum byin gyis brlab pa yang mtshon no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa yang bstan cing dbang po dang yul phrad pa las skyes pa rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir sku gsum byin gyis brlab pa yang mtshon no //
translated: This also teaches the consecration of the eye, etc., and since consciousness arises from the contact of faculty and object, it also indicates the consecration of the three bodies.

original: gar ma dang chos ma dang rdo rje ma dang gdol ba mo dang bram ze mo ste //
analyzed: gar ma dang chos ma dang rdo rje ma dang gdol ba mo dang bram ze mo ste //
translated: The dancer, the Dharma woman, the vajra woman, the untouchable woman, and the brahmin woman.

original: rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan pa 'di rnams mchod cing goms par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan pa 'di rnams mchod cing goms par bya'o //
translated: One should worship and practice these, which possess the five families.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of means and wisdom.

original: zhes pa thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin yul dang dbang po dbyer med par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin yul dang dbang po dbyer med par rtogs pas so //
translated: By the realization of the inseparability of the object and the sense faculty, which are the nature of means and wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid dga' ba ni de kho na la rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid dga' ba ni de kho na la rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, delighting in reality is the attachment to reality itself.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyis rang gi ngo bos ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pas /
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyis rang gi ngo bos ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pas /
translated: By this very cause, one should know reality just as it is by nature.

original: gzugs med mthong ba bo yang med //
analyzed: gzugs med mthong ba bo yang med //
translated: There is no formless realm to be seen,

original: ces pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: and so on up to

original: sems med sems las byung ba'ang med //
analyzed: sems med sems las byung ba'ang med //
translated: no mind, no mental factors.

original: ces pa'i bar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis /
translated: By the inseparability of the three vajras,

original: de lo na ste /
analyzed: de lo na ste /
translated: one should know the reality

original: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / ye shes lnga dbyer med pas mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / ye shes lnga dbyer med pas mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: of the mandala that has the nature of the fifteen dakinis, by the inseparability of the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five pristine awarenesses.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang dbyer med pas yul drug dang / dbang po drug dang / rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin gyis bco brgyad @106a * //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang dbyer med pas yul drug dang / dbang po drug dang / rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin gyis bco brgyad @106a * //
translated: Since one is inseparable from Vajrasattva, one should rely on the eighteen, the nature of the six objects, the six sense faculties, and the six consciousnesses.

original: de ; phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang ngo //🔽ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar //
analyzed: de ; phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang ngo // ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are also like that.🔽How should one rely on them?

original: rab tu 'bad pas bsten par bya //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas bsten par bya //
translated: One should rely on them with great effort, so that they are not known by anyone.

original: zhes pa 'di rnams bsten pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di rnams bsten pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: These are the reliance on the eighteen, which is contrary to the world.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽How should one rely on them?

original: zhes pa ji ltar 'ga' yang shes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu 'bad pa phul du byung ba 'bad pas bsten par bya ste /🔽'di rnams khu ba rdo rjer 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes pa ji ltar 'ga' yang shes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu 'bad pa phul du byung ba 'bad pas bsten par bya ste / 'di rnams khu ba rdo rjer 'gyur //
translated: One should rely on them with great effort, with the utmost effort, so that they are not known by anyone.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
translated: This is because of the statement, “These become the semen of the vajra.”

original: yang na bsten par bya zhing goms par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bsten par bya zhing goms par bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should rely on them and become familiar with them.

original: rab tu 'bad par bar chad med pas so //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad par bar chad med pas so //
translated: One should rely on them with great effort, without obstacles.

original: de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir //
translated: For that very reason,

original: ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar //
analyzed: ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar //
translated: how should one rely on them?

original: zhes pa ji ltar dbyer med par gyur pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ji ltar dbyer med par gyur pa ste //
translated: Thus, it is said that they become inseparable.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And also:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One has said:

original: dbyer med mtshan nyid grub pa na //
analyzed: dbyer med mtshan nyid grub pa na //
translated: “When the characteristic of inseparability is accomplished,

original: phyag rgya rnal 'byor bas 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag rgya rnal 'byor bas 'grub 'gyur //
translated: the yogin will accomplish the seal.🔽”

original: zhes so // gal te bye bar gyur na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // gal te bye bar gyur na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they were to become separated, what would happen then?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ma gsang sprul dang chom rkun dang // sa spyod me yis sdug bsngal byed ;
analyzed: ma gsang sprul dang chom rkun dang // sa spyod me yis sdug bsngal byed ;
translated: “The snake, the thief, the earth-dwelling, and the fire will cause suffering.🔽”

original: / gal te gsal por bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: / gal te gsal por bstan par gyur na /
translated: If it were to be revealed clearly,

original: de'i tshe sdug bsngal byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sdug bsngal byed do //
translated: then at that time, it would cause suffering.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: sbrul dang chom rkun dang me dang sa spyod rnams kyis te /
analyzed: sbrul dang chom rkun dang me dang sa spyod rnams kyis te /
translated: By the snake, the thief, the fire, and the earth-dwelling ones.

original: sa spyod ni stag la sogs pa'o //🔽de rnams kyis mi zad pa'i gnod pas dus byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa spyod ni stag la sogs pa'o // de rnams kyis mi zad pa'i gnod pas dus byed par 'gyur te /
translated: The earth-dwelling ones are tigers and so forth.🔽By those, there will be the death of the one who is harmed by the inexhaustible harm.

original: de nas dmyal bar 'gro ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal la brgyud mar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dmyal bar 'gro ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal la brgyud mar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, there will be the suffering of going to hell and so forth.

original: yang na ma gsang bar bye ba gzung ba dang / 'dzin par mngon par zhen na sdug bsngal byed de /
analyzed: yang na ma gsang bar bye ba gzung ba dang / 'dzin par mngon par zhen na sdug bsngal byed de /
translated: Or else, if one does not keep it secret, one is tormented by the fear of being seized and held.

original: sbrul dang chom rkun dang me dang sa spyod rnams kyis sdug bsngal bskyed pa las /
analyzed: sbrul dang chom rkun dang me dang sa spyod rnams kyis sdug bsngal bskyed pa las /
translated: One is tormented by the fear of snakes, thieves, fire, and the earth-guardians.

original: 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal byed pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal byed pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is tormented by the fear of the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is tormented by the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: gal te 'di rnams bsten pa bye ba las ni skyon du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams bsten pa bye ba las ni skyon du 'gyur na /
translated: If one is tormented by these when one relies on them,🔽what is the purpose of relying on them?

original: 'di rnams bsten pas dgos pa cir 'gyur zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams bsten pas dgos pa cir 'gyur zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba //
translated: The five families' seals

original: thar pa'i rgyur na brjod par bya //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyur na brjod par bya //
translated: are said to be the cause of liberation.

original: gar ma dang / tshos ma dang rdo rje ma dang gdol pa mo dang bram ze mo rnams ni rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes pa thar pa'i rgyur brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gar ma dang / tshos ma dang rdo rje ma dang gdol pa mo dang bram ze mo rnams ni rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes pa thar pa'i rgyur brjod par bya ste /
translated: The five families' seals are said to be the cause of liberation, namely, the dancer, the weaver, the vajra woman, the untouchable woman, and the brahmin woman.

original: thar pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: They are the cause of liberation.

original: yang na / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po de nyid rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes brjod par bya ste don bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang na / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po de nyid rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes brjod par bya ste don bshad zin to //
translated: Or else, those very five Tathagatas are called the five-family seals, the meaning of which has already been explained.

original: yang na / bye ba med par gyur na de nyid @106b phyag rgya lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na / bye ba med par gyur na de nyid @106b phyag rgya lnga ste /
translated: Or else, when they are not differentiated, they are the five seals,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan ma zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan ma zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: which are called the signs of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin kho na yul lnga'i rang bzhin phyag rgya lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin kho na yul lnga'i rang bzhin phyag rgya lnga'o //
translated: The five seals, whose nature is the five objects, are of the very nature of the five Tathagatas, who are inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thar pa thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thar pa thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they become the cause of attaining liberation.

original: phyag rgya'i sgra ni 'di rnams ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sgra ni 'di rnams ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term “seal” with regard to these?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje 'dis ni gdab bya ste //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje 'dis ni gdab bya ste //
translated: “One should seal with this vajra,

original: de la phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
analyzed: de la phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
translated: and it is called a seal.”

original: zhes pa / gang rdo rje zhes brjod pa'i rdo rje mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje de yis te /🔽yid ni dam pa'i bde ba za //
analyzed: zhes pa / gang rdo rje zhes brjod pa'i rdo rje mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje de yis te / yid ni dam pa'i bde ba za //
translated: The vajra that is called “vajra” is Akshobhya, the vajra of mind.

original: zhes pa'i tshig las reg bya ni yid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig las reg bya ni yid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The verse “the mind is the supreme bliss” indicates that touch is the object of the mind.

original: gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //
analyzed: gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //
translated: The dancer is Vajra-woman.

original: gdol pa mo dang bram ze mo //
analyzed: gdol pa mo dang bram ze mo //
translated: The outcaste is the Brahmin woman.

original: zhes pa / gang gsungs pa de rnams kyi dbus su gnas pa'i rdo rje'i rigs nyid dang por gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa / gang gsungs pa de rnams kyi dbus su gnas pa'i rdo rje'i rigs nyid dang por gsungs te /
translated: Among those mentioned, the Vajra family in the middle is mentioned first,

original: sems ni thams cad kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni thams cad kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because mind is the lord of all.

original: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
analyzed: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
translated: The lotus is the vajra, and likewise the action.🔽The Tathagata is the jewel,

original: de bzhin gshegs dang rin chen nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs dang rin chen nyid //
translated: and the jewel is the lotus.

original: slar yang gong du gzhag pa'i phyag rgya gnyis ni gar ma padma'i rigs te /
analyzed: slar yang gong du gzhag pa'i phyag rgya gnyis ni gar ma padma'i rigs te /
translated: The dancer is the lotus family,

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: and the outcaste is the vajra.🔽The outcaste is the jewel, and the dancer is the lotus.🔽The jewel is the vajra, and the lotus is the action.🔽The lotus is the vajra, and the vajra is the jewel.

original: tshos ma las kyi rigs te don yod grub pa'i rigs sku rdo rje'o //🔽slar rim pa ma yin pas mtha' nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshos ma las kyi rigs te don yod grub pa'i rigs sku rdo rje'o // slar rim pa ma yin pas mtha' nas brtsams te /
translated: The vajra is the action, and the action is the lotus.🔽The action is the vajra, and the vajra is the jewel.🔽The jewel is the lotus, and the lotus is the action.🔽The action is the lotus, and the lotus is the vajra.🔽The vajra is the jewel, and the jewel is the Tathagata.🔽The Tathagata is the action, and the action is the lotus.🔽The lotus is the vajra, and the vajra is the jewel.🔽The jewel is the lotus, and the lotus is the Tathagata.

original: bram ze mo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sku rdo rje ste /
analyzed: bram ze mo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sku rdo rje ste /
translated: The Tathagata is the vajra, and the vajra is the action.🔽The action is the jewel, and the jewel is the lotus.🔽The lotus is the vajra, and the vajra is the action.🔽The action is the jewel, and the jewel is the lotus.

original: don yod grub pa ni 'di nyid la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir /🔽'di dang por gsungs so ;
analyzed: don yod grub pa ni 'di nyid la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir / 'di dang por gsungs so ;
translated: The lotus is the Tathagata, and the Tathagata is the action.🔽The action is the jewel, and the jewel is the lotus.🔽The lotus is the vajra, and the vajra is the jewel.🔽The jewel is the lotus, and the lotus is the vajra.🔽The vajra is the jewel, and the jewel is the lotus.🔽The lotus is the action, and the action is the Tathagata.🔽The Tathagata is the vajra, and the vajra is the jewel.🔽The jewel is the lotus, and the lotus is the action.🔽The action is the vajra, and the vajra is the jewel.🔽The jewel is the lotus, and the lotus is the Tathagata.🔽The Tathagata is the action, and the action is the vajra.

original: / gdol pa mo rin chen rigs te /
analyzed: / gdol pa mo rin chen rigs te /
translated: The vajra is the jewel, and the jewel is the lotus

original: rin chen dbang po'i rigs 'od dpag med gsung rdo rje la rab tu zhugs pas gsung rdo rje'o //🔽'od dpag med zla ba dang rin chen dbang po nyi ma ste /🔽zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid las gnyis ka bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis rgyas gdab par rigs so zhes rin chen dbang po'i rigs mtha' nyid du gsungs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po'i rigs 'od dpag med gsung rdo rje la rab tu zhugs pas gsung rdo rje'o // 'od dpag med zla ba dang rin chen dbang po nyi ma ste / zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid las gnyis ka bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis rgyas gdab par rigs so zhes rin chen dbang po'i rigs mtha' nyid du gsungs so zhes pa'o //
translated: The Vajra family is Amoghasiddhi, the action vajra, because it is the basis of the action vajra.🔽The Tathagata family is Vairocana, the mind vajra, because it is the basis of the mind vajra.🔽The Jewel family is Amitābha, the speech vajra, because it is the basis of the speech vajra.🔽The Lotus family is Akṣobhya, the body vajra, because it is the basis of the body vajra.🔽The Vajra family is Amoghasiddhi, the action vajra, because it is the basis of the action vajra.

original: snying rje chen po dam pa yi //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dam pa yi //
translated: The Tathagata family is Vairocana, the mind vajra, because it is the basis of the mind vajra.

original: rigs ni rnam pa lnga ru brjod //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa lnga ru brjod //
translated: The Jewel family is Amitābha, the speech vajra, because it is the basis of the speech vajra.🔽The Lotus family is Akṣobhya, the body vajra, because it is the basis of the body vajra.🔽The Vajra family is Amoghasiddhi, the action vajra, because it is the basis of the action vajra.

original: ces pa rim pa 'dis rigs rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ces pa rim pa 'dis rigs rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The Tathagata family is Vairocana, the mind vajra, because it is the basis of the mind vajra.🔽The Jewel family is Amitābha, the speech vajra, because it is the basis of the speech vajra.🔽The Lotus family is Akṣobhya, the body vajra, because it is the basis of the body vajra.

original: kye'i rdo rje snying po snying rje chen po zhes bod pa'o //🔽gnyis ka dbyer med pa las gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje snying po snying rje chen po zhes bod pa'o //🔽gnyis ka dbyer med pa las gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Vajra family is Amoghasiddhi, the

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen dbang po dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams lugs las bzlog pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa'i rim pas bram ze mo dang //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen dbang po dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams lugs las bzlog pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa'i rim pas bram ze mo dang //
translated: and in the forward order, the Brahmin woman,

original: gdol pa mo dang / gar ma @107a * //
analyzed: gdol pa mo dang / gar ma @107a * //
translated: the untouchable woman, the dancer,

original: dang / chos  ma dang / g-yung mo rnams gsungs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dang / chos  ma dang / g-yung mo rnams gsungs so zhes pa'o //
translated: the religious woman, and the prostitute.

original: yang na / rdo rje 'dis ni gdab bya ste //
analyzed: yang na / rdo rje 'dis ni gdab bya ste //
translated: Or, this vajra is to be cast,

original: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
analyzed: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
translated: therefore it is called a seal.

original: gdab par bya zhing mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: gdab par bya zhing mtshon par bya ste /
translated: It is to be cast and indicated.

original: rgyu 'dis ni phyag rgya zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis ni phyag rgya zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For this reason, it is called a seal.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that?

original: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
analyzed: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
translated: The vajra, lotus, and likewise the action,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen nyid //
translated: the tathāgata, and the jewel itself,

original: mi phyed pa'i rdo rje'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i rdo rje'i rgyu des na /
translated: by the cause of the indivisible vajra,

original: 'di dag thams cad phyag rgya zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad phyag rgya zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: all of these are to be called seals.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam pa'i rigs ni lnga nyid du brjod de ye shes kyi nges par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam pa'i rigs ni lnga nyid du brjod de ye shes kyi nges par gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the family of the excellent is said to be fivefold, because of the certainty of the intuition.

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the great compassion.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can 'di nyid ye shes te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can 'di nyid ye shes te /
translated: This very intuition is the intuition of the identity of the five intuitions of the nondual intuition of wisdom and means.

original: mthong ba po dang / mthong bar bya ba la sogs pa dbye ba med pa las shes rab dang thabs kyi tshogs de kho na la dga' bas mchod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba po dang / mthong bar bya ba la sogs pa dbye ba med pa las shes rab dang thabs kyi tshogs de kho na la dga' bas mchod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: From the nondifferentiation of the seer and the seen, etc., the assembly of wisdom and means should be worshipped with delight in that reality.

original: yang na sku'i sgras chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na sku'i sgras chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
translated: Or, the word “body” refers to the source of phenomena, Nairātmya.

original: de len cing 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It is taken and held,

original: de dang lhan cig dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir rigs rnams so //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir rigs rnams so //
translated: because it becomes the nature of the families that are inseparable from it.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: And that is fivefold.

original: rgyas par ni rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i rigs nyid las ji ltar mtha' yas pa'i rigs /
analyzed: rgyas par ni rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i rigs nyid las ji ltar mtha' yas pa'i rigs /
translated: In detail, it is the family of the infinite, from the very family of the infinite.
