original: sngags kyi le 'ur rab tu bshad cing le'u gzhan du yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi le 'ur rab tu bshad cing le'u gzhan du yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is explained in the chapter on mantra and will be explained in other chapters as well.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir dam pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid las snying rje chen po nyid dang / de nyid dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan pa'i phyir lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs las bzlog pas 'khrags 'khrugs su gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir dam pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid las snying rje chen po nyid dang / de nyid dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan pa'i phyir lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs las bzlog pas 'khrags 'khrugs su gsungs pa /
translated: For this very reason, the supreme indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate is great compassion itself, and in order to teach the characteristics of that very indivisibility, [the Bhagavān] speaks in a mixed order, in forward and reverse orders.

original: rdo rje'i phyag rgya g-yung mor 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phyag rgya g-yung mor 'gyur //
translated: The vajra mudrā is the ḍombī,

original: de bzhin padma gar ma nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin padma gar ma nyid //
translated: and likewise, the lotus is the dancer.

original: las ni tshos mar yang dag bshad ;
analyzed: las ni tshos mar yang dag bshad ;
translated: The action is explained as the washerwoman,

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa bram ze mo //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa bram ze mo //
translated: and the tathāgata is the brahmin woman.

original: rin chen gdol mar shes par bya //
analyzed: rin chen gdol mar shes par bya //
translated: The jewel is known as the caṇḍālī,

original: phyag rgya lngar ni rnam par nges //
analyzed: phyag rgya lngar ni rnam par nges //
translated: and the five mudrās are ascertained.

original: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
translated: These are the families of the tathāgatas,

original: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //
translated: which are expressed in brief.

original: mdor bsdus pas zhes pa yul dang rnam par shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyis rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir rdo rje la sogs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs yin te /🔽ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba'ang med //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas zhes pa yul dang rnam par shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyis rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir rdo rje la sogs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs yin te / ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba'ang med //
translated: The phrase in brief means that the objects and consciousnesses are the vajra and so forth, the families of the Tathagatas such as Akshobhya, because they are fully engaged in the nature of those [objects and consciousnesses].🔽 As it is said, The formless is seen by means of the essence.

original: ces pa la sogs pa thams cad gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa thams cad gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: And so forth.

original: yang na / gang gi phyir g-yung mo la sogs pa rnams ni phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yang na / gang gi phyir g-yung mo la sogs pa rnams ni phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Or, because the low-caste woman and so forth are the nature of the mudra,

original: @107b de'i phyir 'di rnams ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: @107b de'i phyir 'di rnams ni rdo rje ste /
translated: they are vajra.

original: mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje nyid do //
translated: Because of their indivisible nature, they are vajra.

original: de'i phyir rnam par nges te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par nges te /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes pa bral ba'i rang bzhin bral bar nges pa'am rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis nges pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes pa bral ba'i rang bzhin bral bar nges pa'am rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis nges pa ste /
translated: the Tathagata family is ascertained as being free from the nature of separation, or ascertained in the manner of various aspects.

original: de rnams stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because of the nature of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
translated: These are the families of the Tathagatas.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //
translated: They are to be expressed in brief.

original: zhes pa rigs ni ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes pa rigs ni ye shes te /
translated: The family is wisdom.

original: 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: This itself is the Tathagatas.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mdor bsdus pas yul dang rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas yul dang rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: In brief, the object and consciousness are

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ;
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ;
translated: of the nature of that.

original: de rnams la rab tu bsres pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rab tu bsres pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of their thorough mixing in those, they are the families of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word Tathagata?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽dpal ldan de bzhin nyid du gshegs //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / dpal ldan de bzhin nyid du gshegs //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽The glorious one has gone to suchness.

original: de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid //
translated: He has also come in just that way.

original: shes rab rigs pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: shes rab rigs pa 'di yis ni //
translated: By this reasoning of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs par mngon par brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par mngon par brjod //
translated: he is expressed as the Tathagata.

original: ces pa de bzhin nyid ni g-yung mo la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
analyzed: ces pa de bzhin nyid ni g-yung mo la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
translated: Suchness is the dakinis such as Dakini and so forth.

original: de rnams su gshegs pa ni rdo rje la sogs pa phyag rgya'i ngo bos rab tu zhugs pa'o zhes pa de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa'o //🔽byon pa zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma de rnams nyid la rdo rje la sogs pa phyag rgya'i ngo bos bdag nyid nges par rtogs par gyur pa'o zhes pa de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi phyir dpal ldan shr'i yig gnyis su med pa'i ye
analyzed: de rnams su gshegs pa ni rdo rje la sogs pa phyag rgya'i ngo bos rab tu zhugs pa'o zhes pa de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa'o // byon pa zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma de rnams nyid la rdo rje la sogs pa phyag rgya'i ngo bos bdag nyid nges par rtogs par gyur pa'o zhes pa de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi phyir dpal ldan shr'i yig gnyis su med pa'i ye
translated: Having gone to those, having entered into the nature of the seals such as the vajra, is “gone to thusness.”🔽Having come is that the self is realized through the nature of the seals such as the vajra of those dakinis.🔽Thus, having come is “thusness.”

original: shes de / 'di la yod pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shes de / 'di la yod pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The glorious one has that, because of having the nondual wisdom of the two Śrī Heruka syllables.

original: yang na de bzhin nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: Or, thusness is nonconceptuality.

original: der gshegs pa ni de'i nang du thim pa ji srid de'i ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: der gshegs pa ni de'i nang du thim pa ji srid de'i ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Having gone there is having dissolved into that, having become the nature of that.

original: de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid ces pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid ces pa /
translated: Having come is

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid la spro ba'i tshul gyis kyang rnam par gnas so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid la spro ba'i tshul gyis kyang rnam par gnas so zhes pa ste /
translated: that nonconceptual wisdom itself also abides in the manner of emanation.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa'i don bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “glorious” has been explained.

original: shes rab ces brjod pa'i rim pa don dam pa'i bden pa dang rigs pa zhes brjod pa'i rim pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ces brjod pa'i rim pa don dam pa'i bden pa dang rigs pa zhes brjod pa'i rim pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: The stage called “wisdom” is the ultimate truth, and the stage called “logic” is the relative truth.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs par mngon par brjod ces pa rdo rje 'chang gis tha snyad du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs par mngon par brjod ces pa rdo rje 'chang gis tha snyad du mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is the conventional expression of Vajradhara, who is called “the Tathāgata.”

original: da ni ngo bos gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa'i sdud pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ngo bos gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa'i sdud pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the summary of “formless by nature” and so on is stated.

original: rigs ni rnam pa drug tu brjod //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa drug tu brjod //
translated: The family is said to be sixfold.

original: ces pa / mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
analyzed: ces pa / mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
translated: The eye, ear, nose,🔽tongue,

original: lce dang lus @108a * //
analyzed: lce dang lus @108a * //
translated: body,

original: dang de bzhin yid //
analyzed: dang de bzhin yid //
translated: and likewise the mind,

original: gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //
translated: form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ro dang de bzhin reg bya ste //
analyzed: ro dang de bzhin reg bya ste //
translated: taste, and likewise touch,

original: chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: and the nature of the phenomena element—

original: 'di rnams rigs ni drug yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams rigs ni drug yin no //
translated: these are the six families.

original: mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: In brief, there are five types.

original: zhes pa de rnams mdor bsdus pa las rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhes pa de rnams mdor bsdus pa las rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Those are in brief five types.

original: yid ni de rnams la brjod do //
analyzed: yid ni de rnams la brjod do //
translated: The mind is said to be those.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: Later, it becomes threefold.

original: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad dang don yod grub pa dag shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis sku rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir don yong grub pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la bsdus so //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad dang don yod grub pa dag shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis sku rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir don yong grub pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la bsdus so //
translated: Vairocana and Amoghasiddhi are included in Vairocana, because the body is established as the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi 'od dpag med dang / rin chen dbang po dag rnam par gzhag pas rin chen dbang po ni 'od dpag med la bsdus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi 'od dpag med dang / rin chen dbang po dag rnam par gzhag pas rin chen dbang po ni 'od dpag med la bsdus so //
translated: Similarly, Amitābha and Ratnasaṃbha are established as speech, and Ratnasaṃbhava is included in Amitābha.

original: de bzhin du thugs kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs dag rnam par gzhag pas rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag tu med pa dag las bsdus pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs dag rnam par gzhag pas rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag tu med pa dag las bsdus pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the body, speech, and mind are established as the mind, and Vairocana and Amitābha are included in the mind.

original: de'i phyir phyi nas gzhan rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar 'gyur ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi nas gzhan rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar 'gyur ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, later, it should be understood that it becomes threefold.

original: yang na / rigs ni rnam pa drug du brjod //
analyzed: yang na / rigs ni rnam pa drug du brjod //
translated: Or, the family is said to be sixfold,

original: mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: in brief, fivefold,

original: rnam pa drug ces pa mig la sogs pa rnam pa drug gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de rnams ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ces pa mig la sogs pa rnam pa drug gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de rnams ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The six aspects are the six aspects of the nature of eye, etc.

original: rigs de rnams brjod pa ni sku bdag med ma'o ;
analyzed: rigs de rnams brjod pa ni sku bdag med ma'o ;
translated: The statement of the lineages is the non-self of the body.

original: / de len cing 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: / de len cing 'dzin pa ste /
translated: They are taken up and held,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir rigs rnams so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir rigs rnams so //
translated: because they are engaged in the nature of self by way of the nature of self.

original: brjod pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The statement is the consciousness.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mdor bsdus pas de rnams bsdus na slar rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas de rnams bsdus na slar rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In brief, they are included in five aspects.

original: spro ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa lda'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa lda'o //
translated: The nature of expansion has six aspects.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis ;
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis ;
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: / phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: / phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: later there are three aspects.

original: rnam pa gsum gang gi rnam pa yin pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang gi rnam pa yin pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That which has three aspects is the three aspects.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid dbyer med pa las gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid dbyer med pa las gcig gi tshig go //
translated: The nature of body, speech, and mind is indivisible, and so is the word one.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dbye ba spro ba'i tshul gyis sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas tha dang du rnam par gzhag pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba las ji srid rim pa las 'das pa rang bzhin med pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dbye ba spro ba'i tshul gyis sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas tha dang du rnam par gzhag pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba las ji srid rim pa las 'das pa rang bzhin med pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The divisions of body, speech, and mind are beyond the stages, and are said to be natureless.🔽The five families and the five elements

original: rigs dang 'byung ba lnga rnams dang // phung po lnga yi rang bzhin can //
analyzed: rigs dang 'byung ba lnga rnams dang // phung po lnga yi rang bzhin can //
translated: have the nature of the five aggregates.

original: rigs dang bgrang bya 'di yis ni //
analyzed: rigs dang bgrang bya 'di yis ni //
translated: By this enumeration of the families,

original: des na @108b rigs zhes mngon par brjod //
analyzed: des na @108b rigs zhes mngon par brjod //
translated: therefore, they are called “families.”

original: gal te rigs lnga po rnams mi bskyod pa la sogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rigs lnga po rnams mi bskyod pa la sogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the five families become Akshobhya and so on,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba sa /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba sa /
translated: by the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba de rnams kyi rigs nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba de rnams kyi rigs nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: they become the three aspects. What are their families?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / rigs su bya ba dang / bgrang bar bya ba grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rigs su bya ba dang / bgrang bar bya ba grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are to be made into families and are to be enumerated by number,

original: rgyu des na rigs zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na rigs zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: by that cause, they are to be called “families.”

original: 'byung ba lnga rnams zhes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga po rnams te /
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga rnams zhes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga po rnams te /
translated: The five great elements are the five great elements.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gzungs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gzungs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the five aggregates is the dhātu, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: de rnams gang la yod pa de ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de rnams gang la yod pa de ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: That which has those is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de rnams kyi rigs nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rigs nyid gang las she na /
translated: From what is their type?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rigs dang bgrang bya grangs su bya ba lnga yis grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i phyir rgyu des na /
analyzed: rigs dang bgrang bya grangs su bya ba lnga yis grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i phyir rgyu des na /
translated: The five types, enumerations, and numbers are completely defined by number.

original: rigs zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For that reason, they should be called “types.”

original: yang na / rigs zhes pa bdag med ma rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin rnams te /
analyzed: yang na / rigs zhes pa bdag med ma rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin rnams te /
translated: Or, the types are the nature of Nairātmya Yoginī.

original: de nas rgyas par 'byung ba lnga'i ngo bos ji lta ba bzhin rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nas rgyas par 'byung ba lnga'i ngo bos ji lta ba bzhin rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Then, the five elements are fully defined by the nature of the five elements.

original: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the five aggregates is the aggregates of form and so on.

original: de yang rgyas par na lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rgyas par na lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, they are five.

original: rgyu nges na rang bzhin de yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: rgyu nges na rang bzhin de yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin can no //
translated: If the cause is ascertained, then the nature is also truly existent just as it is, and therefore it has a nature.

original: de rnams kyi rigs dang bgrang bya lnga po nyid re re la lnga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rigs dang bgrang bya lnga po nyid re re la lnga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Each of those five types and enumerations has the nature of five,

original: de rnams kyang re re la lnga'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir mtha' yas shing grangs med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang re re la lnga'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir mtha' yas shing grangs med pa ste /
translated: and each of those becomes the nature of five, and therefore they are infinite and innumerable.

original: rgyu 'dis ni rigs yin zhing de'i ngo bos mngon par brjod do /
analyzed: rgyu 'dis ni rigs yin zhing de'i ngo bos mngon par brjod do /
translated: By this cause, it is a type, and by its nature, it is expressed.

original: rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: it should be established.

original: 'dis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang nyid ces pa'o //
translated: By this, it is Vajradhara itself by the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sgom pa po med bsgom bya med //
analyzed: sgom pa po med bsgom bya med //
translated: there is no meditator, there is no meditation.

original: ces pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid /
analyzed: ces pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid /
translated: Since the three vajras are inseparable, the nature of the five aggregates

original: ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba'ang med //
analyzed: ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba'ang med //
translated: is not seen by the nature of form.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de sdud pa gsungs pa ste /🔽bsgom pa po mthong ba med /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de sdud pa gsungs pa ste / bsgom pa po mthong ba med /
translated: What was said, such as “there is no meditator,” is summarized and explained.🔽There is no meditator.

original: bsgom bya gzugs med /
analyzed: bsgom bya gzugs med /
translated: There is no form to meditate on.

original: sngags med ces pa /
analyzed: sngags med ces pa /
translated: The phrase no mantra means

original: sngags sgra med /
analyzed: sngags sgra med /
translated: no sound of mantra.

original: thos pa po yang med /
analyzed: thos pa po yang med /
translated: There is also no hearer.

original: lha med ces pa /
analyzed: lha med ces pa /
translated: The phrase no deity means

original: dri med snom pa po yang med pa ste /
analyzed: dri med snom pa po yang med pa ste /
translated: no one to smell the fragrance.

original: 'dis ni sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum po dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum po dbyer med pa'o //
translated: This is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na med pa'i lta bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na med pa'i lta bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If everything is emptiness, then that would be the view of nihilism.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sngags dang lha ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: sngags dang lha ni yang dag gnas //
translated: The mantra and deity are truly present.

original: ci snying @109a * //
analyzed: ci snying @109a * //
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: zhe na / spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las sngags dang lha gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag spros pa ni sku'o //
analyzed: zhe na / spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las sngags dang lha gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag spros pa ni sku'o //
translated: From the nature free of elaborations, the mantra and deity, which are the vajra of speech and the vajra of mind, are elaborated as the vajra of body.

original: de yang ma lus pa de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ma lus pa de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And since that is not other than that, everything is present by nature.

original: yang na / sgom pa po med /
analyzed: yang na / sgom pa po med /
translated: Or, no meditator means

original: gang 'dzin pa nyid du brtags pa de dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dzin pa nyid du brtags pa de dgag pa'o //
translated: the refutation of that which is imagined to be the apprehender.

original: bsgom bya med ces pa gang gzung ba nyid du brtags pa de yang dgag pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom bya med ces pa gang gzung ba nyid du brtags pa de yang dgag pa'o //
translated: The phrase no meditation means the refutation of that which is imagined to be the object of apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngags med mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngags med mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, without mantra, without sign,

original: rang bzhin mtshan ma med pa nyid las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin mtshan ma med pa nyid las so //
translated: from the very absence of the sign of intrinsic reality.

original: lha med rnam par shes pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha med rnam par shes pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Without deity, consciousness also does not exist.

original: 'dis ni sgom pa po dang bsgom par bya ba dag bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgom pa po dang bsgom par bya ba dag bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This refutes the meditator and the object of meditation.

original: cho ga yang gsungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: cho ga yang gsungs pa'i phyir //
translated: The ritual is also stated.

original: sngags dang lha ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: sngags dang lha ni yang dag gnas //
translated: Mantra and deity are truly present.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las spros pa ni rgyas pa kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las spros pa ni rgyas pa kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: From the nature of non-elaboration, elaboration is the nature of the relative.

original: de thams cad dang bral ba nyid las spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad dang bral ba nyid las spros pa med pa'o //
translated: From the very absence of all that, there is non-elaboration.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin te /
translated: This is the nature.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'di rnams ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'di rnams ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: Because this has no intrinsic nature, these are not negated.🔽Or,

original: yang na / spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: yang na / spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: from the nature of non-elaboration,

original: zhes pa spros pa las 'das pa nyid las /
analyzed: zhes pa spros pa las 'das pa nyid las /
translated: from the very transcendence of elaboration,

original: sngags dang lha mtshan ma med pa nyid mtshan mar gnas te /
analyzed: sngags dang lha mtshan ma med pa nyid mtshan mar gnas te /
translated: mantra and deity abide as signlessness.

original: rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa nyid de kho nar nye bar bstan to zhes pa sgom pa po med bsgom bya med ces pa bdag gi de kho na rdo rje'i rigs kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa nyid de kho nar nye bar bstan to zhes pa sgom pa po med bsgom bya med ces pa bdag gi de kho na rdo rje'i rigs kyi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the vajra family of the self-reality is stated as “no meditator, no object of meditation.”

original: sngags med ces pa sngags kyi de kho na sngags kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: sngags med ces pa sngags kyi de kho na sngags kyi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the mantra is stated as “no mantra,” the reality of mantra.

original: lha med ces pa lha'i de kho na lha'i le'u'o //
analyzed: lha med ces pa lha'i de kho na lha'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the deity is stated as “no deity,” the reality of the deity.

original: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature free of elaborations,

original: sngags dang lha ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: sngags dang lha ni yang dag gnas //
translated: mantra and deity truly abide.

original: zhes pa ye shes kyi de kho na dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ye shes kyi de kho na dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the empowerment of the reality of gnosis is stated.🔽By the arrangement of the meditator’s eyes, etc., the six families of Vairocana, etc., are arranged as the object of meditation and the meditator.

original: sgom pa po nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rigs drug po rnams bsgom bya dang sgom byed kyi rnam par gzhag pas rnam par shes pa'i nang du thim pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgom pa po nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rigs drug po rnams bsgom bya dang sgom byed kyi rnam par gzhag pas rnam par shes pa'i nang du thim pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they dissolve into consciousness,

original: sems dpa' ni thams cad na yod pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni thams cad na yod pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: the heroes are present everywhere.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang / thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang / thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, and all the Buddhas are said to be the reality of the hero.

original: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid dang sems dpar brjod de /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid dang sems dpar brjod de /
translated: The nature of the five aggregates is said to be the reality and the hero.

original: sems pa srid pa gsum gcig pa zhes pa'i gsung las bsgom par bya ba dang sgom par byed pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid las srid pa @109b gsum ste /
analyzed: sems pa srid pa gsum gcig pa zhes pa'i gsung las bsgom par bya ba dang sgom par byed pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid las srid pa @109b gsum ste /
translated: From the statement “the mind is the unity of the three existences,” both the object of meditation and the meditator are inseparable bliss, and so on, realized as the nature of consciousness itself.

original: de'i gcig ni dbyer med pa nyid do zhes pa de kho na'i ngo bor brjod do //
analyzed: de'i gcig ni dbyer med pa nyid do zhes pa de kho na'i ngo bor brjod do //
translated: The three existences are one in it, which is said to be the nature of reality.

original: yang na tshangs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //🔽khyab 'jug ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do // khyab 'jug ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, Brahma is Vairochana,🔽Vishnu is Akshobhya,

original: zhi ba ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Shiva is Amoghasiddhi,

original: thams cad ni rin chen dbang po'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni rin chen dbang po'o //
translated: all is Ratnasambhava,

original: sangs rgyas ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: and the Buddha is Amitabha.

original: de nyid ni sems dpa' zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni sems dpa' zhes pa'o //
translated: That reality is said to be the hero.

original: yang na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rigs drug po rnams de'i ngo bo nyid kyis lnga nyid dang / mtha' yas pa'i rigs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rigs drug po rnams de'i ngo bo nyid kyis lnga nyid dang / mtha' yas pa'i rigs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the six families of Vairochana, etc., are five in essence, and the infinite families are the sixth.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽Vairochana, Akshobhya, Amoghasiddhi,

original: rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' ni //
translated: Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and the hero,

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhing dang ; / thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhing dang ; / thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Ishvara, and all are said to be Buddha.

original: ces pa'o // rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis de nyid du 'thad mod kyi /🔽tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yang /
analyzed: ces pa'o // rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis de nyid du 'thad mod kyi / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yang /
translated: Vairochana, etc., are indeed admissible as Tathagatas themselves.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how about Brahma, etc.?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: tshangs pa myang 'das sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: tshangs pa myang 'das sangs rgyas te //
translated: Brahma is nirvana, Buddha,

original: zhes pa / tshangs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pa las sangs rgyas zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa / tshangs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pa las sangs rgyas zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Brahma is said to be nirvana, and to be Buddha,

original: nyi tshe ba rtogs pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba rtogs pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because he realizes the limited.

original: nyams phyir khyab 'jug brjod par bya //
analyzed: nyams phyir khyab 'jug brjod par bya //
translated: Vishnu is said to be the enjoyment body,🔽because he enjoys the Dharma.

original: zhes pa nyams pa la bi sha ste /
analyzed: zhes pa nyams pa la bi sha ste /
translated: In the case of the degeneration of the world, Vishnu is the one who degenerates.

original: nyams pa ni 'jig pa yin zhing 'jig pa'i rang bzhin las khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: nyams pa ni 'jig pa yin zhing 'jig pa'i rang bzhin las khyab 'jug ste /
translated: Degeneration is destruction, and Vishnu is the one who has the nature of destruction.

original: nyi tsha ba rtogs pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tsha ba rtogs pas gnas pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is known as the sun.

original: yang na / 'jug phyir zhes pa 'jug pa la bi sha ste /
analyzed: yang na / 'jug phyir zhes pa 'jug pa la bi sha ste /
translated: Alternatively, Vishnu is the one who enters, because he enters.

original: thams cad du 'jug cing rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir khyab 'jug spro ba tsam rnam par gnas pa khyab 'jug sangs rgyas zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'jug cing rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir khyab 'jug spro ba tsam rnam par gnas pa khyab 'jug sangs rgyas zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: He is Vishnu, the Buddha, who is the mere manifestation that abides, because he enters and fully enters everything.

original: rtag tu dge bas zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: rtag tu dge bas zhi ba nyid //
translated: He is always peaceful because of virtue.

original: ces pa zhi ba ni dbang phyug chen po ste /
analyzed: ces pa zhi ba ni dbang phyug chen po ste /
translated: Peace is Mahesvara.

original: de yang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is also the Buddha.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rtag tu thams cad kyi tshe dge legs thob par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad kyi tshe dge legs thob par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he always brings about virtue and goodness at all times.

original: 'di yang nyi tshe ba nyid do //🔽thams cad kun bdag la gnas phyir //
analyzed: 'di yang nyi tshe ba nyid do // thams cad kun bdag la gnas phyir //
translated: He is also limited.🔽Because everything abides in the self of all.

original: zhes pa // thams cad kyang kun gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyi bdag la gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes pa // thams cad kyang kun gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyi bdag la gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Everything abides in the self of all.

original: mu stegs pas brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las so //
analyzed: mu stegs pas brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las so //
translated: From the nature of the self imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: dam pa'i bde bas de nyid de //
analyzed: dam pa'i bde bas de nyid de //
translated: That itself is the bliss of the sublime,

original: dga' ba rtogs phyir rnams da do //
analyzed: dga' ba rtogs phyir rnams da do //
translated: because of realizing the joy.

original: zhes pa sangs rgyas rnams rnam sad de /
analyzed: zhes pa sangs rgyas rnams rnam sad de /
translated: The buddhas are the fully awakened ones.

original: stong pa nyid kyi bdag med ma rnal 'byor ma'i ye shes rtogs pa las /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi bdag med ma rnal 'byor ma'i ye shes rtogs pa las /
translated: From the realization of the wisdom of the emptiness of selflessness of Yoginī Nairātmya,

original: dga' ba rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of realizing the joy.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: @110a * // dam pa'i bde ba yang dag pa ye shes kyis te /
analyzed: @110a * // dam pa'i bde ba yang dag pa ye shes kyis te /
translated: The bliss of the sublime is the authentic wisdom.

original: rgyu 'dis ni de nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis ni de nyid ces pa'o //
translated: By this cause, it is “that itself.”🔽Or, Vairocana, Akṣobhya, Amoghasiddhi,

original: yang na / rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: yang na / rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' ni //
translated: Ratnasambhava, and Amitābha are the bodhisattvas.

original: zhes pa mig la sogs pa dbang po drug po 'di rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po rnams shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyis tshangs pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhes /
analyzed: zhes pa mig la sogs pa dbang po drug po 'di rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po rnams shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyis tshangs pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhes /
translated: These six sense organs, such as the eyes, and the six objects, such as form, are indivisible method and wisdom. Since they are the nature of the five aggregates, they are the nature of the five tathāgatas, such as Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad rnam sad de nyid brjod //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad rnam sad de nyid brjod //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva, and all the Awakened Ones, are said to be that.

original: tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste /
translated: Brahma is Vishnu.

original: tshangs pa ji lta bu'i rang bzhin zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa ji lta bu'i rang bzhin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of Brahma?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: tshangs pa myang 'das sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: tshangs pa myang 'das sangs rgyas te //
translated: Brahma is nirvana, the Buddha.

original: zhes pa / mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo ni tshangs pa don dam pa'i bden pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa / mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo ni tshangs pa don dam pa'i bden pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas so //
translated: The essence of nirvana is Brahma, abiding in ultimate truth.

original: 'jug phyir khyab 'jug brjod par bya //
analyzed: 'jug phyir khyab 'jug brjod par bya //
translated: Vishnu is said to be because of engagement.

original: zhes pa / thams cad du 'jug pa spro ba'i rang bzhin gyis kun rdzob kyi bden pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa / thams cad du 'jug pa spro ba'i rang bzhin gyis kun rdzob kyi bden pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the nature of expansion, engaging in everything, he abides in conventional truth.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa yang de nyid ces pa tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa yang de nyid ces pa tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste //
translated: The indivisibility of conventional and ultimate truths is said to be that, Brahma is Vishnu.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid las de nyid ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid las de nyid ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: From the nature of non-duality, it is said to be that.

original: zhi ba nyid thams cad de /
analyzed: zhi ba nyid thams cad de /
translated: Shiva is all,

original: de yang de nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: and that is also said to be that.

original: ci ltar rtag tu dge bas thams cad kyi tshe rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis dge ba thob bar byed pa'i phyir sdud pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rtag tu dge bas thams cad kyi tshe rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis dge ba thob bar byed pa'i phyir sdud pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: In what way is it the nature of gathering? It is the nature of gathering because it always obtains virtue at all times by means of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: thams cad kun bdag la gnas phyir //🔽thams cad kyi lus la gnas pa'i phyir te spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kun bdag la gnas phyir // thams cad kyi lus la gnas pa'i phyir te spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all things abide in me,

original: spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid gnyis ka dbyer med pa las de nyid du rjod do //
analyzed: spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid gnyis ka dbyer med pa las de nyid du rjod do //
translated: because all things abide in the body, in the manner of emanation and gathering, it is said to be just that.

original: de'i phyir rnam sad khyad par du 'phags pa'i rtogs pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam sad khyad par du 'phags pa'i rtogs pas gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it abides in the realization of the superiority of the fully enlightened.

original: ji ltar dga' ba rtogs phyir stong pa nyid kyis ngo bos khams gsum pa rtogs pa'i phyir dam pa'i bde ba yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid kyis de nyid ces brjod do / yang na /
analyzed: ji ltar dga' ba rtogs phyir stong pa nyid kyis ngo bos khams gsum pa rtogs pa'i phyir dam pa'i bde ba yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid kyis de nyid ces brjod do / yang na /
translated: Because of the realization of the three realms by means of the nature of emptiness, it is said to be just that, the supreme bliss of perfect pristine consciousness.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sems dpa'i mthar thug pa drug dang tshangs pa la sogs pa de nyid kyi mthar thug pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sems dpa'i mthar thug pa drug dang tshangs pa la sogs pa de nyid kyi mthar thug pa drug ste /
translated: The six ending with Vairochana and the six ending with Brahma are the six families.

original: drug tshan gnyis po 'di sems dpa' dang de nyid dbyer med pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa rtogs pa las de nyid gnyis pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: drug tshan gnyis po 'di sems dpa' dang de nyid dbyer med pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa rtogs pa las de nyid gnyis pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Since these two groups of six are the hero and his indivisibility, the realization of the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind is the mandala of the nature of the fifteen dakinis, which is the second reality.

original: shes rab @110b dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis bco brgyad phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: shes rab @110b dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis bco brgyad phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of Vajradhara, which has the nature of the eighteen aggregates, elements, and sense bases, is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag / tha dad med pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang bskyed pa na mi bskyod pa nyid rdo rje 'chang du grub bo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag / tha dad med pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang bskyed pa na mi bskyod pa nyid rdo rje 'chang du grub bo zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the mandala of wisdom and the mandala of commitment are not different because of the indivisibility of the two, when Vajradhara is generated, Akshobhya himself is established as Vajradhara.

original: lha'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to realize the nature of the deity, the teacher is stated:

original: gang phyir lus su byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir lus su byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of arising as the body,

original: lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
translated: it is to be called “the deity.”

original: zhes pa / lus gnas ye she chen po ni //
analyzed: zhes pa / lus gnas ye she chen po ni //
translated: The great pristine awareness that abides in the body

original: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las so //
translated: is the Bhagavān.

original: yang na / lus phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can 'phel ba'i ngo bor byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na / lus phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can 'phel ba'i ngo bor byung ba ste /
translated: Or else, the body is the nature of the five aggregates that have arisen in the form of growth.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it abides in the nature of that,

original: lha zhes mngon par brjod de tha sna yud du bya'o //
analyzed: lha zhes mngon par brjod de tha sna yud du bya'o //
translated: it is called “god” and should be understood as “I.”

original: lha de nyid bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lha de nyid bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: That god is to be called “bhagavān.”🔽As it is said:

original: ci ltar / sangs rgyas 'di la bha ga mnga' //
analyzed: ci ltar / sangs rgyas 'di la bha ga mnga' //
translated: The Buddha possesses a bhaga,

original: bcom ldan zhes ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: bcom ldan zhes ni brjod par bya //
translated: and so is called “bhagavān.”

original: bha ga'i sgra nyid kyis ci zhig brjod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bha ga'i sgra nyid kyis ci zhig brjod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is expressed by the word bhaga?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bha ga rnam pa drug du brjod //
analyzed: bha ga rnam pa drug du brjod //
translated: Bhaga is said to be of six kinds.

original: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
translated: All the qualities such as power,

original: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
translated: or else, the demons such as the afflictions are destroyed,

original: 'joms phyir bcom ldan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms phyir bcom ldan zhes pa'o //
translated: and so he is called “bhagavān.”

original: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
translated: All the qualities such as power,

original: zhes pa / dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // grags pa dang ni dpal brtson 'grus //
analyzed: zhes pa / dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // grags pa dang ni dpal brtson 'grus //
translated: 1. Mastery, good form, fame, glory, energy,

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste //
translated: and perfect knowledge

original: drug ni bha ga zhes par brjod //
analyzed: drug ni bha ga zhes par brjod //
translated: are the six called the bhaga.

original: dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa bag chags mtha' dag spangs pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa bag chags mtha' dag spangs pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: Mastery is the nature of the abandonment of all propensities.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfect knowledge of the utterly pure gnosis, which is the essence of the nonduality of the conventional and the ultimate, is the mastery.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfect achievement of one's own and others' goals arises from that.

original: de bzhin du gzugs phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa dngos po mtha' dag gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu me long lta bu'i ye shes ni gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa dngos po mtha' dag gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu me long lta bu'i ye shes ni gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, good form is the mirror-like gnosis, which is the cause for the arising of the knowledge of the correct suchness of all things as being like reflections.

original: grags pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa snying rje la sogs pa yon tan rin po che'i mthu las 'gro ba mtha' dag gi phan pa sgrub par nus pa nyid kyis phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas gtso bor gyur pa'i sbyor ba las🔽/ mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni grags @111a * //
analyzed: grags pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa snying rje la sogs pa yon tan rin po che'i mthu las 'gro ba mtha' dag gi phan pa sgrub par nus pa nyid kyis phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas gtso bor gyur pa'i sbyor ba las / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni grags @111a * //
translated: The perfection of fame is the perfection of all perfections, since it is the basis of all perfections through the power of the precious qualities of compassion and so on, which are able to accomplish the benefit of all beings.🔽From the application of the principal,

original: pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the gnosis of equality is the perfection of fame.

original: dpal phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa dngos po mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par so sor gzigs pa nyid kyis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dpal phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa dngos po mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par so sor gzigs pa nyid kyis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The perfection of glory is the individually discriminating gnosis, since it individually sees all things without error.

original: brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa las byung ba bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa las byung ba bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The perfection of diligence is the gnosis of achieving activities, which arises from the purification of the perfection of diligence.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa zhes pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the nature of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality.

original: ye shes lda'i bdag nyid can 'di ni dbang phyug la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes lda'i bdag nyid can 'di ni dbang phyug la sogs pa ste /
translated: This one, whose nature is wisdom, is the Lord, etc.

original: bha ga drug po de rnams ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan no //
analyzed: bha ga drug po de rnams ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan no //
translated: The Bhagavān is so called because he possesses those six bhagas.

original: yang na zhes pa phyogs gzhan te /
analyzed: yang na zhes pa phyogs gzhan te /
translated: Or, the other position is that

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu rnams te /
translated: the afflictions, etc., are the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, the aggregates, the Lord of Death, and the sons of the gods.

original: de rnams 'joms phyir sgrib pa dang bral ba las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'joms phyir sgrib pa dang bral ba las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'o //
translated: Because he conquers those, he is the Bhagavān, who is free from obscurations.

original: yang na sangs rgyas 'di la bha ga mnga'/
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas 'di la bha ga mnga'/
translated: Or, this Buddha possesses a bhaga.

original: ye shes kyi rnam pa ni bcom ldan zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam pa ni bcom ldan zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The aspect of wisdom should be called the Bhagavān.

original: bha ga rnam pa drug ni dbye ba drug ste /
analyzed: bha ga rnam pa drug ni dbye ba drug ste /
translated: The six types of bhaga are the six types.

original: ci ltar mig la sogs pa drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa drug dang gnyis ka dbyer med pa rnam par shes pa drug ces pa bco brgyad de /
analyzed: ci ltar mig la sogs pa drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa drug dang gnyis ka dbyer med pa rnam par shes pa drug ces pa bco brgyad de /
translated: How is it that the eighteen are the six sense faculties such as the eyes, the six sense objects such as form, and the six consciousnesses that are inseparable from both?

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mngon par shes pa drug gi yon tan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mngon par shes pa drug gi yon tan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are the nature of the qualities of the six higher perceptions.

original: brjod pa ni ye shes kyi rnam par te /
analyzed: brjod pa ni ye shes kyi rnam par te /
translated: Speech is the aspect of gnosis.

original: rgyu 'di nyid las dbang phyug la sogs pa gsungs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid las dbang phyug la sogs pa gsungs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: From this very cause, all the qualities of Ishvara and so forth are attained.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das nyid la mchog gi yon tan de rnams yod kyi gzhan rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das nyid la mchog gi yon tan de rnams yod kyi gzhan rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: This shows that the Blessed One alone possesses those supreme qualities, not others.

original: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
translated: Or, the afflictions and so forth are the demons.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The afflictions and so forth are the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and the thoroughly afflicted.

original: nyon mongs par byed pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa ni dbang po drug go //🔽nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba'i mngon par zhen pas de rnams la dbang po rnams 'jug pa'i phyir yul drug po rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs par byed pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa ni dbang po drug go // nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba'i mngon par zhen pas de rnams la dbang po rnams 'jug pa'i phyir yul drug po rnams so //
translated: The six sense faculties are the afflictions because they engage in the apprehension of subject and object, etc. due to the adherence to the notion of a real self.🔽The six sense objects are the secondary afflictions because the sense faculties engage in them due to the adherence to the notion of real sense objects.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa nang de ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go @111b zhes pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa nang de ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go @111b zhes pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa
translated: The six consciousnesses are the afflictions because they engage in the apprehension of subject and object, etc. due to the adherence to the notion of real subject and object.🔽Thus, the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and the afflictive dharmas are the demons.

original: rnams so // de nyid bdud de ye shes rnams la rol pa ma yin pa'i phyir sems can rnams bdud do //
analyzed: rnams so // de nyid bdud de ye shes rnams la rol pa ma yin pa'i phyir sems can rnams bdud do //
translated: They are demons because they do not delight in the wisdoms of sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi snod ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snod ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par bkod pa'o //
translated: The field of those demons is the field of the extremely pure realm of Dharma.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the Bhagavān.

original: da ni bskyed ma dang ni sring mo zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa rnams kyi don rgyas par bshad pas gzhan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni bskyed ma dang ni sring mo zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa rnams kyi don rgyas par bshad pas gzhan du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the meaning of the brief statements beginning with “mother who gives birth” is explained in detail in the other [commentaries].

original: gang phyir skye 'gro bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skye 'gro bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because he gives birth to living beings,

original: shes rab bskyed mar brjod par bya //
analyzed: shes rab bskyed mar brjod par bya //
translated: he is called the mother who gives birth.

original: gang phyir skal ba ston pa yis //
analyzed: gang phyir skal ba ston pa yis //
translated: Because he teaches good fortune,

original: shes rab sring mo zhes bya nyid //
analyzed: shes rab sring mo zhes bya nyid //
translated: he is called the sister of wisdom.

original: ces pa'i don rab tu gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa'i don rab tu gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is very clear.

original: yang na / shes rab bskyed mar brjod par bya / zhes pa shes rab kyi sgras phul du byung ba'i ye shes ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: yang na / shes rab bskyed mar brjod par bya / zhes pa shes rab kyi sgras phul du byung ba'i ye shes ni shes rab ste /
translated: Moreover, he is called the mother who gives birth. The word “wisdom” refers to the wisdom that is the highest knowledge.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni bskyed ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni bskyed ma zhes brjod do //
translated: That very pure consciousness is called the mother who gives birth.

original: gang gi phyir skye 'gro bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa skye 'gro ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye 'gro bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa skye 'gro ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Because he gives birth to living beings. Living beings are the five aggregates, which have the nature of form, etc., and are the sense faculties such as the eyes, etc.

original: de nyid shes rab sring mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid shes rab sring mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: That is to be called the sister of wisdom.🔽As it is said,

original: ji ltar / gang phyir skal pa ston pa'i zhes pa /
analyzed: ji ltar / gang phyir skal pa ston pa'i zhes pa /
translated: “Because of the different fortunes of the teacher,”

original: gang phyir rgyu gang las /
analyzed: gang phyir rgyu gang las /
translated: because of the different causes,

original: skal pa tha dad pa yul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ston cing rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skal pa tha dad pa yul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ston cing rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: the different fortunes are taught, are realized, in the nature of the object, etc.

original: yang na tha dad dang bral ba ni bha ga ste /
analyzed: yang na tha dad dang bral ba ni bha ga ste /
translated: Or else, the bhaga is free from difference,

original: tha dad med pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad med pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: meaning non-difference.

original: de gang las ston pa chos thams cad kyi sems kyi lus nyid las zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de gang las ston pa chos thams cad kyi sems kyi lus nyid las zhes pa'i don to //
translated: From what is it taught? From the mind-body of all phenomena.🔽The washerwoman, the girl,

original: tshos ma dang ni bu mo dang // gar ma zhes par rab brjod pa //
analyzed: tshos ma dang ni bu mo dang // gar ma zhes par rab brjod pa //
translated: and the dancer are well known.

original: tshos ma dang gar ma la sogs pa de rnams ni /
analyzed: tshos ma dang gar ma la sogs pa de rnams ni /
translated: The washerwoman, the dancer, and so on,

original: bu mor yang brjod de /
analyzed: bu mor yang brjod de /
translated: are also called the girl.

original: sems can thams cad 'chod  pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'chod  pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of washing all sentient beings,

original: tshos ma zhes ni de bzhin brjod //
analyzed: tshos ma zhes ni de bzhin brjod //
translated: the washerwoman is so called.

original: gar ma la sogs pa ni bu mo nyid de /
analyzed: gar ma la sogs pa ni bu mo nyid de /
translated: The dancer, etc., are the girl.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yon tan 'jo phyir shes rab ni //
analyzed: yon tan 'jo phyir shes rab ni //
translated: Because of the enjoyment of qualities,

original: bu mo zhes ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: bu mo zhes ni brjod par bya //
translated: wisdom is to be called the girl.

original: shes rab gar mar brjod bya ste //
analyzed: shes rab gar mar brjod bya ste //
translated: Wisdom is said to be the dancing girl.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: g-yo ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of its movement.

original: de yang bu mo'i don de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de yang bu mo'i don de nyid kyis so //
translated: And that is the very meaning of the word “girl.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir snying rje chen po zhes pa bod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snying rje chen po zhes pa bod pa'o //
translated: That is why the word “great compassion” is added.

original: gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //
translated: Because the Lord is not touched,

original: de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya //
analyzed: de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya //
translated: he is said to be the outcaste.

original: 'di yang bu mo'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bu mo'o //
translated: And this is the girl.

original: a'a li k'a li rab brjod phyir //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li rab brjod phyir //
translated: Because of the expression of the vowels and consonants,

original: brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
analyzed: brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
translated: the expression is said to be the repetition.

original: ces pa 'dis ni //🔽gdol pa mo dang bram ze mo dag / a'a @112a * //
analyzed: ces pa 'dis ni // gdol pa mo dang bram ze mo dag / a'a @112a * //
translated: By this

original: li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: the outcaste and the brahmin are situated in the nature of the vowels and consonants.🔽Or else,

original: yang na / chos ma dang ni bu mor yang //
analyzed: yang na / chos ma dang ni bu mor yang //
translated: the Dharma mother and the girl

original: brjod par bya zhes pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya zhes pa ste /
translated: are to be expressed.

original: sems can thams cad 'tshed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'tshed pa'i phyir /
translated: The cook is so called because she cooks all sentient beings.

original: tshos ma zhes pa sems can thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: tshos ma zhes pa sems can thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: All sentient beings are of the nature of the five aggregates, form, etc.

original: de rnams thams cad dang sems can yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad dang sems can yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , because they are all that and also sentient beings.

original: de rnams 'tshed ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa sku rdo rje tshos ma ste /
analyzed: de rnams 'tshed ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa sku rdo rje tshos ma ste /
translated: The characteristics of those which are not cooked are the conventional truth, which is the daughter who cooks the vajra body.

original: de rnams nyid don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yon tan 'jo phyir bu mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yon tan 'jo phyir bu mo zhes pa'o //
translated: Since those are established by the ultimate truth, she is called a daughter because she enjoys qualities.

original: shes rab gar mar brjod bya ste //
analyzed: shes rab gar mar brjod bya ste //
translated: Wisdom is said to be the dancing girl.

original: g-yo ba'i phyir ni snying rje che //🔽zhes pa / g-yo ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rlung g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir te /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i phyir ni snying rje che // zhes pa / g-yo ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rlung g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir te /
translated: Great compassion is said to be the movement.🔽The reason “because of movement” is because of the nature of the movement of the wind.

original: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid ni rlung ngo //
translated: The nature of the vowels and consonants is wind.

original: gar ma ni gsung rdo rje ste /
analyzed: gar ma ni gsung rdo rje ste /
translated: The dancing girl is the vajra speech.

original: de yang bu mo'o //
analyzed: de yang bu mo'o //
translated: She is also a daughter.

original: gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //
translated: Because the Bhagavān is not touched,

original: de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya //
analyzed: de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya //
translated: therefore, she is said to be the Yoginī.

original: zhes pa // yid ni dam pa'i bde ba za //
analyzed: zhes pa // yid ni dam pa'i bde ba za //
translated: The mind is said to be the supreme bliss.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las thugs rdo rje g-yung mo ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las thugs rdo rje g-yung mo ste /
translated: From the statement, the mind vajra is the Yoginī.

original: de yang bu mo'o //
analyzed: de yang bu mo'o //
translated: She is also a daughter.

original: 'di rnams kyang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis rdo rje'i rigs te le'u dang po bdag gi de kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis rdo rje'i rigs te le'u dang po bdag gi de kho na'o //
translated: Since these are inseparable from the three vajras, the emanation body itself is the vajra family, which is the reality of the first chapter.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the inseparability of the three vajras, it is said:

original: a'a li k'a li rab brjod phyir //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li rab brjod phyir //
translated: In order to express the ālikāli,

original: brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
analyzed: brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
translated: recitation is explained as expression.

original: ces pa / a'a li rin chen dbang po rnam par dag pa nyid las gdol pa mo dang / bdag med ma rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: ces pa / a'a li rin chen dbang po rnam par dag pa nyid las gdol pa mo dang / bdag med ma rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The ālikāli is the expression of the pure lord of jewels, which is the untouchable woman and the yoginī Nairātmya.

original: k'a li rnam par snang mdzad rnam par dag pa nyid las bram ze mo dang thabs so ;
analyzed: k'a li rnam par snang mdzad rnam par dag pa nyid las bram ze mo dang thabs so ;
translated: The kālikāli is the pure Vairocana, which is the brahmin woman and the method.

original: / gnyis ka brjod pa ni gnyis su med pas rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / gnyis ka brjod pa ni gnyis su med pas rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The expression of both is the nondual abiding.

original: brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
analyzed: brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
translated: Recitation is explained as expression.

original: ces pa nges pa nyid kyis gsungs so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa nges pa nyid kyis gsungs so zhes pa ste /
translated: This is said to be the certainty.

original: 'dis ni sngags kyi le'u /
analyzed: 'dis ni sngags kyi le'u /
translated: By this, the chapter on mantra

original: sngags kyi de kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: is the reality of mantra, which is the enjoyment body.

original: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
analyzed: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
translated: The footprint is the maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa / rkang pa ni cha shas te /
analyzed: zhes pa / rkang pa ni cha shas te /
translated: The foot is a part.

original: rjes ni des sna tshogs pa'i gzugs spro ba dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rjes ni des sna tshogs pa'i gzugs spro ba dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The trace is the emanation of various forms by that, the commitment mandala.

original: 'dus phyir dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
analyzed: 'dus phyir dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
translated: The mandala is said to be the gathering.

original: 'dus pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The gathering is the apprehending.

original: g-yo ba med par byed pa ji srid sdud pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med par byed pa ji srid sdud pa'o //
translated: It is the gathering as long as it is made unmoving.

original: de'i phyir yang dkyil 'khor du brjod do zhes pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dkyil 'khor du brjod do zhes pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Therefore, it is also said to be a mandala, the wisdom mandala.

original: @112b dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
analyzed: @112b dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
translated: Those are the two mandalas.

original: yang na / rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
analyzed: yang na / rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
translated: Or, the foot trace is the mandala.

original: zhes pa rkang pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes pa rkang pa ni ye shes te /
translated: The foot is wisdom.

original: rgyu des na rjes ni spro ba'o zhas pa lha'i de kho na lha'i le'u chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na rjes ni spro ba'o zhas pa lha'i de kho na lha'i le'u chos kyi sku'o //
translated: By that cause, the trace is the emanation, the reality of the deity.

original: 'dus phyir dkyil 'khor zhes pa spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus phyir dkyil 'khor zhes pa spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: The mandala is said to be the gathering, the head of one's family.

original: 'dis ni he ru ka rdzogs pa'o zhes pa dbang bskur ba'i le'u ye shes kyi de kho na sku gsum dbyer med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni he ru ka rdzogs pa'o zhes pa dbang bskur ba'i le'u ye shes kyi de kho na sku gsum dbyer med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: This is the completion of Heruka, the chapter on the consecration, the reality of intuition, the inseparability of the three bodies, the state of omniscience.

original: yang na / rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
analyzed: yang na / rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
translated: Again, the verse, “The footprint is the mandala,”

original: zhes pa gang /
analyzed: zhes pa gang /
translated: is what?

original: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te /
translated: The footprint is the mandala.

original: rkang pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The foot is the fourth, the innate.

original: rjes ni tshul 'dis yang dag par bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: rjes ni tshul 'dis yang dag par bskyed pa ste /
translated: The print is the correct generation by this method.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called the mandala.

original: 'dus phyir 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dus phyir 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the gathering, because of the grasping,

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the “unmoving nature.”

original: le'u 'di nyid du /
analyzed: le'u 'di nyid du /
translated: In this very chapter,

original: rdo rje 'dis ni gdab bya ste //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dis ni gdab bya ste //
translated: “This vajra is to be cast,

original: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
analyzed: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
translated: and therefore it is called the seal.”

original: zhes mdor bstan pa de nyid kyis rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes mdor bstan pa de nyid kyis rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The brief indication is the very extensive explanation.

original: lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgya yin //
analyzed: lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgya yin //
translated: “The hand movement is the seal.”

original: zhes pa lag pa dag gis phan tshun nyed pa 'di nyid phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lag pa dag gis phan tshun nyed pa 'di nyid phyag rgya'o //
translated: This very mutual rubbing with the hands is the seal.

original: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The rubbing of the fingers is also like that.

original: zhes pa sor mo dag gis phan tshun nyed pa 'di yang phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sor mo dag gis phan tshun nyed pa 'di yang phyag rgya'o //
translated: This mutual rubbing of the fingers is also a seal.

original: yang na lag pa bsgyur ba zhes pa ka rdo rje 'chang /
analyzed: yang na lag pa bsgyur ba zhes pa ka rdo rje 'chang /
translated: Or, the turning of the hands is the sound “ka” and the vajra-holder.

original: ra bdag med ma /
analyzed: ra bdag med ma /
translated: The “ra” is Nairātmya.

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid spo ta ni sgra ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid spo ta ni sgra ste /
translated: The “ta” is the nature of both.

original: phyag rgya dang mtshan mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang mtshan mar 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes the seal and the sign.

original: rigs lnga'i rim pas rigs brgya la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rim pas rigs brgya la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: By the sequence of the five clans, there are the different divisions of the one hundred clans and so forth, and there is no difference.

original: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The rubbing of the fingers is also like that.

original: zhes pa sor mo'i sgras lnga'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: zhes pa sor mo'i sgras lnga'i bdag nyid can /
translated: The word “finger” has the nature of the five.

original: yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin rigs lnga'o //
translated: The five clans have the nature of the objects and the sense powers.

original: de nyed pa ni sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de nyed pa ni sdud pa ste /
translated: Their mutual rubbing is their gathering.

original: 'di mthar thug pa kho na yin zhing dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa dang spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di mthar thug pa kho na yin zhing dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa dang spro ba dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate, and it is the nature of the indivisibility of the two mandalas, of emanation and gathering.

original: lha ni rnam pa gnyis te lus dang ldan pa dang / sngags kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lha ni rnam pa gnyis te lus dang ldan pa dang / sngags kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The deity is twofold: embodied and mantra-nature.

original: de ji ltar de kho na'i rnal 'byor kyis bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de kho na'i rnal 'byor kyis bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be meditated upon by means of the yoga of reality?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽de ni bsam bya ste bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / de ni bsam bya ste bsam par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽It is to be thought of,

original: gang bsam pa gang dang gang bsams pa'i yul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsam pa gang dang gang bsams pa'i yul du byas pa'o //
translated: that which is thought of, that which is made the object of thought.
