original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gang phyir rnam bsams sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar byed pa gang yin pa de bsam par @113a * //
analyzed: gang phyir rnam bsams sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar byed pa gang yin pa de bsam par @113a * //
translated: From that which is thought of, by the various ways of making a sign, that is to be thought of.

original: bya'o // yang na /
analyzed: bya'o // yang na /
translated: Or else,

original: de ni bsam bya de gzung ba dang yul gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni bsam bya de gzung ba dang yul gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: it is to be thought of, that which is grasped, the nature of the object.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gang bsams pa dbang po rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis yul du dbang byas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsams pa dbang po rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis yul du dbang byas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: From that which is thought of, the object that is dominated by the sense faculties in the manner of grasping.

original: rnam bsams ni /
analyzed: rnam bsams ni /
translated: That which is thought of

original: dbang po'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
translated: is the nature of the sense faculties.

original: de gang gi phyir bsam bya gzung ba yul gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de gang gi phyir bsam bya gzung ba yul gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Because of that, it is to be thought of, that which is grasped, the nature of the object.

original: de dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: de dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa med de /
translated: They are not different characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir rnam bsams zhes pa dbang po dang yul dbyer med pa nyid las shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam bsams zhes pa dbang po dang yul dbyer med pa nyid las shes pa'o //
translated: Because of the inseparability of the sense organ and the object, there is consciousness.

original: lus dang ldan pa dang sngags kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i de kho na rnal 'byor bas thams cad kyi tshe bsgom par bya'o zhes pa le'u dang po dang gnyis par ro //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa dang sngags kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i de kho na rnal 'byor bas thams cad kyi tshe bsgom par bya'o zhes pa le'u dang po dang gnyis par ro //
translated: The yogin should always meditate on the reality of the deity, which is endowed with the body and the nature of the mantra, as stated in the first and second chapters.

original: lha gang yin pa'ang lha'i le'u dang / dbang bskur ba'i le'ur gsungs so //
analyzed: lha gang yin pa'ang lha'i le'u dang / dbang bskur ba'i le'ur gsungs so //
translated: And the deity is also mentioned in the chapter on the consecration and the chapter on the deity.

original: de rnams ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should they be meditated upon?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: pha la thob pa'i bde ba gang //
analyzed: pha la thob pa'i bde ba gang //
translated: Whatever pleasure is obtained from the father,

original: bde ba de ni rang gis bza' //
analyzed: bde ba de ni rang gis bza' //
translated: that pleasure is to be enjoyed by oneself.

original: bde ba gang gis 'chi ba 'dir //
analyzed: bde ba gang gis 'chi ba 'dir //
translated: Whatever pleasure is in this death,

original: bde ba de ni bsam gtan brjod //
analyzed: bde ba de ni bsam gtan brjod //
translated: that pleasure is said to be concentration.

original: pha la zhes pa skyed par byed pa yid la'o //
analyzed: pha la zhes pa skyed par byed pa yid la'o //
translated: Father refers to the mind that gives rise to it.

original: de las thob pa'i bde ba gang dbang po dang yul las skyes pa'i shes pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de bza' zhing myong bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las thob pa'i bde ba gang dbang po dang yul las skyes pa'i shes pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de bza' zhing myong bar bya ste /
translated: The bliss obtained from that is to be eaten and experienced, which is any aspect of consciousness arisen from the sense faculty and object, such as bliss.

original: rang gis zhes pa bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gis zhes pa bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “By oneself” means by one’s own self.

original: 'dis ni sems las tha dad pa ci yang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems las tha dad pa ci yang med do zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that there is nothing at all separate from the mind.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pas gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said by the noble Nāgārjuna:

original: lha yi dmigs pa tha dad ni //
analyzed: lha yi dmigs pa tha dad ni //
translated: The various visualizations of deities

original: mos pa sna tshogs rgyu nyid de //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs rgyu nyid de //
translated: are the cause of various aspirations.

original: sems kyi rdo rje rnam grol na //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje rnam grol na //
translated: When the mind-vajra is liberated,

original: lha ni gzhan du brjod mi bya //🔽zhes pa'o // bde ba de ni /
analyzed: lha ni gzhan du brjod mi bya // zhes pa'o // bde ba de ni /
translated: the deity is said to be none other.🔽That bliss

original: ye shes de nyid bsam gtan brjod //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid bsam gtan brjod //
translated: is said to be concentration, gnosis.

original: 'dir kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'di ni bsam gtan zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'di ni bsam gtan zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here this Hevajra Tantra is to be called “concentration,”

original: gang las bde ba gang gis zhes pa ye shes gang gis 'chi ba ni 'chi ba lta bur yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang las bde ba gang gis zhes pa ye shes gang gis 'chi ba ni 'chi ba lta bur yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: because it is the bliss that is the cessation of the object, sense faculty, and consciousness, as if one were dead, by means of that gnosis.

original: gang gi phyir de ni ye shes las gzhan rtogs pa'i ched du ye shes gzhan med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni ye shes las gzhan rtogs pa'i ched du ye shes gzhan med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other gnosis for the sake of realizing anything other than that gnosis.

original: yang na / pha la zhes pa skyed par byed pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin rab tu rtogs pa na /
analyzed: yang na / pha la zhes pa skyed par byed pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin rab tu rtogs pa na /
translated: Or else, when one realizes the nature of the father, the origin of gnosis, which is the indivisibility of wisdom and method,

original: thob pa'i bde ba gang ye shes gang zhig skyes pa'i ye shes de nyid rang gis zhes pa bdag nyid la bza' zhing bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i bde ba gang ye shes gang zhig skyes pa'i ye shes de nyid rang gis zhes pa bdag nyid la bza' zhing bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the bliss that is attained, the gnosis that is born, that gnosis itself is to be eaten, that is, generated, by oneself.

original: bde ba ye shes de nyid ni 'chi ba zhes kyang brjod de /
analyzed: bde ba ye shes de nyid ni 'chi ba zhes kyang brjod de /
translated: That bliss, that gnosis, is also called “death.”

original: bde ba gang gis zhes @113b pa ye shes gang gis 'dir bsam gtan bsam pa zhas 'dir brjod de /
analyzed: bde ba gang gis zhes @113b pa ye shes gang gis 'dir bsam gtan bsam pa zhas 'dir brjod de /
translated: By what bliss, that is, by what gnosis, one meditates here, that is, one abides here.

original: gnas so zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus it is presented.

original: de'i phyir bskyed pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa ni shes pa gcig pu dang 'brel pa'i phyir ye shes ni nges par rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa ni shes pa gcig pu dang 'brel pa'i phyir ye shes ni nges par rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since origination, abiding, and destruction are connected to a single consciousness, gnosis is definitely the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: yang na / pha las thob pa'i bde ba gang //
analyzed: yang na / pha las thob pa'i bde ba gang //
translated: The bliss obtained from the father🔽is generated by the generating cause.

original: skyed byed kyis bskyed pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i phyir ye shes te /
analyzed: skyed byed kyis bskyed pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i phyir ye shes te /
translated: Wisdom is the gnosis that is the inseparability of prajñā and upāya.

original: ye shes de nyid rang gis bza' //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid rang gis bza' //
translated: That gnosis itself is to be eaten by oneself.

original: bdag nyid ces yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine oneself as the nature of the deity.

original: de yang rang bzhin med pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin med pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that it is also devoid of intrinsic nature:

original: bde ba de ni 'chi bar brjod par bya //
analyzed: bde ba de ni 'chi bar brjod par bya //
translated: That bliss is said to be death.

original: zhes pa / ye shes de nyid rgyu gang gis 'chi ba nyid kyis brtag par bya ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa / ye shes de nyid rgyu gang gis 'chi ba nyid kyis brtag par bya ba de'i phyir /
translated: That gnosis itself is to be imagined by the cause of death itself.

original: ye shes de nyid kyis bsam gtan du yang brjod de bsam par brjod ces pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid kyis bsam gtan du yang brjod de bsam par brjod ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that gnosis is also called “concentration” and “imagination.”

original: de'i phyir 'di thams cad rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all of this is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “pure by nature” is that.

original: yang na pha la skyed par byed pa bsam gtan dang bsam par bya ba dag dbyer med par rtogs par gyur na bde ba gang ye shes gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na pha la skyed par byed pa bsam gtan dang bsam par bya ba dag dbyer med par rtogs par gyur na bde ba gang ye shes gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan zhes brjod do //
translated: Or else, when one realizes the inseparability of the meditation and the object of meditation, that bliss and that intuition are called meditation.

original: de yang rang gis bza' zhes pa 'di rang rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gis bza' zhes pa 'di rang rig par bya ba'o //
translated: And that is to be eaten by oneself, that is to be known by oneself.

original: bsam tan de yang 'chi ba lta bur dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i phyir 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: bsam tan de yang 'chi ba lta bur dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i phyir 'chi ba ste /
translated: And that meditation is death, because it stops the senses, the objects, and the consciousnesses, as in death.

original: bde ba gang gis 'dir ye shes gang gis 'di rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba gang gis 'dir ye shes gang gis 'di rtogs pa'o //
translated: By what bliss, by what intuition, is this realized?

original: de kho na dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan ni ye shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de kho na dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan ni ye shes zhes brjod do //
translated: Meditation endowed with that is called intuition.

original: le'u bzhis gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: le'u bzhis gang gsungs pa /
translated: What is taught in the four chapters

original: de thams cad de kho na'i le'us bsdus so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad de kho na'i le'us bsdus so zhes pa'o //
translated: is all included in the chapter on reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ku dang gsung dang thugs kye'i rdo rje'i de kho na'i le'u ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ku dang gsung dang thugs kye'i rdo rje'i de kho na'i le'u ste lnga pa'o //
translated: The chapter on reality of the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all the transcendent lords is the fifth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can ye shes lnga dbyer med pa mig la sogs pa lhag par gnas pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can ye shes lnga dbyer med pa mig la sogs pa lhag par gnas pa'i ye shes so //
translated: All the Tathagatas is the nature of the extremely pure Dharmadhatu, which is the indivisibility of wisdom and means, the gnosis that is the indivisibility of the five gnoses, which is the special abode of the eyes, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes pa sku gsum lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes pa sku gsum lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Body, speech, and mind is the special abode of the three bodies.

original: kye'i rdo rje zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Hevajra is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de kho na zhes pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de kho na zhes pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Thatness is nondual gnosis.

original: 'di thams cad rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo nyid ces pa'o //
translated: All of this is the nature of Vajradhara.

original: lnga pa ni lnga rnams kyi rdzogs pa dang gang ba ste /🔽de nyid kyi phyir rdzogs pa rnam pa @114a * //
analyzed: lnga pa ni lnga rnams kyi rdzogs pa dang gang ba ste / de nyid kyi phyir rdzogs pa rnam pa @114a * //
translated: The fifth is the completion and filling of the five.

original: thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: For that very reason, the completion is the nature of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations.

original: yang na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje rigs kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: yang na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje rigs kyi le'u'o //
translated: Or else, this is the chapter of the Vajra family of all the Tathagatas.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sngags kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sngags kyi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the mantras of body, speech, and mind.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i lha'i le'u'o //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i lha'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the deities of Hevajra.

original: de kho nas dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de kho nas dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the conferral of initiation by that [Hevajra].🔽The chapter on that [Hevajra] itself, for the sake of summarizing.

original: ldabs bsdus pa'i phyir de kho na'i le'u'o zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u lnga pa'o /
analyzed: ldabs bsdus pa'i phyir de kho na'i le'u'o zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las le'u lnga pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fifth chapter in the commentary on the union with the pure state of Vajradhara, called The Stainless Light.

original: // / da ni le'u bzhis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid de kho na bzhi dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de kho na bzhi'i bdag nyid kyang de kho na'i le'us mngon par brjod de /
analyzed: // / da ni le'u bzhis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid de kho na bzhi dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de kho na bzhi'i bdag nyid kyang de kho na'i le'us mngon par brjod de /
translated: Now, in four chapters, the nature of the wisdom mandala and the mandala of commitments, that very fourfold reality, and also the nature of the fourfold reality of pure wisdom, are expressed in the chapter on that [reality].

original: de kho na'i rnal 'byor pas ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang de kho nas gnas pa de'i yang /
analyzed: de kho na'i rnal 'byor pas ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang de kho nas gnas pa de'i yang /
translated: How should the practitioner of that reality abide? And for one who abides in that reality,

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: what is the result? In order to teach that, it is said:

original: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
translated: Next, I will explain

original: spyod pa pha rol phyin mchog nyid //
analyzed: spyod pa pha rol phyin mchog nyid //
translated: the supreme perfection of conduct.

original: gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
analyzed: gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
translated: By which there is the culmination of power.

original: kye yi rdo rjer dngos grub rgyus //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rjer dngos grub rgyus //
translated: In the Hevajra Tantra, the cause of power.

original: 'di'i don spyod pa zhes pa de kho na'i rnal 'byor pa'i lugs so //
analyzed: 'di'i don spyod pa zhes pa de kho na'i rnal 'byor pa'i lugs so //
translated: The meaning of this is that the conduct is the system of the yoga of reality.

original: de rab bshad bya zhes pa rab tu brjod pas so sor rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de rab bshad bya zhes pa rab tu brjod pas so sor rtogs par bya ste /
translated: That is to be explained means that it is to be understood by a thorough expression.

original: rab tu brjod pa zhes bya ba ni gang bya bas yongs su dman pa'i bya ba gsungs pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa zhes bya ba ni gang bya bas yongs su dman pa'i bya ba gsungs pa 'di nyid do //
translated: The so-called thorough expression is the statement of the conduct that is inferior to the conduct of this very [system].

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the culmination of the supreme perfection.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ni nyan thos la sogs pa mos pa dman pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid las gong ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ni nyan thos la sogs pa mos pa dman pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid las gong ma'o //
translated: For that very reason, the supreme is the highest, not the domain of those with inferior aspirations such as the Sravakas and so forth.

original: ci'i don nyid du spyod pa byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i don nyid du spyod pa byed ce na /
translated: For what purpose does one engage in conduct?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
analyzed: gsungs pa / gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
translated: By which there is the culmination of power.

original: zhes pa / spyod pa byed pa gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa / spyod pa byed pa gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba rtogs pa ste /
translated: The one who engages in conduct realizes the culmination of power.

original: dngos grub kyi mthar rang bzhin rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mthar rang bzhin rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The culmination of the powers is the realization of the nature.

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: de nas gzhan zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, the other,

original: de nas gzhan ni de kho na'i le'ur gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas gzhan ni de kho na'i le'ur gsungs pa /
translated: the other is the chapter on reality,

original: de las 'di'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis dngos grub mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan phul du byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'di'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis dngos grub mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan phul du byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: which is superior to the other because the ultimate result of the powers arises from it by being its cause.

original: gang du zhe na /🔽kye'i rdo rjer te /
analyzed: gang du zhe na / kye'i rdo rjer te /
translated: Where?🔽In Hevajra.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'dir ro //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'dir ro //
translated: In this tantra of Hevajra.

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: By what cause?

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgyus zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rgyus zhes pa'o //
translated: By the cause of the power of the great seal.

original: yang na spyod pa rab bshad bya //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na spyod pa rab bshad bya // zhes pa ste /
translated: Or, the conduct will be explained.

original: gsungs pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i don nyid do //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: dngos grub mthar 'gro ba zhes @114b pa ;
analyzed: dngos grub mthar 'gro ba zhes @114b pa ;
translated: The culmination of the powers

original: dngos grub ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: dngos grub ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: is the power of Vajradhara.

original: de'i mtha' ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Its end is the nature.

original: khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: gzhan mchog go //
analyzed: gzhan mchog go //
translated: It is superior to the other.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de nas bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag med ma ste /
translated: Then, Nairatmya.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dag dbyer med pa las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dag dbyer med pa las so //
translated: Therefore, from the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya,

original: gang du kye'i rdo rjer gnyis su med par rtogs pa na ste /
analyzed: gang du kye'i rdo rjer gnyis su med par rtogs pa na ste /
translated: where there is realization of nonduality in Hevajra,

original: de nyid ci'i don du rtogs she na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i don du rtogs she na /
translated: for what purpose is there realization?

original: dngos grub rgyus phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don te /
analyzed: dngos grub rgyus phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don te /
translated: For the sake of the power of the great seal,

original: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: not in any other way, is the meaning.

original: de kho na'i rnal 'byor ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na'i rnal 'byor ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: The characteristic of the yoga of reality is stated:

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin gyi rgyan 'dzin pa'i don gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin gyi rgyan 'dzin pa'i don gyis gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of holding the ornament of the characteristic and nature of the mundane and the supramundane is stated:

original: sgom pa po yis rnam gzung ba //
analyzed: sgom pa po yis rnam gzung ba //
translated: The meditator should hold the ornament.

original: rna bar lha yi rna rgyan te /
analyzed: rna bar lha yi rna rgyan te /
translated: The ornament of the gods in the ear

original: zhes pa rnal 'byor pas rgyan byas te /
analyzed: zhes pa rnal 'byor pas rgyan byas te /
translated: is the ornament of the yogi.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lha'i rna rgyan zhes pa lha'i bdag nyid kyis rna rgyan la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna rgyan zhes pa lha'i bdag nyid kyis rna rgyan la sogs pa ste /
translated: The ornament of the gods is the ornament of the gods, and so on.

original: lha rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the purity of the gods.

original: 'dis ni phyag rgya rnam par dag pa'i lha gang yin pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyag rgya rnam par dag pa'i lha gang yin pa /
translated: This means that whatever deity is the pure seal,

original: lha de'i mtshan ma nyid der byas te /
analyzed: lha de'i mtshan ma nyid der byas te /
translated: that deity's sign is made there.

original: rab gnas la sogs pa yang byas nas rna ba dag la gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab gnas la sogs pa yang byas nas rna ba dag la gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Having also consecrated it and so forth, it should be worn on the ears.

original: lha'i sgra ni thams cad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i sgra ni thams cad du rig par bya ste /
translated: The sound of the deity should be understood everywhere.

original: 'dir 'khor lo dang lag gdub la sogs pa rnams la yang sngar bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'khor lo dang lag gdub la sogs pa rnams la yang sngar bzhin bya'o //
translated: Here, the wheel, bracelets, and so forth should also be done as before.

original: rkang gdub la yang rdo rje thod pa'i phyag rgya dang / dpung rgyan la yang rdo rje 'chang nyid kyi phyag rgya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rkang gdub la yang rdo rje thod pa'i phyag rgya dang / dpung rgyan la yang rdo rje 'chang nyid kyi phyag rgya zhes pa'o //
translated: Also, on the anklets, the vajra skull-cup gesture, and on the armlet, the gesture of Vajradhara himself.

original: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin //🔽lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
analyzed: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin // lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
translated: On the head, the wheel is held.🔽On the hands, there are two bracelets.

original: gdub bu gnyis so //
analyzed: gdub bu gnyis so //
translated: Two bracelets.

original: rked pa la yang ska rags gnyis //
analyzed: rked pa la yang ska rags gnyis //
translated: On the waist, there are two belts.

original: rkang pa dag la rkang gdub ste //🔽dpung pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan dang // mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dag la rkang gdub ste // dpung pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan dang // mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba'o //
translated: On the feet, there are anklets.🔽On the base of the arms, there is an armlet, and on the throat, a garland of bones.

original: zhes pa ; mgrin par rus pa'i mgul rgyan te //
analyzed: zhes pa ; mgrin par rus pa'i mgul rgyan te //
translated: On the throat, a necklace of bones.

original: 'dis ci gsungs na /
analyzed: 'dis ci gsungs na /
translated: What does this say?

original: rna rgyan la sogs pa gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: rna rgyan la sogs pa gang gsungs pa //
translated: All of these, such as earrings,

original: de thams cad rus pa kho na'i ste //
analyzed: de thams cad rus pa kho na'i ste //
translated: are made of bone.

original: rus pa yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las bdag med ma'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyan thams cad rnal 'byor pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rus pa yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las bdag med ma'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhes pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyan thams cad rnal 'byor pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: And the bone is of the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhatu, and is of the nature of Nairatmya alone. Thus, the yogin should take up all the ornaments of the nature of wisdom and means.

original: yang na bsgom pa pos de kho na dang ldan pas lha'i rna rgyan /
analyzed: yang na bsgom pa pos de kho na dang ldan pas lha'i rna rgyan /
translated: Or else, the meditator, endowed with reality, should take up the earrings of the deity.

original: rna cha'i bdag nyid 'od dpag med //
analyzed: rna cha'i bdag nyid 'od dpag med //
translated: The nature of the earrings is Amitabha.

original: ces pa'i gsung las lha'i rna rgyan de yang 'od dpag med de /
analyzed: ces pa'i gsung las lha'i rna rgyan de yang 'od dpag med de /
translated: And that earring of the deity is Amitabha.

original: de yang lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: And that is the nature of all deities.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: @115a * // a'a li dang k'a li gnyis kyis n'a da gnyis las rdzogs pa'i phyir rna bdag la'o //
analyzed: @115a * // a'a li dang k'a li gnyis kyis n'a da gnyis las rdzogs pa'i phyir rna bdag la'o //
translated: In the ears of the meditator, because the two nada syllables are completed from the two ali and kali.

original: de gnyis kyi phyir de rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing tha dad med par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa gzung ba zhes pa gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyir de rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing tha dad med par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa gzung ba zhes pa gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: For those two reasons, because it holds in the manner of various aspects and makes them non-different, it is the apprehended aspect, which is the nature of the vajra of speech, the enjoyment body.

original: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin //
analyzed: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin //
translated: The wheel is held in the head.

original: zhes pa / dkyil 'khor ba'i bdag po nyid kyis 'khor lo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa / dkyil 'khor ba'i bdag po nyid kyis 'khor lo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The lord of the maṇḍala himself is Akṣobhya, the wheel.

original: de yang / spyi bor te /
analyzed: de yang / spyi bor te /
translated: And that is in the head.

original: bde chen kam la gnas pa gang /
analyzed: bde chen kam la gnas pa gang /
translated: That which abides in the kamala of great bliss.

original: zhes pa'i gsungs las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsungs las so //
translated: That is stated.

original: rnam par 'dzin zhes pa 'khor lo mi bskyod pa de nyid rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing gzung par bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa dbyer med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'dzin zhes pa 'khor lo mi bskyod pa de nyid rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing gzung par bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa dbyer med par byed pa'o //
translated: The wheel is held in the manner of various aspects, and it makes the apprehended and the non-apprehended indivisible.

original: de ni bya ba'i tshul nyid kyis gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bya ba'i tshul nyid kyis gzung bar bya ste /
translated: That is to be apprehended by the manner of action.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: A is Nairātmya.

original: bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa nyid mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa nyid mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Inseparable from Nairātmya, he is Akṣobhya, the nature of mind-vajra, the dharmakāya.

original: lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
analyzed: lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
translated: On his hands are two bracelets.

original: zhes pa / lnga'i bdag nyid gnyis kyis dbang po dang yul gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa / lnga'i bdag nyid gnyis kyis dbang po dang yul gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The two of the nature of the five are the nature of the sense faculties and their objects.

original: lag gdub kyi sgras rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: lag gdub kyi sgras rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The bracelet is Vairocana.

original: snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku /
analyzed: snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku /
translated: The nature of light is the nature of the body-vajra, the nirmāṇakāya.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa'i gsung las so //
translated: From the speech of Vairocana.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rig pa dang snang ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rig pa dang snang ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: The nature of knowledge and means is said to be the nature of the clear light of awareness.

original: sku gsum gyi ngo bo kho na'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi ngo bo kho na'o //
translated: It is the nature of the three bodies alone.

original: rnal 'byor pa rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni de ltar rgyan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni de ltar rgyan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogin adorned with ornaments becomes like that.

original: 'di rnams nyid shes rab dang thabs dbyer med par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid shes rab dang thabs dbyer med par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to make the nature of wisdom and means inseparable, it is said:

original: rked pa la yang ska rags nyid //
analyzed: rked pa la yang ska rags nyid //
translated: On his waist is a belt.

original: ces pa / kam bde ba chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa / kam bde ba chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Kaṃ is the characteristic of the bliss of attachment.

original: de las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir ka ti bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir ka ti bdag med ma'o //
translated: Since it goes beyond that, it is Kati Nairatma.

original: de la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin las rten dang brten pa nyid kyis ska rags don yod grub pa sku rdo rje ste /🔽skar gsal ni don yod gnas //
analyzed: de la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin las rten dang brten pa nyid kyis ska rags don yod grub pa sku rdo rje ste / skar gsal ni don yod gnas //
translated: In that, the nature of the pervaded and the pervader is the belt of Amoghasiddhi, the vajra body.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las /
translated: The statement the belt is Amoghasiddhi is from the Tantra of the Dialogue with Subahu.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid sku rdo rje zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid sku rdo rje zhes pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of the relative and the ultimate is the vajra body.

original: rkang pa dag la rkang gdub ste /
analyzed: rkang pa dag la rkang gdub ste /
translated: The anklets are on the feet.

original: zhes pa rkang pa dag la ye shes gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid rkang gdub ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rkang pa dag la ye shes gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid rkang gdub ste /
translated: The indivisibility of the two pristine consciousnesses is the anklets.

original: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so //
translated: The two garlands of a and ka are the two anklets.

original: de bzhin du gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid du gsung rdo rje zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid du gsung rdo rje zhes pa'o //
translated: In that way, the indivisibility of the two is the vajra speech.

original: dpung pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan dang // zhes pa /
analyzed: dpung pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan dang // zhes pa /
translated: The bracelets are on the arms.

original: ba byang chub kyi @115b sems so //
analyzed: ba byang chub kyi @115b sems so //
translated: The ba is bodhicitta.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: The a is Nairatma.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid byang chub kyi sems yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid byang chub kyi sems yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the essence of that is bodhicitta,

original: ha rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: ha rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: the ha is Vajradhara.

original: de yang / au rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: de yang / au rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: The syllable u is the dakini Vajravarahi.

original: des brgyan pa'i phyir hu rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin nyid byang chub kyi sems zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des brgyan pa'i phyir hu rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin nyid byang chub kyi sems zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable hu is the nature of Vajradhara, which is the bodhicitta.

original: b'a hu'i sgras de gnyis ka dbyer med pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can ging yin pa'o //
analyzed: b'a hu'i sgras de gnyis ka dbyer med pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can ging yin pa'o //
translated: The syllable va is the indivisibility of those two, which is the nature of the two.

original: de nyid rtsa ba ste dang po dang gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtsa ba ste dang po dang gtso bo'o //
translated: That is the root, which is the first and the principal.

original: de las 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes te /🔽au yig gis /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes te / au yig gis /
translated: The wisdom that arises from that is the nature of the five elements.

original: sa ni pukka s'i ru brjod //🔽ces pa'i gsung las pukka s'i'o //
analyzed: sa ni pukka s'i ru brjod // ces pa'i gsung las pukka s'i'o //
translated: The syllable u is the element of earth.

original: ka chu'i khams so //
analyzed: ka chu'i khams so //
translated: The syllable ka is the element of water.

original: ra me'i khams so //
analyzed: ra me'i khams so //
translated: The syllable ra is the element of fire.

original: ya rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: ya rlung gi khams so //
translated: The syllable ya is the element of wind.

original: ae chos 'byung nam mkha'i khams so zhes pa dpung rgyan 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: ae chos 'byung nam mkha'i khams so zhes pa dpung rgyan 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The syllable e is the element of space, the source of phenomena.

original: dang yig las gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid thugs rdo rje zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dang yig las gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid thugs rdo rje zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllable dang is the indivisibility of those two, which is the mind vajra.

original: mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The syllable ka is the garland of bones.🔽 The syllable ma is the garland of dry skulls.🔽 The syllable ni is the garland of fresh skulls.🔽 The syllable pa is the garland of heads.

original: zhes pa / mgrin pa'i sgras mgrin pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo nyid kyis /
analyzed: zhes pa / mgrin pa'i sgras mgrin pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo nyid kyis /
translated: By the word throat, the throat wheel of enjoyment itself,

original: de yang / 'dab ma bcu drug las stong pa nyid bcu drug go //
analyzed: de yang / 'dab ma bcu drug las stong pa nyid bcu drug go //
translated: and from that, the sixteen emptinesses from the sixteen petals.

original: de las rten dang brten pa'i dngos po khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa nyid kyis mi'i rus pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
analyzed: de las rten dang brten pa'i dngos po khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa nyid kyis mi'i rus pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
translated: From that, the dakinis from the human bone, the nature of the dhatu, by the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de rnams kyi phreng ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi phreng ba ste /
translated: That is the garland.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis 'di rnams spro ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis 'di rnams spro ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: By the nature of the five exalted wisdoms such as mirror-like exalted wisdom, this is the nature of the emanation.

original: dang po dang mthar na rgyan dang mgul rgyan /
analyzed: dang po dang mthar na rgyan dang mgul rgyan /
translated: At the beginning and end, the ornaments and necklace.

original: 'od dpag med dang rin chen dbang po dang / khu ba dang khrag gi ngo bo bskyed pa dang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: 'od dpag med dang rin chen dbang po dang / khu ba dang khrag gi ngo bo bskyed pa dang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: Amitabha and Ratnasambhava, the nature of semen and blood, the nature of creation and destruction,

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin dag las 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin rin chen dbang po ste /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin dag las 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin rin chen dbang po ste /
translated: from the nature of the moon and sun, this nature of Ratnasambhava.

original: mgul ba'i phreng ba rin chen dbang ;
analyzed: mgul ba'i phreng ba rin chen dbang ;
translated: The necklace is Ratnasambhava.

original: / zhes pa'i gsung las /
analyzed: / zhes pa'i gsung las /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement:

original: a'a li k'a li n'a da dbyer med pa dag las rdo rje gsum dang / ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin de kho na gnyis su med pa ni de kho na dang ldan pa'i rgyan no zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li n'a da dbyer med pa dag las rdo rje gsum dang / ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin de kho na gnyis su med pa ni de kho na dang ldan pa'i rgyan no zhes gsungs pa'i don to //
translated: From the indivisible A and Kali, the three vajras and the nature of the fourfold, innate identity of the five intuitions, is the ornament of reality.

original: gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: de'i bgo ba stag gi pags pa dang / de'i bza' ba mi 'chi bcu phyed do zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i bgo ba stag gi pags pa dang / de'i bza' ba mi 'chi bcu phyed do zhes pa /
translated: His garment is the tiger skin, and his food is half of a human corpse.

original: bdud rtsi lnga ni ji ltar 'o ma la sogs pa bdud rtsi ba zhin du bza' bar bya ba de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga ni ji ltar 'o ma la sogs pa bdud rtsi ba zhin du bza' bar bya ba de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Just as the five nectars are to be eaten like milk, etc., so are Vairochana, etc.

original: yang na / thams cad nas kun tu bsgrubs pa ni bgo ba ste /
analyzed: yang na / thams cad nas kun tu bsgrubs pa ni bgo ba ste /
translated: Or, the garment is the accomplishment of everything in every way.

original: de gang zhe na /🔽stag gi @116a * //
analyzed: de gang zhe na / stag gi @116a * //
translated: What is that?

original: pags pa zhes pa gzugs sna tshogs pa spro ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: pags pa zhes pa gzugs sna tshogs pa spro ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The tiger skin is the identity of the emission of various forms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bza' ba thim pa mi 'chi bcu phyed ces pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes bdud rtsi'i ngo bo zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa sku rdo rje rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bza' ba thim pa mi 'chi bcu phyed ces pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes bdud rtsi'i ngo bo zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa sku rdo rje rdo rje rigs kyi le'ur mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement “the dissolution of food is half of immortality” is that the nature of the five transcendent lords’ pristine awareness elixir is the indivisible three vajras, which is the extensive explanation of the brief presentation in the Vajra Body chapter of the Vajra Family.

original: // 'dir he ru ka sbyor skyes bu ni he ru ka'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: // 'dir he ru ka sbyor skyes bu ni he ru ka'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: Here, the “union-born hero” is a yogin endowed with the yoga of Heruka.

original: rigs lnga la ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rigs lnga la ni rnam par gnas //
translated: He is in the five families.

original: bram ze dang ni rgyal rigs dang // rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs dang // mthar skyes de lnga rnams la'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang ni rgyal rigs dang // rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs dang // mthar skyes de lnga rnams la'o //
translated: The five are the brahmin, the kṣatriya, the vaiśya, the śūdra, and the outcaste.

original: yang na / gang rdo rje'i rigs dang / padma'i rigs dang / las kyi rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams la'o //
analyzed: yang na / gang rdo rje'i rigs dang / padma'i rigs dang / las kyi rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams la'o //
translated: Or, they are the vajra family, the lotus family, the action family, and the transcendent family.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽rigs lnga dag dang mnyam ldan pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / rigs lnga dag dang mnyam ldan pa //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽He is endowed with the five families.

original: rigs gcig tu ni rnam par brtags //
analyzed: rigs gcig tu ni rnam par brtags //
translated: He is imagined in one family.

original: rigs lnga rnams 'dres par gyur pa gang yin pa de rigs gcig ste /
analyzed: rigs lnga rnams 'dres par gyur pa gang yin pa de rigs gcig ste /
translated: That which is the merging of the five clans is one clan.

original: rigs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: rigs gcig kho na'o //
translated: It is just one clan.

original: de yang / slar brtags zhes pa gcig nyid brtags pa'i dbang las zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang / slar brtags zhes pa gcig nyid brtags pa'i dbang las zhes pa'o //
translated: And that is also “reexamined” by the power of examining the one.

original: 'di ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rigs gcig dang ni du ma yis //
analyzed: rigs gcig dang ni du ma yis //
translated: Because of the one clan and the many,

original: ging phyir g-yo ba mtshon mi bya //
analyzed: ging phyir g-yo ba mtshon mi bya //
translated: the movement is not indicated.

original: gcig gis kyang rgyu gang gi phyir dbye ba tha dad pa mtshon mi bya /
analyzed: gcig gis kyang rgyu gang gi phyir dbye ba tha dad pa mtshon mi bya /
translated: By the one, the cause by which the division is indicated is not made,

original: rtogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs par mi bya'o //
translated: is not understood.

original: yang na / he ru ka sbyor zhes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi skyes bu de kho na'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par gnas pa spro ba'o //
analyzed: yang na / he ru ka sbyor zhes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi skyes bu de kho na'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par gnas pa spro ba'o //
translated: Or else, “the union of Heruka” is the yoga of that very person whose nature is nonconceptual intuition, the manifestation of the abiding.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: rigs lnga la ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga rnams la'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga la ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga rnams la'o //
translated: In the five clans, in the five intuitions such as the mirror intuition.

original: gang las she na /🔽rigs lnga dag dang mnyam ldan pa //
analyzed: gang las she na / rigs lnga dag dang mnyam ldan pa //
translated: From what?🔽The five clans are endowed with the five intuitions.

original: ye shes lnga po rnams la mnyam pa'i ngo bos zhugs pa de nyid /
analyzed: ye shes lnga po rnams la mnyam pa'i ngo bos zhugs pa de nyid /
translated: The one who has entered into the five intuitions by the nature of equality,

original: rigs gcig gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid de /
analyzed: rigs gcig gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid de /
translated: That very wisdom, which is not divided into two or more kinds,

original: de yang brtags pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang brtags pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: is also ascertained as the investigation.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽gang phyir du ma yis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid spro ba dang / rigs gcig gi don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid sdud par dbye ba tha dad pa'i bya ba mtshon mi bya /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / gang phyir du ma yis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid spro ba dang / rigs gcig gi don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid sdud par dbye ba tha dad pa'i bya ba mtshon mi bya /
translated: How is that?🔽Because of the many, the nature of the relative truth is expanded, and the nature of the ultimate truth, which is of one kind, is contracted.

original: rtogs par mi bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par mi bya zhes pa'o //
translated: The different activities of the divisions are not to be illustrated or realized.

original: yang na / yi ge lnga zhes pa ka kha ga gha nga /
analyzed: yang na / yi ge lnga zhes pa ka kha ga gha nga /
translated: Or else, the five syllables are ka, kha, ga, gha, and ṅa.

original: yi ge lnga po rnams la rnam par gnas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge lnga po rnams la rnam par gnas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: The five syllables are located in the various aspects.

original: ci ltar zhe na yi ge mnyam par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na yi ge mnyam par ldan pa'o //
translated: How is that? The syllables are in union.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ni means “because.”

original: @116b phan tshun yi ge lnga rnams kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa yi ge gcig tu brtags pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid kyis gang nges pa de nyid ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: @116b phan tshun yi ge lnga rnams kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa yi ge gcig tu brtags pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid kyis gang nges pa de nyid ye shes lnga'o //
translated: The five syllables that are mutually included are ascertained as the single syllable, which is the five tathāgatas, Vairocana, and so on.

original: gang gi he ru ka sbyor gyis //
analyzed: gang gi he ru ka sbyor gyis //
translated: By whose union with Heruka,

original: he ru ka sbyor ba de ni he ru ka sbyor te //
analyzed: he ru ka sbyor ba de ni he ru ka sbyor te //
translated: that union with Heruka is the union with Heruka.

original: de ni skyes bu rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: That is the yogi of the person.

original: 'di ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yi ge gcig dang dum yis /
analyzed: yi ge gcig dang dum yis /
translated: By one syllable and by many syllables,

original: yi ge gcig gis kyang gang gi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gis kyang gang gi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa /
translated: by one syllable also, for what reason, the various divisions of Vairochana and so forth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbye ba sna tshogs brtag par mi bya zhing yi ge du ma nyid kyis kyang gang gi phyir dbye ba mtshon par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbye ba sna tshogs brtag par mi bya zhing yi ge du ma nyid kyis kyang gang gi phyir dbye ba mtshon par mi bya ste /
translated: the Tathagatas should not be imagined, and by many syllables also, for what reason, the divisions should not be indicated.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad dang tha dad med pa dag khyad par med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad dang tha dad med pa dag khyad par med pa nyid do //
translated: Because of the absence of difference between difference and non-difference.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas gang du gnas par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas gang du gnas par bya zhe na /
translated: In that case, where should the yogi who has become like that dwell?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽shing gcig gam ni dur khrod dang // ma mo'i khyim dang bzhi mdo dang // yang na mtshan mo phyed dang ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / shing gcig gam ni dur khrod dang // ma mo'i khyim dang bzhi mdo dang // yang na mtshan mo phyed dang ni //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽At a solitary tree, or in a charnel ground,🔽or in a house of a mother goddess, or at a crossroads,🔽or at midnight,

original: dben pa dang ni bas mtha' ru //
analyzed: dben pa dang ni bas mtha' ru //
translated: in a secluded place, or in the outskirts.

original: sgom pa bzang bar brjod par bya //
analyzed: sgom pa bzang bar brjod par bya //
translated: One should speak of the good meditation.🔽The tree is the tree in the shade of which no other tree grows.

original: shing gcig ces pa gang la shing gzhan gyi grib ma mi 'byung ba'i shing de ni gdon mi za bar gnod sbyin lhag par gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de lhag par gnas pa'i gnas su gal te dogs pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: shing gcig ces pa gang la shing gzhan gyi grib ma mi 'byung ba'i shing de ni gdon mi za bar gnod sbyin lhag par gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de lhag par gnas pa'i gnas su gal te dogs pa med par gyur na /
translated: In the abode of the Yakshas, if one is without fear,

original: de'i tshe / de'i de kho na'i spyod pa dang de'i 'bras bu yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe / de'i de kho na'i spyod pa dang de'i 'bras bu yang 'byung ngo //
translated: then the practice of reality and its result will occur.

original: dur khrod ces pa dur khrod kyis gzhir yang /
analyzed: dur khrod ces pa dur khrod kyis gzhir yang /
translated: The charnel ground is the place where the charnel ground is.

original: yi dags lhag par gnas te /
analyzed: yi dags lhag par gnas te /
translated: The ghosts dwell there.

original: der yang 'dir dogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: der yang 'dir dogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: And there also, one is without fear.🔽The house of the Mothers is the house of Chandika and the other fierce goddesses.🔽The crossroads is where four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.

original: ma mo'i khyim zhes pa tsandi ka la sogs pa rab gtum gyi lha lhag par gnas par de 'jigs pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: ma mo'i khyim zhes pa tsandi ka la sogs pa rab gtum gyi lha lhag par gnas par de 'jigs pa med pa'o ;
translated: The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The crossroads is where the four roads meet.

original: / bzhi mdo zhes pa gang du lam bzhi gcig pa nyid de der yang lha 'du ba'i phyir ro //🔽dar ni brtson 'grus dman pas gnas par mi nus so //
analyzed: / bzhi mdo zhes pa gang du lam bzhi gcig pa nyid de der yang lha 'du ba'i phyir ro //🔽dar ni brtson 'grus dman pas gnas par mi nus so //
translated: The crossroads is where the four roads meet.🔽The

original: mtshan mo byed ces pa skye bo thams cad gnyid du song ba'i mtshan mo skad cig de la lha ma yin rnams gnas te /
analyzed: mtshan mo byed ces pa skye bo thams cad gnyid du song ba'i mtshan mo skad cig de la lha ma yin rnams gnas te /
translated: The night is the time when all people have gone to sleep. At that very moment, the demigods are active.

original: de la yang de dgos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang de dgos pa med pa'o //
translated: And that is useless.

original: dben pa zhes pa ri'i phug la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dben pa zhes pa ri'i phug la sogs pa ste /
translated: The solitary place is a mountain cave, and so on.

original: lha ma yin la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the demigods, and so on, live there.

original: der yang / 'jigs pa las nges par grol bas gnas par bya'o //🔽bas mtha' zhes pa gzhan pa'i phyogs tha dad pa ches thag ring brgya mtsho'i @117a * //
analyzed: der yang / 'jigs pa las nges par grol bas gnas par bya'o // bas mtha' zhes pa gzhan pa'i phyogs tha dad pa ches thag ring brgya mtsho'i @117a * //
translated: And there, too, one should live free from fear.

original: nang du gnas pa'i gling la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nang du gnas pa'i gling la sogs pa ste /
translated: The wilderness is a different place, very far away, an island in the ocean, and so on.

original: der yang klu lhag par gnas pa nyid kyis 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid do //
analyzed: der yang klu lhag par gnas pa nyid kyis 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid do //
translated: And there, too, because of the special presence of the nagas, it is a fearful place.

original: der yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: der yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: And there, too, one should be free from conceptualization.

original: cung zad drod ni thob pa na //🔽gal te spyod pa byed 'dod pa //
analyzed: cung zad drod ni thob pa na // gal te spyod pa byed 'dod pa //
translated: When one has attained a little warmth,🔽if one wishes to practice the conduct,🔽if one wishes to practice the conduct in this way,

original: zhes pa gal te 'di lta bu'i spyod pa bya ba'i sgo yis byed 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes pa gal te 'di lta bu'i spyod pa bya ba'i sgo yis byed 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: then,

original: cung zad drod ni thob pa na bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad drod ni thob pa na bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: One should do it when one has attained a little heat.

original: cung zad drod kyi sgras de kho na las lta stangs bzhi grub pa na'o //
analyzed: cung zad drod kyi sgras de kho na las lta stangs bzhi grub pa na'o //
translated: By the words “a little heat” is meant the accomplishment of the four modes of vision from thatness.

original: des dman pa dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des dman pa dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not that one should fear being inferior to that.

original: gal te 'di lta bu'i spyod pa bya dka' bde ci'i don du byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'di lta bu'i spyod pa bya dka' bde ci'i don du byed ce na /
translated: If one asks, “For what purpose should one perform such difficult conduct?”

original: gsungs pa / gal te 'grub 'gyur 'dod yod pa /
analyzed: gsungs pa / gal te 'grub 'gyur 'dod yod pa /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares,

original: 'dis ni spyod pa spyad par bya //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa spyad par bya //
translated: one should perform the conduct if one has a desire for accomplishment.

original: gal te phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub pa dang thob par 'gyur ba'i 'dod pa yod pa gang gi phyir ni'i sgra de'i don zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: gal te phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub pa dang thob par 'gyur ba'i 'dod pa yod pa gang gi phyir ni'i sgra de'i don zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The word “if” means “for the sake of.”

original: 'dis ni spyod pa'i gnas pa 'dis gnas par bya zhing spyad par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa'i gnas pa 'dis gnas par bya zhing spyad par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: By this [he means] “one should perform the conduct by abiding in this abiding of the conduct.”

original: yang na / shing gcig ces pa shing lta bur spro ba'i tshul gyis yal ga dang nye ba'i yal ga'i bdag nyid can gyi shing ste /
analyzed: yang na / shing gcig ces pa shing lta bur spro ba'i tshul gyis yal ga dang nye ba'i yal ga'i bdag nyid can gyi shing ste /
translated: Or, “one tree” is a tree that has the nature of branches and sub-branches in the manner of spreading out like a tree.

original: gcig ni lhan cig med pa sku rdo rje zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni lhan cig med pa sku rdo rje zhes pa'o //
translated: “One” is the non-coexistent, the vajra body.

original: dur khrod ces pa chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gsung rdo rje'o ;
analyzed: dur khrod ces pa chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gsung rdo rje'o ;
translated: The charnel ground is the abode of the realm of reality, the nature of the two garlands of nāḍīs, the vajra of speech.

original: / ma mo'i khyim zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
analyzed: / ma mo'i khyim zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
translated: The house of the mātṛkās is the ḍākinīs.

original: nye bar mtshon pa nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ste /
translated: The tathāgatas are in the very illustration,

original: de dang tha dang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha dang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from that.

original: de rnams kyi khyim ni gnas thugs rdo rje ste der ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khyim ni gnas thugs rdo rje ste der ro //
translated: Their house is the abode of the vajra of mind.

original: bzhi mdo zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ste der ro //
analyzed: bzhi mdo zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ste der ro //
translated: The crossroads is Vajradhara, the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: mtshan mo phyed ces pa /
analyzed: mtshan mo phyed ces pa /
translated: Midnight is

original: mtshan mo las phyed gang gis mtshan mo dang tha dad du bya ba de ni nyin mo ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo las phyed gang gis mtshan mo dang tha dad du bya ba de ni nyin mo ste /
translated: the time of midnight, which is different from night.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin /
translated: Night and day are the nature of wisdom and method,

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid can ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid can ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la ste /
translated: in the maṇḍala of gnosis, which has the nature of the maṇḍala of the pledge.

original: mtshan mo phyed ces pa'i don ni 'di nyid mngon par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo phyed ces pa'i don ni 'di nyid mngon par gsal bar byed do //
translated: The meaning of “midnight” is clarified by this.

original: dben pa dang ni bas mtha' ru //
analyzed: dben pa dang ni bas mtha' ru //
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,

original: zhes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skye bo gang du me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skye bo gang du me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,

original: bas mtha' zhes pa spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa ste der ro //
analyzed: bas mtha' zhes pa spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa ste der ro //
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,

original: gnyis ka la yang gnyis ka yod pa'i phyir shing @117b gcig gis sku rdo rje mngon par gsal ba'i phyir rdo rje rigs kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang gnyis ka yod pa'i phyir shing @117b gcig gis sku rdo rje mngon par gsal ba'i phyir rdo rje rigs kyi le'u'o //
translated: In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,

original: dur khrod kyis kyang gsung rdo rje mngon par gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dur khrod kyis kyang gsung rdo rje mngon par gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,

original: sngags kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi le'u'o //
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,

original: ma mo'i khyim gyis thugs rdo rje gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma mo'i khyim gyis thugs rdo rje gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,

original: lha'i le'u'o // bzhi mdo yis rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: lha'i le'u'o // bzhi mdo yis rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,

original: spyi bor rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: spyi bor rigs kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //
translated: In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits,🔽In a forest, in a solitary place, in a forest,🔽In a temple, in a mountain cave,🔽In a charnel ground, in a house of spirits

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pas mtshan phyed ces pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med pas mtshan phyed ces pa ste /
translated: The “midnight” is the indivisibility of the mandala of pristine consciousness and the mandala of commitment.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor gnyis ka'i bdag nyid spro ba dang sdud pa'i ngo bos dkyil 'khor gnyis ka yang ngo zhes pa /
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor gnyis ka'i bdag nyid spro ba dang sdud pa'i ngo bos dkyil 'khor gnyis ka yang ngo zhes pa /
translated: That is the nature of both mandalas, with the essence of emanation and gathering, and both mandalas are “indeed.”

original: de kho na'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i le'u'o //
translated: This is the chapter on reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na'i rnal 'byor pa spyod pa byed nus pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na'i rnal 'byor pa spyod pa byed nus pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, the yogi/nī of reality is able to perform the conduct.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa 'dis bya ba'i sgo yis spyod pa byed 'dod pa de ni cung zad drod thob par gyur pa na zhes pa lta stangs bzhi la sogs pa nus pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa 'dis bya ba'i sgo yis spyod pa byed 'dod pa de ni cung zad drod thob par gyur pa na zhes pa lta stangs bzhi la sogs pa nus pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, when this yogi/nī, who wishes to perform the conduct through the door of action, obtains a little heat, then, because of possessing various abilities, such as the four gazes,

original: de tshe spyod pa bya bar 'dod pas de dang sbyar ba nyid do //
analyzed: de tshe spyod pa bya bar 'dod pas de dang sbyar ba nyid do //
translated: at that time, the one who wishes to perform the conduct should apply it.

original: spyod pa nyid kyi don ci zhe na /
analyzed: spyod pa nyid kyi don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “conduct”?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / 'grub 'gyur gal te 'di phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'grub 'gyur gal te 'di phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If one wishes to attain the mahāmudrā siddhi,

original: 'dis ni spyod pa spyad par bya zhing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa spyad par bya zhing gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should practice and abide in this conduct.

original: 'di ni de'i kun du bzang po'i spyod pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i kun du bzang po'i spyod pa zhes brjod de /
translated: This is called his “universally good conduct.”🔽Without this, there is no authentic spiritual attainment.

original: 'di dang bral bas yang dag pa'i dngos grub ma yin no zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa gsung rdo rje sngags kyi le'ur mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang bral bas yang dag pa'i dngos grub ma yin no zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa gsung rdo rje sngags kyi le'ur mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the concise explanation of the chapter on the vajra speech mantra of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: 'dis ni spyod pa zhes pa gang gsungs pa de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa zhes pa gang gsungs pa de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, it is said that what is called “conduct” has this meaning.

original: 'dis ni zhes gsungs pa dang / gsung bar 'gyur ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes gsungs pa dang / gsung bar 'gyur ba yang ngo //
translated: “By this” refers to what has been said and what will be said.

original: rigs lnga la sogs pa tha dad med par rtogs pa las shing gcig la sogs pa rnams su gnas bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs lnga la sogs pa tha dad med par rtogs pa las shing gcig la sogs pa rnams su gnas bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the realization of the absence of distinctions among the five buddha families and so forth, one becomes able to abide in the conduct of the single deity and so forth.

original: de las kyang drod thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las kyang drod thob par 'gyur te /
translated: From that, one attains warmth.

original: de las kyang kun du bzang po'i spyod pa bzod cing de las dngos grub kyi ched du dogs pa med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang kun du bzang po'i spyod pa bzod cing de las dngos grub kyi ched du dogs pa med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, one becomes able to endure the universally good conduct, and from that, fearlessness for the sake of spiritual attainment arises.

original: dngos grub kyang phyag rgya chen po'i sngon du 'gro ba nyid de /
analyzed: dngos grub kyang phyag rgya chen po'i sngon du 'gro ba nyid de /
translated: And also, the power is the preliminary to the Great Seal.

original: bden pa gnyis ka'i khyad par can phyag rgya rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ka'i khyad par can phyag rgya rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One attains the seal which is distinguished by the two truths.

original: de blangs te de dang lhan cig spyod pa bya ba ste /
analyzed: de blangs te de dang lhan cig spyod pa bya ba ste /
translated: Having taken that, one should practice with her.

original: shin tu bzhin bzangs mig yangs ma //
analyzed: shin tu bzhin bzangs mig yangs ma //
translated: She is very beautiful, with large eyes,

original: rang gis dbang bskur snying rje can //
analyzed: rang gis dbang bskur snying rje can //
translated: self-consecrated, compassionate,

original: rdo rje'i bu mo 'di khyer nas //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bu mo 'di khyer nas //
translated: and one should take this vajra girl

original: spyod pa bya bar @118a * //🔽rtogs par bya //
analyzed: spyod pa bya bar @118a * // rtogs par bya //
translated: and practice with her.

original: rang gis dbang bskur zhes pa rang gis dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i bya ba dang / chu la sogs pa'i cho gas dbang bskur ba shin tu rnam par dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis dbang bskur zhes pa rang gis dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i bya ba dang / chu la sogs pa'i cho gas dbang bskur ba shin tu rnam par dag par byas pa'o //
translated: The self-consecrated means that one should perform the ritual of the mandala, etc. , and should perform the consecration with the ritual of the water, etc. , in a very pure way.

original: yang na nus pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nus pa'o //
translated: Or else, it means ability.

original: snying rje can zhes pa gzhan gyi don la nye bar sbyor ba ste /🔽snying rje med na mi 'grub pas //
analyzed: snying rje can zhes pa gzhan gyi don la nye bar sbyor ba ste / snying rje med na mi 'grub pas //
translated: The compassionate means applying oneself to the welfare of others.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las so //🔽rdo rje'i bu mo zhes pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las so // rdo rje'i bu mo zhes pa /
translated: Since one does not succeed without compassion, it is as stated in the line without compassion, one does not succeed.

original: rdo rje'i rigs lo bcu drug ma ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs lo bcu drug ma ste /
translated: The vajra girl means a girl of the vajra clan, sixteen years old.

original: 'di lta bu 'di khyer zhing gzung nas spyod pa byas te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di khyer zhing gzung nas spyod pa byas te /
translated: Having taken up and held this, one should practice it.

original: mchog gi spyod pa bya'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog gi spyod pa bya'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one should practice the supreme practice.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyi dngos med na //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyi dngos med na //
translated: In the absence of the vajra family,

original: rang 'dod lha yi rigs kyis bya //
analyzed: rang 'dod lha yi rigs kyis bya //
translated: one should practice with the family of one’s chosen deity.

original: rang 'dod lha zhes pa rang gi 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i lha de'i rigs kyis te /
analyzed: rang 'dod lha zhes pa rang gi 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i lha de'i rigs kyis te /
translated: One’s chosen deity means the family of that deity who is desired and wished for.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang dkar po che //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang dkar po che //
translated: The yogin who is white

original: de yi lha ni rnam snang mdzad //
analyzed: de yi lha ni rnam snang mdzad //
translated: has Vairocana as his deity.

original: ces pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs de yis kyang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs de yis kyang zhes pa'o //
translated: And so on, means that one should practice with the family that will be explained.

original: gal te de yang ma rnyed na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de yang ma rnyed na de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not find that, then at that time

original: yang na zhes pa phyogs gzhan te gzhan gyi rigs byung ba tha dad pa'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa phyogs gzhan te gzhan gyi rigs byung ba tha dad pa'i rigs rnams so //
translated: one should practice with another family, a different family, a different type.

original: byang chub sa bon btab pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub sa bon btab pa yis //
translated: Having planted the seed of enlightenment,🔽one should practice with the family that arises.

original: yang dag sbyangs pa zhes pa byang chub ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag sbyangs pa zhes pa byang chub ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Enlightenment is nonconceptual intuition.

original: de'i sa bon ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu las te /
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu las te /
translated: Its seed is from the cause of perfect enlightenment.

original: de btab cing bskyod pas 'dus byas pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de btab cing bskyod pas 'dus byas pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Having planted that, by moving it, the very pure compounded nature is the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: de gzung zhing blangs nas spyod pa bya bar rtogs par zhes pa slar bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de gzung zhing blangs nas spyod pa bya bar rtogs par zhes pa slar bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having seized and taken that, one should understand that one should practice, and repeat it.🔽Or,

original: yang na / bzhin bzangs zhes pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na / bzhin bzangs zhes pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to say “beautiful one,”

original: de zhal te a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de zhal te a'a li k'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis so //
translated: that face, that is, the two garlands of vowels and consonants.

original: bzang ba ni yid 'phrog pa ste /
analyzed: bzang ba ni yid 'phrog pa ste /
translated: Beautiful is captivating.

original: gang gi bzhin bzang ba de gsung rdo rje yin zhing de'o //🔽mig yangs ma zhes pa gang gi yangs pa rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi bzhin bzang ba de gsung rdo rje yin zhing de'o // mig yangs ma zhes pa gang gi yangs pa rgyas pa ste /
translated: Whose face is beautiful, that is, the speech vajra, is that.🔽The one with wide eyes,

original: khams gsum pa khyab pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa khyab pa'o //
translated: whose eyes are wide open, that is, pervading the three realms.

original: de'i mig ni mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i mig ni mthong ba ste /
translated: Her eyes are seeing,

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of wisdom and method.

original: mig yangs ma thugs rdo rje ste de'o //
analyzed: mig yangs ma thugs rdo rje ste de'o //
translated: The one with wide eyes is the mind vajra, that is, that.

original: rang gis dbang bskur /
analyzed: rang gis dbang bskur /
translated: One should consecrate oneself.

original: dbang bskur pa'i mthar thug pas gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: dbang bskur pa'i mthar thug pas gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa na /
translated: At the conclusion of the consecration, when the image is complete,

original: de ni sku rdo rje'i //
analyzed: de ni sku rdo rje'i //
translated: that is the body vajra.

original: snying rje can zhes pa 'gro ba'i don bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje can zhes pa 'gro ba'i don bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The compassionate one is so called because of engaging in the benefit of beings.

original: de ni bden pa gnyis ka'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni bden pa gnyis ka'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the nature of the two truths.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje'i bu mo zhes pa mi phyed pa nyid las rdo rje dang 'od gsal ba nyid las bu mo @118b ste ;
